verses.sanskrit_deva: मा चि॑द॒न्यद्वि शं॑सत॒ सखा॑यो॒ मा रि॑षण्यत इन्द्र॒मित्स्तो॑ता॒ वृष॑णं॒ सचा॑ सु॒ते मुहु॑रु॒क्था च॑ शंसत
verses.transliteration: mā́ cid anyád ví śaṃsata  sákhāyo mā́ riṣaṇyata  índram ít stotā vŕ̥ṣaṇaṃ sácā suté  múhur ukthā́ ca śaṃsata

translation.text: GLORIFY naught besides, O friends; so shall no sorrow trouble you. Praise only mighty Indra when the juice is shed, and say your lauds repeatedly:

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒व॒क्र॒क्षिणं॑ वृष॒भं य॑था॒जुरं॒ गां न च॑र्षणी॒सह॑म् वि॒द्वेष॑णं सं॒वन॑नोभयंक॒रं मंहि॑ष्ठमुभया॒विन॑म्
verses.transliteration: avakrakṣíṇaṃ vr̥ṣabháṃ yathājúraṃ  gā́ṃ ná carṣaṇīsáham  vidvéṣaṇaṃ saṃvánanobhayaṃkarám  máṃhiṣṭham ubhayāvínam

translation.text: Even him, eternal, like a bull who rushes down, men's Conqueror, bounteous like a cow; Him who is cause of both, of enmity and peace, to both sides most munificent.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यच्चि॒द्धि त्वा॒ जना॑ इ॒मे नाना॒ हव॑न्त ऊ॒तये॑ अ॒स्माकं॒ ब्रह्मे॒दमि॑न्द्र भूतु॒ तेऽहा॒ विश्वा॑ च॒ वर्ध॑नम्
verses.transliteration: yác cid dhí tvā jánā imé  nā́nā hávanta ūtáye  asmā́kam bráhmedám indra bhūtu te-  -áhā víśvā ca várdhanam

translation.text: Although these men in sundry ways invoke thee to obtain thine aid, Be this our prayer, addressed, O Indra, unto thee, thine exaltation every day.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि त॑र्तूर्यन्ते मघवन्विप॒श्चितो॒ऽर्यो विपो॒ जना॑नाम् उप॑ क्रमस्व पुरु॒रूप॒मा भ॑र॒ वाजं॒ नेदि॑ष्ठमू॒तये॑
verses.transliteration: ví tartūryante maghavan vipaścíto  -aryó vípo jánānām  úpa kramasva pururū́pam ā́ bhara  vā́jaṃ nédiṣṭham ūtáye

translation.text: Those skilled in song, O Maghavan among these men o'ercome with might the foeman's songs. Come hither, bring us strength in many a varied form most near that it may succour us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒हे च॒न त्वाम॑द्रिवः॒ परा॑ शु॒ल्काय॑ देयाम् न स॒हस्रा॑य॒ नायुता॑य वज्रिवो॒ न श॒ताय॑ शतामघ
verses.transliteration: mahé caná tvā́m adrivaḥ  párā śulkā́ya deyām  ná sahásrāya nā́yútāya vajrivo  ná śatā́ya śatāmagha

translation.text: O Caster of the Stone, I would not sell thee for a mighty price, Not for a thousand, Thunderer! nor ten thousand, nor a hundred, Lord of countless wealth!

verses.sanskrit_deva: वस्याँ॑ इन्द्रासि मे पि॒तुरु॒त भ्रातु॒रभु॑ञ्जतः मा॒ता च॑ मे छदयथः स॒मा व॑सो वसुत्व॒नाय॒ राध॑से
verses.transliteration: vásyām̐ indrāsi me pitúr  utá bhrā́tur ábhuñjataḥ  mātā́ ca me chadayathaḥ samā́ vaso  vasutvanā́ya rā́dhase

translation.text: O Indra, thou art more to me than sire or niggard brother is. Thou and my mother, O Good Lord, appear alike, to give me wealth abundantly.

verses.sanskrit_deva: क्वे॑यथ॒ क्वेद॑सि पुरु॒त्रा चि॒द्धि ते॒ मनः॑ अल॑र्षि युध्म खजकृत्पुरंदर॒ प्र गा॑य॒त्रा अ॑गासिषुः
verses.transliteration: kvèyatha kvéd asi  purutrā́ cid dhí te mánaḥ  álarṣi yudhma khajakr̥t puraṃdara  prá gāyatrā́ agāsiṣuḥ

translation.text: Where art thou? Whither art thou gone? For many a place attracts thy mind. Haste, Warrior, Fort-destroyer, Lord of battle's din, haste, holy songs have sounded forth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रास्मै॑ गाय॒त्रम॑र्चत वा॒वातु॒र्यः पु॑रंद॒रः याभिः॑ का॒ण्वस्योप॑ ब॒र्हिरा॒सदं॒ यास॑द्व॒ज्री भि॒नत्पुरः॑
verses.transliteration: prā́smai gāyatrám arcata  vāvā́tur yáḥ puraṃdaráḥ  yā́bhiḥ kāṇvásyópa barhír āsádaṃ  yā́sad vajrī́ bhinát púraḥ

translation.text: Sing out the psalm to him who breaks down castles for his faithful friend, Verses to bring the Thunderer to destroy the forts and sit on Kaṇva's sacred grass.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ये ते॒ सन्ति॑ दश॒ग्विनः॑ श॒तिनो॒ ये स॑ह॒स्रिणः॑ अश्वा॑सो॒ ये ते॒ वृष॑णो रघु॒द्रुव॒स्तेभि॑र्न॒स्तूय॒मा ग॑हि
verses.transliteration: yé te sánti daśagvínaḥ  śatíno yé sahasríṇaḥ  áśvāso yé te vŕ̥ṣaṇo raghudrúvas  tébhir nas tū́yam ā́ gahi

translation.text: The Horses which are thine in tens, in hundreds, yea, in thousands thine, Even those vigorous Steeds, fleet-footed in the course, with those come quickly near to us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ त्व१॒॑द्य स॑ब॒र्दुघां॑ हु॒वे गा॑य॒त्रवे॑पसम् इन्द्रं॑ धे॒नुं सु॒दुघा॒मन्या॒मिष॑मु॒रुधा॑रामरं॒कृत॑म्
verses.transliteration: ā́ tv àdyá sabardúghāṃ  huvé gāyatrávepasam  índraṃ dhenúṃ sudúghām ányām íṣam  urúdhārām araṃkŕ̥tam

translation.text: This day I call Sabardugiha who animates the holy song, Indra the richly-yielding Milch-cow who provides unfailing food in ample stream.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यत्तु॒दत्सूर॒ एत॑शं व॒ङ्कू वात॑स्य प॒र्णिना॑ वह॒त्कुत्स॑मार्जुने॒यं श॒तक्र॑तुः॒ त्सर॑द्गन्ध॒र्वमस्तृ॑तम्
verses.transliteration: yát tudát sū́ra étaśaṃ  vaṅkū́ vā́tasya parṇínā  váhat kútsam ārjuneyáṃ śatákratuḥ  tsárad gandharvám ástr̥tam

translation.text: When Sura wounded Etaṣa, with Vâta's rolling winged car. Indra bore Kutsa Ârjuneya off, and mocked Gandharva. the unconquered One.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य ऋ॒ते चि॑दभि॒श्रिषः॑ पु॒रा ज॒त्रुभ्य॑ आ॒तृदः॑ संधा॑ता सं॒धिं म॒घवा॑ पुरू॒वसु॒रिष्क॑र्ता॒ विह्रु॑तं॒ पुनः॑
verses.transliteration: yá r̥té cid abhiśríṣaḥ  purā́ jatrúbhya ātŕ̥daḥ  sáṃdhātā saṃdhím maghávā purūvásur  íṣkartā víhrutam púnaḥ

translation.text: He without ligature, before making incision in the neck, Closed up the wound again, most wealthy Maghavan, who maketh whole the injured part.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा भू॑म॒ निष्ट्या॑ इ॒वेन्द्र॒ त्वदर॑णा इव वना॑नि॒ न प्र॑जहि॒तान्य॑द्रिवो दु॒रोषा॑सो अमन्महि
verses.transliteration: mā́ bhūma níṣṭyā iva-  -índra tvád áraṇā iva  vánāni ná prajahitā́ny adrivo  duróṣāso amanmahi

translation.text: May we be never cast aside, and strangers, as it were, to thee. We, Thunder-wielding Indra, count ourselves as trees rejected and unfit to bum.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अम॑न्म॒हीद॑ना॒शवो॑ऽनु॒ग्रास॑श्च वृत्रहन् स॒कृत्सु ते॑ मह॒ता शू॑र॒ राध॑सा॒ अनु॒ स्तोमं॑ मुदीमहि
verses.transliteration: ámanmahī́d anāśávo  -anugrā́saś ca vr̥trahan  sakŕ̥t sú te mahatā́ śūra rā́dhasā  ŕ̥nu stómam mudīmahi

translation.text: O Vr̥itra-slayer, we were thought slow and unready for the fray. Yet once in thy great bounty may we have delight, O Hero, after praising thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यदि॒ स्तोमं॒ मम॒ श्रव॑द॒स्माक॒मिन्द्र॒मिन्द॑वः ति॒रः प॒वित्रं॑ ससृ॒वांस॑ आ॒शवो॒ मन्द॑न्तु तुग्र्या॒वृधः॑
verses.transliteration: yádi stómam máma śrávad  asmā́kam índram índavaḥ  tiráḥ pavítraṃ sasr̥vā́ṃsa āśávo  mándantu tugryāvŕ̥dhaḥ

translation.text: If he will listen to my laud, then may out Soma-drops that flow Rapidly through the strainer gladden Indra, drops due to the Tugryas' Strengthener.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ त्व१॒॑द्य स॒धस्तु॑तिं वा॒वातुः॒ सख्यु॒रा ग॑हि उप॑स्तुतिर्म॒घोनां॒ प्र त्वा॑व॒त्वधा॑ ते वश्मि सुष्टु॒तिम्
verses.transliteration: ā́ tv àdyá sadhástutiṃ  vāvā́tuḥ sákhyur ā́ gahi  úpastutir maghónām prá tvāvatu-  ádhā te vaśmi suṣṭutím

translation.text: Come now unto the common laud of thee and of thy faithful friend. So may our wealthy nobles' praise give joy to thee. Fain would I sing thine eulogy.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सोता॒ हि सोम॒मद्रि॑भि॒रेमे॑नम॒प्सु धा॑वत ग॒व्या वस्त्रे॑व वा॒सय॑न्त॒ इन्नरो॒ निर्धु॑क्षन्व॒क्षणा॑भ्यः
verses.transliteration: sótā hí sómam ádribhir  ém enam apsú dhāvata  gavyā́ vástreva vāsáyanta ín náro  nír dhukṣan vakṣáṇābhyaḥ

translation.text: Press out the Soma with the stones, and in the waters wash it clean. The men investing it with raiment made of milk shall milk it forth from out the stems.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अध॒ ज्मो अध॑ वा दि॒वो बृ॑ह॒तो रो॑च॒नादधि॑ अ॒या व॑र्धस्व त॒न्वा॑ गि॒रा ममा जा॒ता सु॑क्रतो पृण
verses.transliteration: ádha jmó ádha vā divó  br̥ható rocanā́d ádhi  ayā́ vardhasva tanvā̀ girā́ máma-  -ā́ jātā́ sukrato pr̥ṇa

translation.text: Whether thou come from earth or from the lustre of the lofty heaven, Wax stronger in thy body through my song of praise: fill full all creatures, O most Wise.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रा॑य॒ सु म॒दिन्त॑मं॒ सोमं॑ सोता॒ वरे॑ण्यम् श॒क्र ए॑णं पीपय॒द्विश्व॑या धि॒या हि॑न्वा॒नं न वा॑ज॒युम्
verses.transliteration: índrāya sú madíntamaṃ  sómaṃ sotā váreṇyam  śakrá eṇam pīpayad víśvayā dhiyā́  hinvānáṃ ná vājayúm

translation.text: For India press the Soma out, most gladdening and most excellent. May Ṣakra make it swell sent forth with every prayer and asking, as it were, for strength.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा त्वा॒ सोम॑स्य॒ गल्द॑या॒ सदा॒ याच॑न्न॒हं गि॒रा भूर्णिं॑ मृ॒गं न सव॑नेषु चुक्रुधं॒ क ईशा॑नं॒ न या॑चिषत्
verses.transliteration: mā́ tvā sómasya gáldayā  sádā yā́cann aháṃ girā́  bhū́rṇim mr̥gáṃ ná sávaneṣu cukrudhaṃ  ká ī́śānaṃ ná yāciṣat

translation.text: Let me not, still beseeching thee with earnest song at Soma rites, Anger thee like soma wild beast. Who would not beseech him who hath power to grant his prayer?

verses.sanskrit_deva: मदे॑नेषि॒तं मद॑मु॒ग्रमु॒ग्रेण॒ शव॑सा विश्वे॑षां तरु॒तारं॑ मद॒च्युतं॒ मदे॒ हि ष्मा॒ ददा॑ति नः
verses.transliteration: mádeneṣitám mádam  ugrám ugréṇa śávasā  víśveṣāṃ tarutā́ram madacyútam  máde hí ṣmā dádāti naḥ

translation.text: The draught made swift with rapturous joy, effectual with its mighty strength, All-conquering, distilling transport, let him drink: for he in ecstasy gives us gifts.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शेवा॑रे॒ वार्या॑ पु॒रु दे॒वो मर्ता॑य दा॒शुषे॑ स सु॑न्व॒ते च॑ स्तुव॒ते च॑ रासते वि॒श्वगू॑र्तो अरिष्टु॒तः
verses.transliteration: śévāre vā́ryā purú  devó mártāya dāśúṣe  sá sunvaté ca stuvaté ca rāsate  viśvágūrto ariṣṭutáḥ

translation.text: Where bliss is not, may he, All-praised, God whom the pious glorify, Bestow great wealth upon the mortal worshipper who sheds the juice and praises him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: एन्द्र॑ याहि॒ मत्स्व॑ चि॒त्रेण॑ देव॒ राध॑सा सरो॒ न प्रा॑स्यु॒दरं॒ सपी॑तिभि॒रा सोमे॑भिरु॒रु स्फि॒रम्
verses.transliteration: éndra yāhi mátsva  citréṇa deva rā́dhasā  sáro ná prāsy udáraṃ sápītibhir  ā́ sómebhir urú sphirám

translation.text: Come, Indra, and rejoice thyself, O God, in manifold affluence. Thou fillest like a lake thy vast capacious bulk with Soma and with draughts besides.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ त्वा॑ स॒हस्र॒मा श॒तं यु॒क्ता रथे॑ हिर॒ण्यये॑ ब्र॒ह्म॒युजो॒ हर॑य इन्द्र के॒शिनो॒ वह॑न्तु॒ सोम॑पीतये
verses.transliteration: ā́ tvā sahásram ā́ śatáṃ  yuktā́ ráthe hiraṇyáye  brahmayújo háraya indra keśíno  váhantu sómapītaye

translation.text: A thousand and a hundred Steeds are harnessed to thy golden car. So may the long-mancd Bays, yoked by devotion, bring Indra to drink the Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ त्वा॒ रथे॑ हिर॒ण्यये॒ हरी॑ म॒यूर॑शेप्या शि॒ति॒पृ॒ष्ठा व॑हतां॒ मध्वो॒ अन्ध॑सो वि॒वक्ष॑णस्य पी॒तये॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ tvā ráthe hiraṇyáye  hárī mayū́raśepyā  śitipr̥ṣṭhā́ vahatām mádhvo ándhaso  vivákṣaṇasya pītáye

translation.text: Yoked to thy chariot wrought of gold, may thy two Bays with peacock tails, Convey thee hither, Steeds with their white backs, to quaff sweet juice that makes us eloquent.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पिबा॒ त्व१॒॑स्य गि॑र्वणः सु॒तस्य॑ पूर्व॒पा इ॑व परि॑ष्कृतस्य र॒सिन॑ इ॒यमा॑सु॒तिश्चारु॒र्मदा॑य पत्यते
verses.transliteration: píbā tv àsyá girvaṇaḥ  sutásya pūrvapā́ iva  páriṣkr̥tasya rasína iyám āsutíś  cā́rur mádāya patyate

translation.text: So drink, thou Lover of the Song, as the first drinker, of this juice. This the outpouring of the savoury sap prepared is good and meet to gladden thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य एको॒ अस्ति॑ दं॒सना॑ म॒हाँ उ॒ग्रो अ॒भि व्र॒तैः गम॒त्स शि॒प्री न स यो॑ष॒दा ग॑म॒द्धवं॒ न परि॑ वर्जति
verses.transliteration: yá éko ásti daṃsánā  mahā́m̐ ugró abhí vrataíḥ  gámat sá śiprī́ ná sá yoṣad ā́ gamad  -hávaṃ ná pári varjati

translation.text: He who alone by wondrous deed is Mighty, Strong by holy works, May he come, fair of cheek; may he not stay afar, but come and turn not from our call.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं पुरं॑ चरि॒ष्ण्वं॑ व॒धैः शुष्ण॑स्य॒ सं पि॑णक् त्वं भा अनु॑ चरो॒ अध॑ द्वि॒ता यदि॑न्द्र॒ हव्यो॒ भुवः॑
verses.transliteration: tvám púraṃ cariṣṇvàṃ  vadhaíḥ śúṣṇasya sám piṇak  tvám bhā́ ánu caro ádha dvitā́  yád indra hávyo bhúvaḥ

translation.text: Ṣushṇa's quick moving castle thou hast crushed to pieces with thy bolts. Thou, Indra, from of old, hast followed after light, since we have had thee to invoke.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मम॑ त्वा॒ सूर॒ उदि॑ते॒ मम॑ म॒ध्यंदि॑ने दि॒वः मम॑ प्रपि॒त्वे अ॑पिशर्व॒रे व॑स॒वा स्तोमा॑सो अवृत्सत
verses.transliteration: máma tvā sū́ra údite  máma madhyáṃdine diváḥ  máma prapitvé apiśarvaré vasav  ā́ stómāso avr̥tsata

translation.text: My praises when the Sun hath risen, my praises at the time of noon, My praises at the coming of the gloom of night, O Vasu, have gone forth to thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्तु॒हि स्तु॒हीदे॒ते घा॑ ते॒ मंहि॑ष्ठासो म॒घोना॑म् नि॒न्दि॒ताश्वः॑ प्रप॒थी प॑रम॒ज्या म॒घस्य॑ मेध्यातिथे
verses.transliteration: stuhí stuhī́d eté ghā te  máṃhiṣṭhāso maghónām  ninditā́śvaḥ prapathī́ paramajyā́ḥ-  maghásya medhyātithe

translation.text: Praise yea, praise him. Of princes these are the most liberal of their gifts, These, Paramajyâ, Ninditâṣva, Prapathî, most bounteous, O Medhyâtithi.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ यदश्वा॒न्वन॑न्वतः श्र॒द्धया॒हं रथे॑ रु॒हम् उ॒त वा॒मस्य॒ वसु॑नश्चिकेतति॒ यो अस्ति॒ याद्वः॑ प॒शुः
verses.transliteration: ā́ yád áśvān vánanvataḥ  śraddháyāháṃ ráthe ruhám  utá vāmásya vásunaś ciketati  yó ásti yā́dvaḥ paśúḥ

translation.text: When to the car, by faith, I yoked the horses longing for the way- For skilled is Yadu's son in dealing precious wealth, he who is rich in herds of kine.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य ऋ॒ज्रा मह्यं॑ माम॒हे स॒ह त्व॒चा हि॑र॒ण्यया॑ ए॒ष विश्वा॑न्य॒भ्य॑स्तु॒ सौभ॑गास॒ङ्गस्य॑ स्व॒नद्र॑थः
verses.transliteration: yá r̥jrā́ máhyam māmahé  sahá tvacā́ hiraṇyáyā  eṣá víśvāny abhy àstu saúbhagā-  -āsaṅgásya svanádrathaḥ

translation.text: May he who gave me two brown steeds together with their cloths of gold, May he, Âsanga's son Svanadratha, obtain all joy and high felicities.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अध॒ प्लायो॑गि॒रति॑ दासद॒न्याना॑स॒ङ्गो अ॑ग्ने द॒शभिः॑ स॒हस्रैः॑ अधो॒क्षणो॒ दश॒ मह्यं॒ रुश॑न्तो न॒ळा इ॑व॒ सर॑सो॒ निर॑तिष्ठन्
verses.transliteration: ádha plā́yogir áti dāsad anyā́n  āsaṅgó agne daśábhiḥ sahásraiḥ  ádhokṣáṇo dáśa máhyaṃ rúśanto  naḷā́ iva sáraso nír atiṣṭhan

translation.text: Playoga's son Âsanga, by ten thousand, O Agni, hath surpassed the rest in giving. For me ten bright-hued oxen have come forward like lotus-stalks from out a lake upstanding.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अन्व॑स्य स्थू॒रं द॑दृशे पु॒रस्ता॑दन॒स्थ ऊ॒रुर॑व॒रम्ब॑माणः शश्व॑ती॒ नार्य॑भि॒चक्ष्या॑ह॒ सुभ॑द्रमर्य॒ भोज॑नं बिभर्षि
verses.transliteration: ánv asya sthūráṃ dadr̥śe purástād  anasthá ūrúr avarámbamāṇaḥ  śáśvatī nā́ry abhicákṣyāha  súbhadram arya bhójanam bibharṣi

translation.text: What time her husband's perfect restoration to his lost strength and manhood was apparent, His consort Ṣaṣvatî with joy addressed him, Now art thou well, my lord, and shalt be happy.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒दं व॑सो सु॒तमन्धः॒ पिबा॒ सुपू॑र्णमु॒दर॑म् अना॑भयिन्ररि॒मा ते॑
verses.transliteration: idáṃ vaso sutám ándhaḥ  píbā súpūrṇam udáram  ánābhayin rarimā́ te

translation.text: HERE is the Soma juice expressed; O Vasu, drink till thou art full: Undaunted God, we give it thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नृभि॑र्धू॒तः सु॒तो अश्नै॒रव्यो॒ वारैः॒ परि॑पूतः अश्वो॒ न नि॒क्तो न॒दीषु॑
verses.transliteration: nŕ̥bhir dhūtáḥ sutó áśnair  ávyo vā́raiḥ páripūtaḥ  áśvo ná niktó nadī́ṣu

translation.text: Washed by the men, pressed out with stones, strained through the filter made of wool, 'Tis like a courser bathed in stream.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं ते॒ यवं॒ यथा॒ गोभिः॑ स्वा॒दुम॑कर्म श्री॒णन्तः॑ इन्द्र॑ त्वा॒स्मिन्त्स॑ध॒मादे॑
verses.transliteration: táṃ te yávaṃ yáthā góbhiḥ  svādúm akarma śrīṇántaḥ  índra tvāsmín sadhamā́de

translation.text: This juice have we made sweet for thee like barley, blending it with milk. Indra, I call thee to our feast.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॒ इत्सो॑म॒पा एक॒ इन्द्रः॑ सुत॒पा वि॒श्वायुः॑ अ॒न्तर्दे॒वान्मर्त्याँ॑श्च
verses.transliteration: índra ít somapā́ ékaḥ-  índraḥ sutapā́ viśvā́yuḥ  antár devā́n mártyāṃś ca

translation.text: Beloved of all, Indra alone drinks up the flowing Soma juice Among the Gods andmortal men.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न यं शु॒क्रो न दुरा॑शी॒र्न तृ॒प्रा उ॑रु॒व्यच॑सम् अ॒प॒स्पृ॒ण्व॒ते सु॒हार्द॑म्
verses.transliteration: ná yáṃ śukró ná dúrāśīr  ná tr̥prā́ uruvyácasam  apaspr̥ṇvaté suhā́rdam

translation.text: The Friend, whom not the brilliant-hued, the badly-mixt or bitter draught, Repels, the far-extending God;

verses.sanskrit_deva: गोभि॒र्यदी॑म॒न्ये अ॒स्मन्मृ॒गं न व्रा मृ॒गय॑न्ते अ॒भि॒त्सर॑न्ति धे॒नुभिः॑
verses.transliteration: góbhir yád īm anyé asmát-  mr̥gáṃ ná vrā́ mr̥gáyante  abhitsáranti dhenúbhiḥ

translation.text: While other men than we with milk chase him as hunters chase a deer, And with their kine inveigle him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्रय॒ इन्द्र॑स्य॒ सोमाः॑ सु॒तासः॑ सन्तु दे॒वस्य॑ स्वे क्षये॑ सुत॒पाव्नः॑
verses.transliteration: tráya índrasya sómāḥ  sutā́saḥ santu devásya  své kṣáye sutapā́vnaḥ

translation.text: For him, for Indra, for the God, be pressed three draughts of Soma juice In the juice-drinker's own abode.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्रयः॒ कोशा॑सः श्चोतन्ति ति॒स्रश्च॒म्व१॒॑ः सुपू॑र्णाः स॒मा॒ने अधि॒ भार्म॑न्
verses.transliteration: tráyaḥ kóśāsa ścotanti  tisráś camvàḥ súpūrṇāḥ  samāné ádhi bhā́rman

translation.text: Three reservoirs exude their drops, filled are three beakers to the brim, All for one offering to the God.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शुचि॑रसि पुरुनिः॒ष्ठाः क्षी॒रैर्म॑ध्य॒त आशी॑र्तः द॒ध्ना मन्दि॑ष्ठः॒ शूर॑स्य
verses.transliteration: śúcir asi puruniṣṭhā́ḥ  kṣīraír madhyatá ā́śīrtaḥ  dadhnā́ mándiṣṭhaḥ śū́rasya

translation.text: Pure art thou, set in many a place, and blended in the midst with milk And curd, to cheer the Hero best.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मे त॑ इन्द्र॒ सोमा॑स्ती॒व्रा अ॒स्मे सु॒तासः॑ शु॒क्रा आ॒शिरं॑ याचन्ते
verses.transliteration: imé ta indra sómās  tīvrā́ asmé sutā́saḥ  śukrā́ āśíraṃ yācante

translation.text: Here, Indra, are thy Soma-draughts pressed out by us, the strong, the pure: They crave admixture of the milk.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ताँ आ॒शिरं॑ पुरो॒ळाश॒मिन्द्रे॒मं सोमं॑ श्रीणीहि रे॒वन्तं॒ हि त्वा॑ शृ॒णोमि॑
verses.transliteration: tā́m̐ āśíram puroḷā́śam  índremáṃ sómaṃ śrīṇīhi  revántaṃ hí tvā śr̥ṇómi

translation.text: O Indra, pour in milk, prepare the cake, and mix the Soma-draught. I hear them say that thou art rich.

verses.sanskrit_deva: हृ॒त्सु पी॒तासो॑ युध्यन्ते दु॒र्मदा॑सो॒ न सुरा॑याम् ऊध॒र्न न॒ग्ना ज॑रन्ते
verses.transliteration: hr̥tsú pītā́so yudhyante  durmádāso ná súrāyām  ū́dhar ná nagnā́ jarante

translation.text: Quaffed juices fight within the breast. The drunken praise not by their wine, The naked praise not when it rains.

verses.sanskrit_deva: रे॒वाँ इद्रे॒वतः॑ स्तो॒ता स्यात्त्वाव॑तो म॒घोनः॑ प्रेदु॑ हरिवः श्रु॒तस्य॑
verses.transliteration: revā́m̐ íd reváta stotā́  syā́t tvā́vato maghónaḥ  préd u harivaḥ śrutásya

translation.text: Rich be the praiser of one rich, munificent and famed like thee: High rank be his, O Lord of Bays.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒क्थं च॒न श॒स्यमा॑न॒मगो॑र॒रिरा चि॑केत न गा॑य॒त्रं गी॒यमा॑नम्
verses.transliteration: uktháṃ caná śasyámānam  ágor arír ā́ ciketa  ná gāyatráṃ gīyámānam

translation.text: Foe of the man who adds no milk, he heeds not any chanted hymn Or holy psalm that may he sung.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा न॑ इन्द्र पीय॒त्नवे॒ मा शर्ध॑ते॒ परा॑ दाः शिक्षा॑ शचीवः॒ शची॑भिः
verses.transliteration: mā́ na indra pīyatnáve  mā́ śárdhate párā dāḥ  śíkṣā śacīvaḥ śácībhiḥ

translation.text: Give us not, Indra, as a prey unto the scornful or the proud: Help, Mighty One, with power and might.

verses.sanskrit_deva: व॒यमु॑ त्वा त॒दिद॑र्था॒ इन्द्र॑ त्वा॒यन्तः॒ सखा॑यः कण्वा॑ उ॒क्थेभि॑र्जरन्ते
verses.transliteration: vayám u tvā tadídarthāḥ-  índra tvāyántaḥ sákhāyaḥ  káṇvā ukthébhir jarante

translation.text: This, even this, O Indra, we implore. as thy devoted friends, The Kaṇvas praise thee with their hymns.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न घे॑म॒न्यदा प॑पन॒ वज्रि॑न्न॒पसो॒ नवि॑ष्टौ तवेदु॒ स्तोमं॑ चिकेत
verses.transliteration: ná ghem anyád ā́ papana  vájrinn apáso náviṣṭau  távéd u stómaṃ ciketa

translation.text: Naught else, O Thunderer, have I praised in the skilled singer's eulogy: On thy land only have I thought.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒च्छन्ति॑ दे॒वाः सु॒न्वन्तं॒ न स्वप्ना॑य स्पृहयन्ति यन्ति॑ प्र॒माद॒मत॑न्द्राः
verses.transliteration: ichánti devā́ḥ sunvántaṃ  ná svápnāya spr̥hayanti  yánti pramā́dam átandrāḥ

translation.text: The Gods seek him who presses out the Soma; they desire not sleep They punish sloth unweariedly.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ओ षु प्र या॑हि॒ वाजे॑भि॒र्मा हृ॑णीथा अ॒भ्य१॒॑स्मान् म॒हाँ इ॑व॒ युव॑जानिः
verses.transliteration: ó ṣú prá yāhi vā́jebhir  mā́ hr̥ṇīthā abhy àsmā́n  mahā́m̐ iva yúvajāniḥ

translation.text: Come hither swift with gifts of wealth – be not thou angry with us-like A great man with a youthful bride.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मो ष्व१॒॑द्य दु॒र्हणा॑वान्त्सा॒यं क॑रदा॒रे अ॒स्मत् अ॒श्री॒र इ॑व॒ जामा॑ता
verses.transliteration: mó ṣv àdyá durháṇāvān  sāyáṃ karad āré asmát  aśrīrá iva jā́mātā

translation.text: Let him not, wrathful with us, spend the evening far from us to-day, Like some unpleasant son-in-law.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि॒द्मा ह्य॑स्य वी॒रस्य॑ भूरि॒दाव॑रीं सुम॒तिम् त्रि॒षु जा॒तस्य॒ मनां॑सि
verses.transliteration: vidmā́ hy àsya vīrásya  bhūridā́varīṃ sumatím  triṣú jātásya mánāṃsi

translation.text: For well we know this Hero's love, most liberal of the boons he gives, His plans whom the three worlds display.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ तू षि॑ञ्च॒ कण्व॑मन्तं॒ न घा॑ विद्म शवसा॒नात् य॒शस्त॑रं श॒तमू॑तेः
verses.transliteration: ā́ tū́ ṣiñca káṇvamantaṃ  ná ghā vidma śavasānā́t  yaśástaraṃ śatámūteḥ

translation.text: Pour forth the gift which Kaṇvas bring, for none more glorious do we know Than the Strong Lord with countless aids.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ज्येष्ठे॑न सोत॒रिन्द्रा॑य॒ सोमं॑ वी॒राय॑ श॒क्राय॑ भरा॒ पिब॒न्नर्या॑य
verses.transliteration: jyéṣṭhena sotar índrāya  sómaṃ vīrā́ya śakrā́ya  bhárā píban náryāya

translation.text: O presser, offer Soma first to Indra, Hero, Ṣakra, him The Friend of man, that he may drink;

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो वेदि॑ष्ठो अव्य॒थिष्वश्वा॑वन्तं जरि॒तृभ्यः॑ वाजं॑ स्तो॒तृभ्यो॒ गोम॑न्तम्
verses.transliteration: yó védiṣṭho avyathíṣu-  áśvāvantaṃ jaritŕ̥bhyaḥ  vā́jaṃ stotŕ̥bhyo gómantam

translation.text: Who, in untroubled ways, is best provider, for his worshippers. Of strength in horses and in kine.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पन्य॑म्पन्य॒मित्सो॑तार॒ आ धा॑वत॒ मद्या॑य सोमं॑ वी॒राय॒ शूरा॑य
verses.transliteration: pányam-panyam ít sotāraḥ-  ā́ dhāvata mádyāya  sómaṃ vīrā́ya śū́rāya

translation.text: Pressers, for him blend Soma juice, each draught most excellent, for him The Brave, the Hero, for his joy.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पाता॑ वृत्र॒हा सु॒तमा घा॑ गम॒न्नारे अ॒स्मत् नि य॑मते श॒तमू॑तिः
verses.transliteration: pā́tā vr̥trahā́ sutám  ā́ ghā gaman nā́ré asmát  ní yamate śatámūtiḥ

translation.text: The Vr̥itra-slayer drinks the juice. May he who gives a hundred aids Approach, nor stay afar from us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: एह हरी॑ ब्रह्म॒युजा॑ श॒ग्मा व॑क्षतः॒ सखा॑यम् गी॒र्भिः श्रु॒तं गिर्व॑णसम्
verses.transliteration: éhá hárī brahmayújā  śagmā́ vakṣataḥ sákhāyam  gīrbhíḥ śrutáṃ gírvaṇasam

translation.text: May the strong Bay Steeds, yoked by prayer, bring hither unto us our Friend, Lover of Song, renowned by songs.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्वा॒दवः॒ सोमा॒ आ या॑हि श्री॒ताः सोमा॒ आ या॑हि शिप्रि॒न्नृषी॑वः॒ शची॑वो॒ नायमच्छा॑ सध॒माद॑म्
verses.transliteration: svādávaḥ sómā ā́ yāhi  śrītā́ḥ sómā ā́ yāhi  śíprinn ŕ̥ṣīvaḥ śácīvo  nā́yám áchā sadhamā́dam

translation.text: Sweet are the Soma juices, come! Blent are the Soma juices, come! R̥ishi-like, mighty, fair of cheek, come hither quickly to the feast.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्तुत॑श्च॒ यास्त्वा॒ वर्ध॑न्ति म॒हे राध॑से नृ॒म्णाय॑ इन्द्र॑ का॒रिणं॑ वृ॒धन्तः॑
verses.transliteration: stútaś ca yā́s tvā várdhanti  mahé rā́dhase nr̥mṇā́ya  índra kāríṇaṃ vr̥dhántaḥ

translation.text: And lauds which strengthen thee for great bounty and valour, and exalt Indra who doeth glorious deeds,

verses.sanskrit_deva: गिर॑श्च॒ यास्ते॑ गिर्वाह उ॒क्था च॒ तुभ्यं॒ तानि॑ स॒त्रा द॑धि॒रे शवां॑सि
verses.transliteration: gíraś ca yā́s te girvāhaḥ-  ukthā́ ca túbhyaṃ tā́ni  satrā́ dadhiré śávāṃsi

translation.text: And songs to thee who lovest song, and all those hymns addressed to thee- These evermore confirm thy might.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒वेदे॒ष तु॑विकू॒र्मिर्वाजाँ॒ एको॒ वज्र॑हस्तः स॒नादमृ॑क्तो दयते
verses.transliteration: evéd eṣá tuvikūrmír  vā́jām̐ éko vájrahastaḥ  sanā́d ámr̥kto dayate

translation.text: Thus he, sole doer of great deeds whose hand holds thunder, gives us strength, He who hath never been subdued.

verses.sanskrit_deva: हन्ता॑ वृ॒त्रं दक्षि॑णे॒नेन्द्रः॑ पु॒रू पु॑रुहू॒तः म॒हान्म॒हीभिः॒ शची॑भिः
verses.transliteration: hántā vr̥tráṃ dákṣiṇena-  -índraḥ purū́ puruhūtáḥ  mahā́n mahī́bhiḥ śácībhiḥ

translation.text: Vr̥itra he slays with his right hand, even Indra, great with mighty power, And much-invoked in many a place.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्मि॒न्विश्वा॑श्चर्ष॒णय॑ उ॒त च्यौ॒त्ना ज्रयां॑सि च अनु॒ घेन्म॒न्दी म॒घोनः॑
verses.transliteration: yásmin víśvāś carṣaṇáyaḥ-  utá cyautnā́ jráyāṃsi ca  ánu ghén mandī́ maghónaḥ

translation.text: He upon whom all men depend, all regions, all achievements, he Takes pleasure in our wealthy chiefs.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ष ए॒तानि॑ चका॒रेन्द्रो॒ विश्वा॒ योऽति॑ शृ॒ण्वे वा॒ज॒दावा॑ म॒घोना॑म्
verses.transliteration: eṣá etā́ni cakāra-  -índro víśvā yó 'ti śr̥ṇvé  vājadā́vā maghónām

translation.text: All this hath he accomplished, yea, Indra, most gloriously renowned, Who gives our wealthy princes strength.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रभ॑र्ता॒ रथं॑ ग॒व्यन्त॑मपा॒काच्चि॒द्यमव॑ति इ॒नो वसु॒ स हि वोळ्हा॑
verses.transliteration: prábhartā ráthaṃ gavyántam  apākā́c cid yám ávati  inó vásu sá hí vóḷhā

translation.text: Who drives his chariot seeking spoil, from afar, to him he loves: For swift is he to bring men wealth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सनि॑ता॒ विप्रो॒ अर्व॑द्भि॒र्हन्ता॑ वृ॒त्रं नृभिः॒ शूरः॑ स॒त्यो॑ऽवि॒ता वि॒धन्त॑म्
verses.transliteration: sánitā vípro árvadbhir  hántā vr̥tráṃ nŕ̥bhiḥ śū́raḥ  satyò 'vitā́ vidhántam

translation.text: The Sage who, winning spoil with steeds, slays Vr̥itra, Hero with the men, His servant's faithful succourer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यज॑ध्वैनं प्रियमेधा॒ इन्द्रं॑ स॒त्राचा॒ मन॑सा यो भूत्सोमैः॑ स॒त्यम॑द्वा
verses.transliteration: yájadhvainam priyamedhāḥ-  índraṃ satrā́cā mánasā  yó bhū́t sómaiḥ satyámadvā

translation.text: O Priyamedhas, worship with collected mind this Indra whom The Soma hath full well inspired.

verses.sanskrit_deva: गा॒थश्र॑वसं॒ सत्प॑तिं॒ श्रव॑स्कामं पुरु॒त्मान॑म् कण्वा॑सो गा॒त वा॒जिन॑म्
verses.transliteration: gātháśravasaṃ sátpatiṃ  śrávaskāmam purutmā́nam  káṇvāso gātá vājínam

translation.text: Ye Kaṇvas, sing the Mighty One, Lord of the Brave, who loves renown, All-present, glorified by song.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य ऋ॒ते चि॒द्गास्प॒देभ्यो॒ दात्सखा॒ नृभ्यः॒ शची॑वान् ये अ॑स्मि॒न्काम॒मश्रि॑यन्
verses.transliteration: yá r̥té cid gā́s padébhyo  dā́t sákhā nŕ̥bhyaḥ śácīvān  yé asmin kā́mam áśriyan

translation.text: Strong Friend, who, with no trace of feet, restores the cattle to the men, Who rest their wish and hope on him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒त्था धीव॑न्तमद्रिवः का॒ण्वं मेध्या॑तिथिम् मे॒षो भू॒तो॒३॒॑ऽभि यन्नयः॑
verses.transliteration: itthā́ dhī́vantam adrivaḥ  kāṇvám médhyātithim  meṣó bhūtò 'bhí yánn áyaḥ

translation.text: Shaped as a Ram, Stone-hurler I once thou camest hither to the son Of Kaṇva, wise Medhyâtithi.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शिक्षा॑ विभिन्दो अस्मै च॒त्वार्य॒युता॒ दद॑त् अ॒ष्टा प॒रः स॒हस्रा॑
verses.transliteration: śíkṣā vibhindo asmai  catvā́ry ayútā dádat  aṣṭā́ paráḥ sahásrā

translation.text: Vibhindu, thou hast helped this man, giving him thousands four times ten, And afterward eight thousand more.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त सु त्ये प॑यो॒वृधा॑ मा॒की रण॑स्य न॒प्त्या॑ ज॒नि॒त्व॒नाय॑ मामहे
verses.transliteration: utá sú tyé payovŕ̥dhā  mākī́ ráṇasya naptyā̀  janitvanā́ya māmahe

translation.text: And these twain pouring streams of milk, creative, daughters of delight, For wedlock sake I glorify.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पिबा॑ सु॒तस्य॑ र॒सिनो॒ मत्स्वा॑ न इन्द्र॒ गोम॑तः आ॒पिर्नो॑ बोधि सध॒माद्यो॑ वृ॒धे॒३॒॑ऽस्माँ अ॑वन्तु ते॒ धियः॑
verses.transliteration: píbā sutásya rasíno  mátsvā na indra gómataḥ  āpír no bodhi sadhamā́dyo vr̥dhé-  -asmā́m̐ avantu te dhíyaḥ

translation.text: DRINK, Indra, of the savoury juice, and cheer thee with our milky draught. Be, for our weal, our Friend and sharer of the feast, and let thy wisdom guard us well.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भू॒याम॑ ते सुम॒तौ वा॒जिनो॑ व॒यं मा नः॑ स्तर॒भिमा॑तये अ॒स्माञ्चि॒त्राभि॑रवताद॒भिष्टि॑भि॒रा नः॑ सु॒म्नेषु॑ यामय
verses.transliteration: bhūyā́ma te sumataú vājíno vayám  mā́ na star abhímātaye  asmā́ñ citrā́bhir avatād abhíṣṭibhir  ā́ naḥ sumnéṣu yāmaya

translation.text: In thy kind grace and favour may we still be strong: expose us not to foe's attack. With manifold assistance guard and succour us, and bring us to felicity.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मा उ॑ त्वा पुरूवसो॒ गिरो॑ वर्धन्तु॒ या मम॑ पा॒व॒कव॑र्णाः॒ शुच॑यो विप॒श्चितो॒ऽभि स्तोमै॑रनूषत
verses.transliteration: imā́ u tvā purūvaso  gíro vardhantu yā́ máma  pāvakávarṇāḥ śúcayo vipaścíto  -abhí stómair anūṣata

translation.text: May these my songs of praise exalt thee, Lord, who hast abundant wealth. Men skilled in holy hymns, pure, with the hues of fire, have sung them with their lauds to thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं स॒हस्र॒मृषि॑भिः॒ सह॑स्कृतः समु॒द्र इ॑व पप्रथे स॒त्यः सो अ॑स्य महि॒मा गृ॑णे॒ शवो॑ य॒ज्ञेषु॑ विप्र॒राज्ये॑
verses.transliteration: ayáṃ sahásram ŕ̥ṣibhiḥ sáhaskr̥taḥ  samudrá iva paprathe  satyáḥ só asya mahimā́ gr̥ṇe śávo  yajñéṣu viprarā́jye

translation.text: He, with his might enhanced by R̥ishis thousandfold, hath like an ocean spread himself. His majesty is praised as true at solemn rites, his power where holy singers rule.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॒मिद्दे॒वता॑तय॒ इन्द्रं॑ प्रय॒त्य॑ध्व॒रे इन्द्रं॑ समी॒के व॒निनो॑ हवामह॒ इन्द्रं॒ धन॑स्य सा॒तये॑
verses.transliteration: índram íd devátātaye-  índram prayaty àdhvaré  índraṃ samīké vaníno havāmahe-  índraṃ dhánasya sātáye

translation.text: Indra for worship of the Gods, Indra while sacrifice proceeds, Indra, as worshippers in battle-shock, we call, Indra that we may win the spoil.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रो॑ म॒ह्ना रोद॑सी पप्रथ॒च्छव॒ इन्द्रः॒ सूर्य॑मरोचयत् इन्द्रे॑ ह॒ विश्वा॒ भुव॑नानि येमिर॒ इन्द्रे॑ सुवा॒नास॒ इन्द॑वः
verses.transliteration: índro mahnā́ ródasī paprathac chávaḥ-  índraḥ sū́ryam arocayat  índre ha víśvā bhúvanāni yemire-  índre suvānā́sa índavaḥ

translation.text: With might hath Indra spread out heaven and earth, with power hath Indra lighted up the Sun. In Indra are all creatures closely held; in him meet the distilling Soma-drops.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भि त्वा॑ पू॒र्वपी॑तय॒ इन्द्र॒ स्तोमे॑भिरा॒यवः॑ स॒मी॒ची॒नास॑ ऋ॒भवः॒ सम॑स्वरन्रु॒द्रा गृ॑णन्त॒ पूर्व्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: abhí tvā pūrvápītaye  índra stómebhir āyávaḥ  samīcīnā́sa r̥bhávaḥ sám asvaran  rudrā́ gr̥ṇanta pū́rvyam

translation.text: Men with their lauds are urging thee, Indra, to drink the Soma first. The R̥ibhus in accord have lifted up their voice, and Rudras sung thee as the first.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्येदिन्द्रो॑ वावृधे॒ वृष्ण्यं॒ शवो॒ मदे॑ सु॒तस्य॒ विष्ण॑वि अ॒द्या तम॑स्य महि॒मान॑मा॒यवोऽनु॑ ष्टुवन्ति पू॒र्वथा॑
verses.transliteration: asyéd índro vāvr̥dhe vŕ̥ṣṇyaṃ śávo  máde sutásya víṣṇavi  adyā́ tám asya mahimā́nam āyávaḥ-  -ánu ṣṭuvanti pūrváthā

translation.text: Indra increased his manly strength at sacrifice, in the wild rapture of this juice. And living men to-day, even as of old, sing forth their praises to his majesty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तत्त्वा॑ यामि सु॒वीर्यं॒ तद्ब्रह्म॑ पू॒र्वचि॑त्तये येना॒ यति॑भ्यो॒ भृग॑वे॒ धने॑ हि॒ते येन॒ प्रस्क॑ण्व॒मावि॑थ
verses.transliteration: tát tvā yāmi suvī́ryaṃ  tád bráhma pūrvácittaye  yénā yátibhyo bhŕ̥gave dháne hité  yéna práskaṇvam ā́vitha

translation.text: I crave of thee that hero strength, that thou mayst first regard this prayer, Wherewith thou holpest Bhr̥igu and the Yatis and Praskaṇva when the prize was staked.

verses.sanskrit_deva: येना॑ समु॒द्रमसृ॑जो म॒हीर॒पस्तदि॑न्द्र॒ वृष्णि॑ ते॒ शवः॑ स॒द्यः सो अ॑स्य महि॒मा न सं॒नशे॒ यं क्षो॒णीर॑नुचक्र॒दे
verses.transliteration: yénā samudrám ásr̥jo mahī́r apás  tád indra vŕ̥ṣṇi te śávaḥ  sadyáḥ só asya mahimā́ ná saṃnáśe  yáṃ kṣoṇī́r anucakradé

translation.text: Wherewith thou sentest mighty waters to the sea, that, Indra, is thy manly strength. For ever unattainable is this power of him to whom the worlds have cried aloud.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श॒ग्धी न॑ इन्द्र॒ यत्त्वा॑ र॒यिं यामि॑ सु॒वीर्य॑म् श॒ग्धि वाजा॑य प्रथ॒मं सिषा॑सते श॒ग्धि स्तोमा॑य पूर्व्य
verses.transliteration: śagdhī́ na indra yát tvā  rayíṃ yā́mi suvī́ryam  śagdhí vā́jāya prathamáṃ síṣāsate  śagdhí stómāya pūrvya

translation.text: Help us, O Indra, when we pray to thee for wealth and hero might. First help thou on to strength the man who strives to win, and aid our laud, O Ancient One.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श॒ग्धी नो॑ अ॒स्य यद्ध॑ पौ॒रमावि॑थ॒ धिय॑ इन्द्र॒ सिषा॑सतः श॒ग्धि यथा॒ रुश॑मं॒ श्याव॑कं॒ कृप॒मिन्द्र॒ प्रावः॒ स्व॑र्णरम्
verses.transliteration: śagdhī́ no asyá yád dha paurám ā́vitha  dhíya indra síṣāsataḥ  śagdhí yáthā rúśamaṃ śyā́vakaṃ kŕ̥pam  índra prā́vaḥ svàrṇaram

translation.text: Help for us, Indra, as thou holpest Paura once, this man's devotions bent on gain. Help, as thou gavest Ruṣama and Ṣyâvaka and Svarṇara and Kr̥ipa aid.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कन्नव्यो॑ अत॒सीनां॑ तु॒रो गृ॑णीत॒ मर्त्यः॑ न॒ही न्व॑स्य महि॒मान॑मिन्द्रि॒यं स्व॑र्गृ॒णन्त॑ आन॒शुः
verses.transliteration: kán návyo atasī́nāṃ  turó gr̥ṇīta mártyaḥ  nahī́ nv àsya mahimā́nam indriyáṃ  svàr gr̥ṇánta ānaśúḥ

translation.text: What newest of imploring prayers shall, then, the zealous mortal sing? For have not they who laud his might, and Indra-power won for themselves the light of heaven?

verses.sanskrit_deva: कदु॑ स्तु॒वन्त॑ ऋतयन्त दे॒वत॒ ऋषिः॒ को विप्र॑ ओहते क॒दा हवं॑ मघवन्निन्द्र सुन्व॒तः कदु॑ स्तुव॒त आ ग॑मः
verses.transliteration: kád u stuvánta r̥tayanta devátā-  ŕ̥ṣiḥ kó vípra ohate  kadā́ hávam maghavann indra sunvatáḥ  kád u stuvatá ā́ gamaḥ

translation.text: When shall they keep the Law and praise thee mid the Gods? Who counts as R̥ishi and as sage? When ever wilt thou, Indra Maghavan, come nigh to presser's or to praiser's call?

verses.sanskrit_deva: उदु॒ त्ये मधु॑मत्तमा॒ गिरः॒ स्तोमा॑स ईरते स॒त्रा॒जितो॑ धन॒सा अक्षि॑तोतयो वाज॒यन्तो॒ रथा॑ इव
verses.transliteration: úd u tyé mádhumattamāḥ-  gíra stómāsa īrate  satrājíto dhanasā́ ákṣitotayo  vājayánto ráthā iva

translation.text: These songs of ours exceeding sweet, these hymns of praise ascend to thee, Like ever-conquering chariots that display their strength, gain wealth, and give unfailing aid.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कण्वा॑ इव॒ भृग॑वः॒ सूर्या॑ इव॒ विश्व॒मिद्धी॒तमा॑नशुः इन्द्रं॒ स्तोमे॑भिर्म॒हय॑न्त आ॒यवः॑ प्रि॒यमे॑धासो अस्वरन्
verses.transliteration: káṇvā iva bhŕ̥gavaḥ sū́ryā iva  víśvam íd dhītám ānaśuḥ  índraṃ stómebhir maháyanta āyávaḥ  priyámedhāso asvaran

translation.text: The Bhr̥igus are like Suns, like Kaṇvas, and have gained all that their thoughts were bent upon. The living men of Priyamedha's race have sung exalting Indra with their lauds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒क्ष्वा हि वृ॑त्रहन्तम॒ हरी॑ इन्द्र परा॒वतः॑ अ॒र्वा॒ची॒नो म॑घव॒न्त्सोम॑पीतय उ॒ग्र ऋ॒ष्वेभि॒रा ग॑हि
verses.transliteration: yukṣvā́ hí vr̥trahantama  hárī indra parāvátaḥ  arvācīnó maghavan sómapītaye-  ugrá r̥ṣvébhir ā́ gahi

translation.text: Best slayer of the Vr̥itras, yoke thy Bay Steeds, Indra, from afar. Come with the High Ones hither, Maghavan, to us, Mighty, to drink the Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मे हि ते॑ का॒रवो॑ वाव॒शुर्धि॒या विप्रा॑सो मे॒धसा॑तये स त्वं नो॑ मघवन्निन्द्र गिर्वणो वे॒नो न शृ॑णुधी॒ हव॑म्
verses.transliteration: imé hí te kārávo vāvaśúr dhiyā́  víprāso medhásātaye  sá tváṃ no maghavann indra girvaṇo  venó ná śr̥ṇudhī hávam

translation.text: For these, the bards and singers, have cried out to thee with prayer, to gain the sacrifice. As such, O Maghavan, Indra, who lovest song, even as a lover bear my call.

verses.sanskrit_deva: निरि॑न्द्र बृह॒तीभ्यो॑ वृ॒त्रं धनु॑भ्यो अस्फुरः निरर्बु॑दस्य॒ मृग॑यस्य मा॒यिनो॒ निः पर्व॑तस्य॒ गा आ॑जः
verses.transliteration: nír indra br̥hatī́bhyo  vr̥tráṃ dhánubhyo asphuraḥ  nír árbudasya mŕ̥gayasya māyíno  níḥ párvatasya gā́ ājaḥ

translation.text: Thou from the lofty plains above, O Indra, hurledst Vr̥itra down. Thou dravest forth the kine of guileful Mr̥igaya and Arbuda from the mountain's hold.

verses.sanskrit_deva: निर॒ग्नयो॑ रुरुचु॒र्निरु॒ सूर्यो॒ निः सोम॑ इन्द्रि॒यो रसः॑ निर॒न्तरि॑क्षादधमो म॒हामहिं॑ कृ॒षे तदि॑न्द्र॒ पौंस्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: nír agnáyo rurucur nír u sū́ryo  níḥ sóma indriyó rásaḥ  nír antárikṣād adhamo mahā́m áhiṃ  kr̥ṣé tád indra paúṃsyam

translation.text: Bright were the flaming fires, the Sun gave forth his shine, and Soma, Indra's juice, shone clear. Indra, thou blewest the great Dragon from the air -. men must regard that valorous deed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यं मे॒ दुरिन्द्रो॑ म॒रुतः॒ पाक॑स्थामा॒ कौर॑याणः विश्वे॑षां॒ त्मना॒ शोभि॑ष्ठ॒मुपे॑व दि॒वि धाव॑मानम्
verses.transliteration: yám me dúr índro marútaḥ  pā́kasthāmā kaúrayāṇaḥ  víśveṣāṃ tmánā śóbhiṣṭham  úpeva diví dhā́vamānam

translation.text: The fairest courser of them all, who runneth on as 'twere to heaven. Which Indra and the Maruts gave, and Pâkasthâman Kaurayâṇ.

verses.sanskrit_deva: रोहि॑तं मे॒ पाक॑स्थामा सु॒धुरं॑ कक्ष्य॒प्राम् अदा॑द्रा॒यो वि॒बोध॑नम्
verses.transliteration: róhitam me pā́kasthāmā  sudhúraṃ kakṣyaprā́m  ádād rāyó vibódhanam

translation.text: To me hath Pâkasthâman given, a ruddy horse,good at the pole, Filling is girth and rousing wealth;

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्मा॑ अ॒न्ये दश॒ प्रति॒ धुरं॒ वह॑न्ति॒ वह्न॑यः अस्तं॒ वयो॒ न तुग्र्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: yásmā anyé dáśa práti  dhúraṃ váhanti váhnayaḥ  ástaṃ váyo ná túgryam

translation.text: Compared with whom no other ten strong coursers, harnessed to the pole, Bear Tugrya to his dwelling place.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ॒त्मा पि॒तुस्त॒नूर्वास॑ ओजो॒दा अ॒भ्यञ्ज॑नम् तु॒रीय॒मिद्रोहि॑तस्य॒ पाक॑स्थामानं भो॒जं दा॒तार॑मब्रवम्
verses.transliteration: ātmā́ pitús tanū́r vā́saḥ-  ojodā́ abhyáñjanam  turī́yam íd róhitasya pā́kasthāmānam  bhojáṃ dātā́ram abravam

translation.text: Raiment is body, food is life, and healing ointment giveth strength. As the free-handed giver of the ruddy steed, I have named Pâkasthâman fourth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यदि॑न्द्र॒ प्रागपा॒गुद॒ङ्न्य॑ग्वा हू॒यसे॒ नृभिः॑ सिमा॑ पु॒रू नृषू॑तो अ॒स्यान॒वेऽसि॑ प्रशर्ध तु॒र्वशे॑
verses.transliteration: yád indra prā́g ápāg údak-  nyàg vā hūyáse nŕ̥bhiḥ  símā purū́ nŕ̥ṣūto asy ā́nave-  -ási praśardha turváśe

translation.text: THOUGH, Indra, thou art called by men eastward and westward, north and south, Thou chiefly art with Anava and Turvaṣa, brave Champion I urged by men to Come.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यद्वा॒ रुमे॒ रुश॑मे॒ श्याव॑के॒ कृप॒ इन्द्र॑ मा॒दय॑से॒ सचा॑ कण्वा॑सस्त्वा॒ ब्रह्म॑भिः॒ स्तोम॑वाहस॒ इन्द्रा य॑च्छ॒न्त्या ग॑हि
verses.transliteration: yád vā rúme rúśame śyā́vake kŕ̥pe-  índra mādáyase sácā  káṇvāsas tvā bráhmabhi stómavāhasaḥ-  índrā́ yachanty ā́ gahi

translation.text: Or, Indra, when with Ruma, Ruṣama, Ṣyâvaka, and Kr̥ipa thou rejoicest thee, Still do the Kaṇvas, bringing praises, with their prayers, O Indra, draw thee hither: come.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यथा॑ गौ॒रो अ॒पा कृ॒तं तृष्य॒न्नेत्यवेरि॑णम् आ॒पि॒त्वे नः॑ प्रपि॒त्वे तूय॒मा ग॑हि॒ कण्वे॑षु॒ सु सचा॒ पिब॑
verses.transliteration: yáthā gauró apā́ kr̥táṃ  tŕ̥ṣyann éty ávériṇam  āpitvé naḥ prapitvé tū́yam ā́ gahi  káṇveṣu sú sácā píba

translation.text: Even as the wild-bull, when he thirsts, goes to the desert's watery pool, Come hither quickly both at morning and at eve, and with the Kaṇvas drink thy fill.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मन्द॑न्तु त्वा मघवन्नि॒न्द्रेन्द॑वो राधो॒देया॑य सुन्व॒ते आ॒मुष्या॒ सोम॑मपिबश्च॒मू सु॒तं ज्येष्ठं॒ तद्द॑धिषे॒ सहः॑
verses.transliteration: mándantu tvā maghavann indréndavo  rādhodéyāya sunvaté  āmúṣyā sómam apibaś camū́ sutáṃ  jyéṣṭhaṃ tád dadhiṣe sáhaḥ

translation.text: May the drops gladden thee, rich Indra, and obtain bounty for him who pours the juice. Soma pressed in the mortar didst thou take and drink, and hence hast won surpassing might.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र च॑क्रे॒ सह॑सा॒ सहो॑ ब॒भञ्ज॑ म॒न्युमोज॑सा विश्वे॑ त इन्द्र पृतना॒यवो॑ यहो॒ नि वृ॒क्षा इ॑व येमिरे
verses.transliteration: prá cakre sáhasā sáho  babháñja manyúm ójasā  víśve ta indra pr̥tanāyávo yaho  ní vr̥kṣā́ iva yemire

translation.text: With mightier strength he conquered strength, with energy he crushed their wrath. O Indra, Strong in youth, all those who sought the fray bent and bowed down to thee like trees.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒हस्रे॑णेव सचते यवी॒युधा॒ यस्त॒ आन॒ळुप॑स्तुतिम् पु॒त्रं प्रा॑व॒र्गं कृ॑णुते सु॒वीर्ये॑ दा॒श्नोति॒ नम॑उक्तिभिः
verses.transliteration: sahásreṇeva sacate yavīyúdhā  yás ta ā́naḷ úpastutim  putrám prāvargáṃ kr̥ṇute suvī́rye  dāśnóti námaÅktibhiḥ

translation.text: He who wins promise of thine aid goes girt as with a thousand mighty men of war. He makes his son preeminent in hero might – he serves with reverential prayer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा भे॑म॒ मा श्र॑मिष्मो॒ग्रस्य॑ स॒ख्ये तव॑ म॒हत्ते॒ वृष्णो॑ अभि॒चक्ष्यं॑ कृ॒तं पश्ये॑म तु॒र्वशं॒ यदु॑म्
verses.transliteration: mā́ bhema mā́ śramiṣma-  -ugrásya sakhyé táva  mahát te vŕ̥ṣṇo abhicákṣyaṃ kr̥tám  páśyema turváśaṃ yádum

translation.text: With thee, the Mighty, for our Friend, we will riot fear or feel fatigue. May we see Turvaṣa and Yadu: thy great deed, O Hero, must be glorified.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒व्यामनु॑ स्फि॒ग्यं॑ वावसे॒ वृषा॒ न दा॒नो अ॑स्य रोषति मध्वा॒ सम्पृ॑क्ताः सार॒घेण॑ धे॒नव॒स्तूय॒मेहि॒ द्रवा॒ पिब॑
verses.transliteration: savyā́m ánu sphigyàṃ vāvase vŕ̥ṣā  ná dānó asya roṣati  mádhvā sámpr̥ktāḥ sāraghéṇa dhenávas  tū́yam éhi drávā píba

translation.text: On his left hip the Hero hath reclined himself: the proffered feast offends him not. The milk is blended with the honey of the bee: quickly come hither, baste, and drink.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒श्वी र॒थी सु॑रू॒प इद्गोमाँ॒ इदि॑न्द्र ते॒ सखा॑ श्वा॒त्र॒भाजा॒ वय॑सा सचते॒ सदा॑ च॒न्द्रो या॑ति स॒भामुप॑
verses.transliteration: aśvī́ rathī́ surūpá íd  gómām̐ íd indra te sákhā  śvātrabhā́jā váyasā sacate sádā  candró yāti sabhā́m úpa

translation.text: Indra, thy friend is fair of form and rich in horses, cars, and kine. He evermore hath food accompanied by wealth, and radiant joins the company.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋश्यो॒ न तृष्य॑न्नव॒पान॒मा ग॑हि॒ पिबा॒ सोमं॒ वशाँ॒ अनु॑ नि॒मेघ॑मानो मघवन्दि॒वेदि॑व॒ ओजि॑ष्ठं दधिषे॒ सहः॑
verses.transliteration: ŕ̥śyo ná tŕ̥ṣyann avapā́nam ā́ gahi  píbā sómaṃ váśām̐ ánu  niméghamāno maghavan divé-dive-  ójiṣṭhaṃ dadhiṣe sáhaḥ

translation.text: Come like a thirsty antelope to the drinking-place: drink Soma to thy heart's desire. Raining it down, O Maghavan, day after day, thou gainest thy surpassing might.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अध्व॑र्यो द्रा॒वया॒ त्वं सोम॒मिन्द्रः॑ पिपासति उप॑ नू॒नं यु॑युजे॒ वृष॑णा॒ हरी॒ आ च॑ जगाम वृत्र॒हा
verses.transliteration: ádhvaryo drāváyā tváṃ  sómam índraḥ pipāsati  úpa nūnáṃ yuyuje vŕ̥ṣaṇā hárī  ā́ ca jagāma vr̥trahā́

translation.text: Priest, let the Soma juice flow forth, for Indra longs to drink thereof. He even now hath yoked his vigorous Bay Steeds: the Vr̥itra-slayer hath come near.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्व॒यं चि॒त्स म॑न्यते॒ दाशु॑रि॒र्जनो॒ यत्रा॒ सोम॑स्य तृ॒म्पसि॑ इ॒दं ते॒ अन्नं॒ युज्यं॒ समु॑क्षितं॒ तस्येहि॒ प्र द्र॑वा॒ पिब॑
verses.transliteration: svayáṃ cit sá manyate dā́śurir jáno  yátrā sómasya tr̥mpási  idáṃ te ánnaṃ yújyaṃ sámukṣitaṃ  tásyéhi prá dravā píba

translation.text: The man with whom thou fillcst thee with Soma deems himself a pious worshipper. This thine appropriate food is here poured out for thee: come, hasten forward. drink of it,

verses.sanskrit_deva: र॒थे॒ष्ठाया॑ध्वर्यवः॒ सोम॒मिन्द्रा॑य सोतन अधि॑ ब्र॒ध्नस्याद्र॑यो॒ वि च॑क्षते सु॒न्वन्तो॑ दा॒श्व॑ध्वरम्
verses.transliteration: ratheṣṭhā́yādhvaryavaḥ  sómam índrāya sotana  ádhi bradhnásyā́drayo ví cakṣate  sunvánto dāśvàdhvaram

translation.text: Press out the Soma juice, ye priests, for Indra borne upon his car. The pressing-stones speak loud of Indra, while they shed the juice which, offered, honours him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उप॑ ब्र॒ध्नं वा॒वाता॒ वृष॑णा॒ हरी॒ इन्द्र॑म॒पसु॑ वक्षतः अ॒र्वाञ्चं॑ त्वा॒ सप्त॑योऽध्वर॒श्रियो॒ वह॑न्तु॒ सव॒नेदुप॑
verses.transliteration: úpa bradhnáṃ vāvā́tā vŕ̥ṣaṇā hárī  índram apásu vakṣataḥ  arvā́ñcaṃ tvā sáptayo 'dhvaraśríyo  váhantu sávanéd úpa

translation.text: To the brown juice may his dear vigorous Bay Steeds bring Indra, to our holy task. Hither let thy Car-steeds who seek the sacrifice bring thee to our drink-offerings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र पू॒षणं॑ वृणीमहे॒ युज्या॑य पुरू॒वसु॑म् स श॑क्र शिक्ष पुरुहूत नो धि॒या तुजे॑ रा॒ये वि॑मोचन
verses.transliteration: prá pūṣáṇaṃ vr̥ṇīmahe  yújyāya purūvásum  sá śakra śikṣa puruhūta no dhiyā́  túje rāyé vimocana

translation.text: Pûshan, the Lord of ample wealth, for firm alliance we elect. May he with wisdom, Ṣakra! Looser! Much-invoked! aid us to riches and to seed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सं नः॑ शिशीहि भु॒रिजो॑रिव क्षु॒रं रास्व॑ रा॒यो वि॑मोचन त्वे तन्नः॑ सु॒वेद॑मु॒स्रियं॒ वसु॒ यं त्वं हि॒नोषि॒ मर्त्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: sáṃ naḥ śiśīhi bhuríjor iva kṣuráṃ  rā́sva rāyó vimocana  tvé tán naḥ suvédam usríyam vásu  yáṃ tváṃ hinóṣi mártyam

translation.text: Sharpen us like a razor in the barber's hands: send riches thou who settest free. Easy to find with thee are treasures of the Dawn for mortal man whom thou dost speed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वेमि॑ त्वा पूषन्नृ॒ञ्जसे॒ वेमि॒ स्तोत॑व आघृणे न तस्य॑ वे॒म्यर॑णं॒ हि तद्व॑सो स्तु॒षे प॒ज्राय॒ साम्ने॑
verses.transliteration: vémi tvā pūṣann r̥ñjáse  vémi stótava āghr̥ṇe  ná tásya vemy áraṇaṃ hí tád vaso  stuṣé pajrā́ya sā́mne

translation.text: Pûshan, I long to win thy love, I long to praise thee, Radiant God. Excellent Lord, 'tis strange tome, no wish have I to sing the psalm that Pajra sings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: परा॒ गावो॒ यव॑सं॒ कच्चि॑दाघृणे॒ नित्यं॒ रेक्णो॑ अमर्त्य अ॒स्माकं॑ पूषन्नवि॒ता शि॒वो भ॑व॒ मंहि॑ष्ठो॒ वाज॑सातये
verses.transliteration: párā gā́vo yávasaṃ kác cid āghr̥ṇe  nítyaṃ rékṇo amartya  asmā́kam pūṣann avitā́ śivó bhava  máṃhiṣṭho vā́jasātaye

translation.text: My kine, O Radiant God, seek pasture where they will, my during wealth, Immortal One. Be our protector, Pûshan! be, most liberal Lord, propitious to our gathering strength.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्थू॒रं राधः॑ श॒ताश्वं॑ कुरु॒ङ्गस्य॒ दिवि॑ष्टिषु राज्ञ॑स्त्वे॒षस्य॑ सु॒भग॑स्य रा॒तिषु॑ तु॒र्वशे॑ष्वमन्महि
verses.transliteration: sthūráṃ rā́dhaḥ śatā́śvaṃ  kuruṅgásya díviṣṭiṣu  rā́jñas tveṣásya subhágasya rātíṣu  turváśeṣv amanmahi

translation.text: Rich was the gift Kurunga gave, a hundred steeds at morning rites. Among the gifts of Turvaṣas we thought of him, the opulent, the splendid King.

verses.sanskrit_deva: धी॒भिः सा॒तानि॑ का॒ण्वस्य॑ वा॒जिनः॑ प्रि॒यमे॑धैर॒भिद्यु॑भिः ष॒ष्टिं स॒हस्रानु॒ निर्म॑जामजे॒ निर्यू॒थानि॒ गवा॒मृषिः॑
verses.transliteration: dhībhíḥ sātā́ni kāṇvásya vājínaḥ  priyámedhair abhídyubhiḥ  ṣaṣṭíṃ sahásrā́nu nírmajām aje  nír yūthā́ni gávām ŕ̥ṣiḥ

translation.text: What by his morning songs Kaṇva, the powerful, hath, with the Priyamedhas, gained-

verses.sanskrit_deva: वृ॒क्षाश्चि॑न्मे अभिपि॒त्वे अ॑रारणुः गां भ॑जन्त मे॒हनाश्वं॑ भजन्त मे॒हना॑
verses.transliteration: vr̥kṣā́ś cin me abhipitvé arāraṇuḥ  gā́m bhajanta mehánā-  -áśvam bhajanta mehánā

translation.text: The very trees were joyful at my coming: kine they obtained in plenty, steeds in plenty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दू॒रादि॒हेव॒ यत्स॒त्य॑रु॒णप्सु॒रशि॑श्वितत् वि भा॒नुं वि॒श्वधा॑तनत्
verses.transliteration: dūrā́d ihéva yát satī́-  -aruṇápsur áśiśvitat  ví bhānúṃ viśvádhātanat

translation.text: WHEN, even as she were present here, red Dawn hath shone from far away, She spreadeth light on every side.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नृ॒वद्द॑स्रा मनो॒युजा॒ रथे॑न पृथु॒पाज॑सा सचे॑थे अश्विनो॒षस॑म्
verses.transliteration: nr̥vád dasrā manoyújā  ráthena pr̥thupā́jasā  sácethe aśvinoṣásam

translation.text: Like Heroes on your will-yoked car farshining, Wonder-Workers! ye Attend, O Aṣvins, on the Dawn.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वाभ्यां॑ वाजिनीवसू॒ प्रति॒ स्तोमा॑ अदृक्षत वाचं॑ दू॒तो यथो॑हिषे
verses.transliteration: yuvā́bhyāṃ vājinīvasū  práti stómā adr̥kṣata  vā́caṃ dūtó yáthohiṣe

translation.text: By you, O Lords of ample wealth our songs of praise have been observed: As envoy have I brought the prayer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पु॒रु॒प्रि॒या ण॑ ऊ॒तये॑ पुरुम॒न्द्रा पु॑रू॒वसू॑ स्तु॒षे कण्वा॑सो अ॒श्विना॑
verses.transliteration: purupriyā́ ṇa ūtáye  purumandrā́ purūvásū  stuṣé káṇvāso aśvínā

translation.text: Kaṇvas must praise the Aṣvins dear to many, making many glad, Most rich, that they may succour us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मंहि॑ष्ठा वाज॒सात॑मे॒षय॑न्ता शु॒भस्पती॑ गन्ता॑रा दा॒शुषो॑ गृ॒हम्
verses.transliteration: máṃhiṣṭhā vājasā́tamā-  -iṣáyantā śubhás pátī  gántārā dāśúṣo gr̥hám

translation.text: Most liberal, best at winning strength, inciters, Lords of splendour who Visit the worshipper's abode.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ता सु॑दे॒वाय॑ दा॒शुषे॑ सुमे॒धामवि॑तारिणीम् घृ॒तैर्गव्यू॑तिमुक्षतम्
verses.transliteration: tā́ sudevā́ya dāśúṣe  sumedhā́m ávitāriṇīm  ghr̥taír gávyūtim ukṣatam

translation.text: So for devout Sudeva dew with fatness his unfailing mead, And make it rich for sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नः॒ स्तोम॒मुप॑ द्र॒वत्तूयं॑ श्ये॒नेभि॑रा॒शुभिः॑ या॒तमश्वे॑भिरश्विना
verses.transliteration: ā́ na stómam úpa dravát  tū́yaṃ śyenébhir āśúbhiḥ  yātám áśvebhir aśvinā

translation.text: Hitherward running speedily with horses, as with rapid hawks, Come, Aṣvins, to our song of praise

verses.sanskrit_deva: येभि॑स्ति॒स्रः प॑रा॒वतो॑ दि॒वो विश्वा॑नि रोच॒ना त्रीँर॒क्तून्प॑रि॒दीय॑थः
verses.transliteration: yébhis tisráḥ parāváto  divó víśvāni rocanā́  trī́m̐r aktū́n paridī́yathaḥ

translation.text: Wherewith the three wide distances, and all the lights that are in heaven. Ye traverse, and three times of night.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त नो॒ गोम॑ती॒रिष॑ उ॒त सा॒तीर॑हर्विदा वि प॒थः सा॒तये॑ सितम्
verses.transliteration: utá no gómatīr íṣaḥ-  utá sātī́r aharvidā  ví patháḥ sātáye sitam

translation.text: O Finders of the Day, that we may win us food of kine and wealth, Open the paths for us to tread.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नो॒ गोम॑न्तमश्विना सु॒वीरं॑ सु॒रथं॑ र॒यिम् वो॒ळ्हमश्वा॑वती॒रिषः॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ no gómantam aśvinā  suvī́raṃ suráthaṃ rayím  voḷhám áśvāvatīr íṣaḥ

translation.text: O Aṣvins, bring us wealth in kine, in noble heroes, and in cars: Bring us the strength that horses give.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वा॒वृ॒धा॒ना शु॑भस्पती दस्रा॒ हिर॑ण्यवर्तनी पिब॑तं सो॒म्यं मधु॑
verses.transliteration: vāvr̥dhānā́ śubhas patī  dásrā híraṇyavartanī  píbataṃ somyám mádhu

translation.text: Ye Lords of splendour, glorified, ye Wonder-Workers borne on paths Of gold, drink sweets with Somajuice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्मभ्यं॑ वाजिनीवसू म॒घव॑द्भ्यश्च स॒प्रथः॑ छ॒र्दिर्य॑न्त॒मदा॑भ्यम्
verses.transliteration: asmábhyaṃ vājinīvasū  maghávadbhyaś ca sapráthaḥ  chardír yantam ádābhyam

translation.text: To us, ye Lords of ample wealth, and to our wealth chiefs extend Wide shelter, ne'er to be assailed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नि षु ब्रह्म॒ जना॑नां॒ यावि॑ष्टं॒ तूय॒मा ग॑तम् मो ष्व१॒॑न्याँ उपा॑रतम्
verses.transliteration: ní ṣú bráhma jánānāṃ  yā́viṣṭaṃ tū́yam ā́ gatam  mó ṣv ànyā́m̐ úpāratam

translation.text: Come quickly downward to the prayer of people whom ye favour most: Approach not unto other folk.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्य पि॑बतमश्विना यु॒वं मद॑स्य॒ चारु॑णः मध्वो॑ रा॒तस्य॑ धिष्ण्या
verses.transliteration: asyá pibatam aśvinā  yuvám mádasya cā́ruṇaḥ  mádhvo rātásya dhiṣṇyā

translation.text: Ye Aṣvins whom our minds perceive, drink of this lovely gladdening draught, The mcath which we present to you.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्मे आ व॑हतं र॒यिं श॒तव॑न्तं सह॒स्रिण॑म् पु॒रु॒क्षुं वि॒श्वधा॑यसम्
verses.transliteration: asmé ā́ vahataṃ rayíṃ  śatávantaṃ sahasríṇam  purukṣúṃ viśvádhāyasam

translation.text: Bring riches hither unto us in hundreds and in thousands, source Of plenteous food, sustaining all.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पु॒रु॒त्रा चि॒द्धि वां॑ नरा वि॒ह्वय॑न्ते मनी॒षिणः॑ वा॒घद्भि॑रश्वि॒ना ग॑तम्
verses.transliteration: purutrā́ cid dhí vāṃ narā  vihváyante manīṣíṇaḥ  vāghádbhir aśvinā́ gatam

translation.text: Verily sages call on you, ye Heroes, in full many a place. Moved by the priests, O Aṣvins, conic.

verses.sanskrit_deva: जना॑सो वृ॒क्तब॑र्हिषो ह॒विष्म॑न्तो अरं॒कृतः॑ यु॒वां ह॑वन्ते अश्विना
verses.transliteration: jánāso vr̥ktábarhiṣaḥ  havíṣmanto araṃkŕ̥taḥ  yuvā́ṃ havante aśvinā

translation.text: Men who have trimmed the sacred grass, bringing oblations and prepared, O Aṣvins, are invoking you.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्माक॑म॒द्य वा॑म॒यं स्तोमो॒ वाहि॑ष्ठो॒ अन्त॑मः यु॒वाभ्यां॑ भूत्वश्विना
verses.transliteration: asmā́kam adyá vām ayáṃ  stómo vā́hiṣṭho ántamaḥ  yuvā́bhyām bhūtv aśvinā

translation.text: May this our hymn of praise to-day, most powerful to bring you, be, O Aṣvins, nearest to your hearts.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो ह॑ वां॒ मधु॑नो॒ दृति॒राहि॑तो रथ॒चर्ष॑णे ततः॑ पिबतमश्विना
verses.transliteration: yó ha vām mádhuno dŕ̥tir  ā́hito rathacárṣaṇe  tátaḥ pibatam aśvinā

translation.text: The skin filled full of savoury meath, laid in the pathway of your car- O Aṣvins, drink ye both therefrom.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तेन॑ नो वाजिनीवसू॒ पश्वे॑ तो॒काय॒ शं गवे॑ वह॑तं॒ पीव॑री॒रिषः॑
verses.transliteration: téna no vājinīvasū  páśve tokā́ya śáṃ gáve  váhatam pī́varīr íṣaḥ

translation.text: For this, ye Lords of ample wealth, bring blessing for our herd, our kine, Our progeny, and plenteous food.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त नो॑ दि॒व्या इष॑ उ॒त सिन्धूँ॑रहर्विदा अप॒ द्वारे॑व वर्षथः
verses.transliteration: utá no divyā́ íṣaḥ-  utá síndhūm̐r aharvidā  ápa dvā́reva varṣathaḥ

translation.text: Ye too unclose to us like doors the strengthening waters of the sky, And rivers, ye who find the day.

verses.sanskrit_deva: क॒दा वां॑ तौ॒ग्र्यो वि॑धत्समु॒द्रे ज॑हि॒तो न॑रा यद्वां॒ रथो॒ विभि॒ष्पता॑त्
verses.transliteration: kadā́ vāṃ taugryó vidhat  samudré jahitó narā  yád vāṃ rátho víbhiṣ pátāt

translation.text: When did the son of' Tugra serve you, Men? Abandoned in the sea, That with winged steeds your car might fly.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वं कण्वा॑य नासत्या॒ ऋपि॑रिप्ताय ह॒र्म्ये शश्व॑दू॒तीर्द॑शस्यथः
verses.transliteration: yuváṃ káṇvāya nāsatyā  ŕ̥piriptāya harmyé  śáśvad ūtī́r daśasyathaḥ

translation.text: Ye, O Nâsatyas, ministered to Kaṇva with repeated aid, When cast into the heated pit.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ताभि॒रा या॑तमू॒तिभि॒र्नव्य॑सीभिः सुश॒स्तिभिः॑ यद्वां॑ वृषण्वसू हु॒वे
verses.transliteration: tā́bhir ā́ yātam ūtíbhir  návyasībhiḥ suśastíbhiḥ  yád vāṃ vr̥ṣaṇvasū huvé

translation.text: Come near with those most recent aids of yours which merit eulogy, When I invoke you, Wealthy Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यथा॑ चि॒त्कण्व॒माव॑तं प्रि॒यमे॑धमुपस्तु॒तम् अत्रिं॑ शि॒ञ्जार॑मश्विना
verses.transliteration: yáthā cit káṇvam ā́vatam  priyámedham upastutám  átriṃ śiñjā́ram aśvinā

translation.text: As ye protected Kaṇva erst, Priyamedha and Upastuta, Atri, Sinjara, Aṣvins Twain

verses.sanskrit_deva: यथो॒त कृत्व्ये॒ धनें॒ऽशुं गोष्व॒गस्त्य॑म् यथा॒ वाजे॑षु॒ सोभ॑रिम्
verses.transliteration: yáthotá kŕ̥tvye dháne  -aṃśúṃ góṣv agástyam  yáthā vā́jeṣu sóbharim

translation.text: And Anṣu in decisive fight, Agastya in the fray for kine. And, in his battles, Sobhari.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ताव॑द्वां वृषण्वसू॒ अतो॑ वा॒ भूयो॑ अश्विना गृ॒णन्तः॑ सु॒म्नमी॑महे
verses.transliteration: etā́vad vāṃ vr̥ṣaṇvasū  áto vā bhū́yo aśvinā  gr̥ṇántaḥ sumnám īmahe

translation.text: For so much bliss, or even more, O Aṣvins, Wealthy Gods, than this, We pray white singing hymns to you.

verses.sanskrit_deva: रथं॒ हिर॑ण्यवन्धुरं॒ हिर॑ण्याभीशुमश्विना आ हि स्थाथो॑ दिवि॒स्पृश॑म्
verses.transliteration: ráthaṃ híraṇyavandhuram  híraṇyābhīśum aśvinā  ā́ hí sthā́tho divispŕ̥śam

translation.text: Ascend your car with golden seat, O Aṣvins, and with reins of gold, That reaches even to the sky.

verses.sanskrit_deva: हि॒र॒ण्ययी॑ वां॒ रभि॑री॒षा अक्षो॑ हिर॒ण्ययः॑ उ॒भा च॒क्रा हि॑र॒ण्यया॑
verses.transliteration: hiraṇyáyī vāṃ rábhir  īṣā́ ákṣo hiraṇyáyaḥ  ubhā́ cakrā́ hiraṇyáyā

translation.text: Golden is its supporting shaft, the axle also is of gold, And both the wheels are made of gold.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तेन॑ नो वाजिनीवसू परा॒वत॑श्चि॒दा ग॑तम् उपे॒मां सु॑ष्टु॒तिं मम॑
verses.transliteration: téna no vājinīvasū  parāvátaś cid ā́ gatam  úpemā́ṃ suṣṭutím máma

translation.text: Thereon, ye Lords of ample wealth, come to us even from afar, Come ye to this mine eulogy.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ व॑हेथे परा॒कात्पू॒र्वीर॒श्नन्ता॑वश्विना इषो॒ दासी॑रमर्त्या
verses.transliteration: ā́ vahethe parākā́t  pūrvī́r aśnántāv aśvinā  íṣo dā́sīr amartyā

translation.text: From far away ye come to us, Aṣvins, enjoying plenteous food Of Dâsas, O Immortal Ones.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नो॑ द्यु॒म्नैरा श्रवो॑भि॒रा रा॒या या॑तमश्विना पुरु॑श्चन्द्रा॒ नास॑त्या
verses.transliteration: ā́ no dyumnaír ā́ śrávobhir  ā́ rāyā́ yātam aśvinā  púruścandrā nā́satyā

translation.text: With splendour, riches, and renown, O Aṣvins, hither come to us, Nâsatyas, shining brilliantly.

verses.sanskrit_deva: एह वां॑ प्रुषि॒तप्स॑वो॒ वयो॑ वहन्तु प॒र्णिनः॑ अच्छा॑ स्वध्व॒रं जन॑म्
verses.transliteration: éhá vām pruṣitápsavo  váyo vahantu parṇínaḥ  áchā svadhvaráṃ jánam

translation.text: May dappled horses, steeds who fly with pinions, bring you hitherward To people skilled in sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: रथं॑ वा॒मनु॑गायसं॒ य इ॒षा वर्त॑ते स॒ह न च॒क्रम॒भि बा॑धते
verses.transliteration: ráthaṃ vām ánugāyasaṃ  yá iṣā́ vártate sahá  ná cakrám abhí bādhate

translation.text: The whcel delayeth not that car of yours accompanied by song, That cometh with a store of food.

verses.sanskrit_deva: हि॒र॒ण्यये॑न॒ रथे॑न द्र॒वत्पा॑णिभि॒रश्वैः॑ धीज॑वना॒ नास॑त्या
verses.transliteration: hiraṇyáyena ráthena  dravátpāṇibhir áśvaiḥ  dhī́javanā nā́satyā

translation.text: Borne on that chariot wrought of gold, with coursers very fleet of foot, Come, O Nâsatyas, swift as thought.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वं मृ॒गं जा॑गृ॒वांसं॒ स्वद॑थो वा वृषण्वसू ता नः॑ पृङ्क्तमि॒षा र॒यिम्
verses.transliteration: yuvám mr̥gáṃ jāgr̥vā́ṃsaṃ  svádatho vā vr̥ṣaṇvasū  tā́ naḥ pr̥ṅktam iṣā́ rayím

translation.text: O Wealthy Gods, ye taste and find the brisk and watchful wild beast good. Associate wealth with food for us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ता मे॑ अश्विना सनी॒नां वि॒द्यातं॒ नवा॑नाम् यथा॑ चिच्चै॒द्यः क॒शुः श॒तमुष्ट्रा॑नां॒ दद॑त्स॒हस्रा॒ दश॒ गोना॑म्
verses.transliteration: tā́ me aśvinā sanīnā́ṃ  vidyā́taṃ návānām  yáthā cic caidyáḥ kaśúḥ  śatám úṣṭrānāṃ dádat  sahásrā dáśa gónām

translation.text: As such, O Aṣvins, find for me my share of new-presented gifts, As Kaṣu, Chedi's son, gave me a hundred head of buffaloes, and ten thousand kine.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो मे॒ हिर॑ण्यसंदृशो॒ दश॒ राज्ञो॒ अमं॑हत अ॒ध॒स्प॒दा इच्चै॒द्यस्य॑ कृ॒ष्टय॑श्चर्म॒म्ना अ॒भितो॒ जनाः॑
verses.transliteration: yó me híraṇyasaṃdr̥śo  dáśa rā́jño ámaṃhata  adhaspadā́ íc caidyásya kr̥ṣṭáyaś  carmamnā́ abhíto jánāḥ

translation.text: He who hath given me for mine own ten Kings like gold to look upon. At Caidya's feet are all the people round about, all those who think upon the shield.

verses.sanskrit_deva: माकि॑रे॒ना प॒था गा॒द्येने॒मे यन्ति॑ चे॒दयः॑ अ॒न्यो नेत्सू॒रिरोह॑ते भूरि॒दाव॑त्तरो॒ जनः॑
verses.transliteration: mā́kir enā́ pathā́ gād  yénemé yánti cedáyaḥ  anyó nét sūrír óhate  bhūridā́vattaro jánaḥ

translation.text: No man, not any, goes upon the path on which the Chedis walk. No other prince, no folk is held more liberal of gifts than they.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒हाँ इन्द्रो॒ य ओज॑सा प॒र्जन्यो॑ वृष्टि॒माँ इ॑व स्तोमै॑र्व॒त्सस्य॑ वावृधे
verses.transliteration: mahā́m̐ índro yá ójasā  parjányo vr̥ṣṭimā́m̐ iva  stómair vatsásya vāvr̥dhe

translation.text: INDRA, great in his power and might, and like Parjanya rich in rain, Is magnified by Vatsa's lauds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र॒जामृ॒तस्य॒ पिप्र॑तः॒ प्र यद्भर॑न्त॒ वह्न॑यः विप्रा॑ ऋ॒तस्य॒ वाह॑सा
verses.transliteration: prajā́m r̥tásya píprataḥ  prá yád bháranta váhnayaḥ  víprā r̥tásya vā́hasā

translation.text: When the priests, strengthening the Son of Holy Law, present their gifts, Singers with Order's hymn of praiser.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कण्वा॒ इन्द्रं॒ यदक्र॑त॒ स्तोमै॑र्य॒ज्ञस्य॒ साध॑नम् जा॒मि ब्रु॑वत॒ आयु॑धम्
verses.transliteration: káṇvā índraṃ yád ákrata  stómair yajñásya sā́dhanam  jāmí bruvata ā́yudham

translation.text: Since Kaṇvas with their lauds have made Indra complete the sacrifice. Words are their own appropriate arms.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सम॑स्य म॒न्यवे॒ विशो॒ विश्वा॑ नमन्त कृ॒ष्टयः॑ स॒मु॒द्राये॑व॒ सिन्ध॑वः
verses.transliteration: sám asya manyáve víśo  víśvā namanta kr̥ṣṭáyaḥ  samudrā́yeva síndhavaḥ

translation.text: Before his hot displeasure all the peoples, all the men, bow down, As rivers bow them to the sea.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ओज॒स्तद॑स्य तित्विष उ॒भे यत्स॒मव॑र्तयत् इन्द्र॒श्चर्मे॑व॒ रोद॑सी
verses.transliteration: ójas tád asya titviṣe-  ubhé yád samávartayat  índraś cármeva ródasī

translation.text: This power of his shone brightly forth when Indra brought together, like A skin, the worlds of heaven and earth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि चि॑द्वृ॒त्रस्य॒ दोध॑तो॒ वज्रे॑ण श॒तप॑र्वणा शिरो॑ बिभेद वृ॒ष्णिना॑
verses.transliteration: ví cid vr̥trásya dódhato  vájreṇa śatáparvaṇā  śíro bibheda vr̥ṣṇínā

translation.text: The fiercely-moving Vr̥itra's head he severed with his thunderbolt, His mighty hundred-knotted bolt.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मा अ॒भि प्र णो॑नुमो वि॒पामग्रे॑षु धी॒तयः॑ अ॒ग्नेः शो॒चिर्न दि॒द्युतः॑
verses.transliteration: imā́ abhí prá ṇonumo  vipā́m ágreṣu dhītáyaḥ  agnéḥ śocír ná didyútaḥ

translation.text: Here are-we sing them loudly forth-our thoughts among-the best of songs. Even lightnings like the blaze of fire.

verses.sanskrit_deva: गुहा॑ स॒तीरुप॒ त्मना॒ प्र यच्छोच॑न्त धी॒तयः॑ कण्वा॑ ऋ॒तस्य॒ धार॑या
verses.transliteration: gúhā satī́r úpa tmánā  prá yác chócanta dhītáyaḥ  káṇvā r̥tásya dhā́rayā

translation.text: When bidden thoughts, spontaneously advancing, glow, and with the stream Of sacrifice the Kaṇvas shine.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र तमि॑न्द्र नशीमहि र॒यिं गोम॑न्तम॒श्विन॑म् प्र ब्रह्म॑ पू॒र्वचि॑त्तये
verses.transliteration: prá tám indra naśīmahi  rayíṃ gómantam aśvínam  prá bráhma pūrvácittaye

translation.text: Indra, may we obtain that wealth in horses and in herds of cows, And prayer that may be noticed first.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒हमिद्धि पि॒तुष्परि॑ मे॒धामृ॒तस्य॑ ज॒ग्रभ॑ अ॒हं सूर्य॑ इवाजनि
verses.transliteration: ahám íd dhí pitúṣ pári  medhā́m r̥tásya jagrábha  aháṃ sū́rya ivājani

translation.text: I from my Father have received deep knowledge of the Holy Law I was born like unto the Sun.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒हं प्र॒त्नेन॒ मन्म॑ना॒ गिरः॑ शुम्भामि कण्व॒वत् येनेन्द्रः॒ शुष्म॒मिद्द॒धे
verses.transliteration: ahám pratnéna mánmanā  gíraḥ śumbhāmi kaṇvavát  yénéndraḥ śúṣmam íd dadhé

translation.text: After the lore of ancient time I make, like Kaṇva, beauteous songs, And Indra's selfgains strength thereby.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ये त्वामि॑न्द्र॒ न तु॑ष्टु॒वुर्ऋष॑यो॒ ये च॑ तुष्टु॒वुः ममेद्व॑र्धस्व॒ सुष्टु॑तः
verses.transliteration: yé tvā́m indra ná tuṣṭuvúr  ŕ̥ṣayo yé ca tuṣṭuvúḥ  máméd vardhasva súṣṭutaḥ

translation.text: Whatever R̥ishis have not praised thee, Indra, or have lauded thee, By me exalted wax thou strong.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यद॑स्य म॒न्युरध्व॑नी॒द्वि वृ॒त्रं प॑र्व॒शो रु॒जन् अ॒पः स॑मु॒द्रमैर॑यत्
verses.transliteration: yád asya manyúr ádhvanīd  ví vr̥trám parvaśó ruján  apáḥ samudrám aírayat

translation.text: When his wrath thundered, when he rent Vr̥itra to pieces, limb by limb, He sent the waters to the sea.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नि शुष्ण॑ इन्द्र धर्ण॒सिं वज्रं॑ जघन्थ॒ दस्य॑वि वृषा॒ ह्यु॑ग्र शृण्वि॒षे
verses.transliteration: ní śúṣṇa indra dharṇasíṃ  vájraṃ jaghantha dásyavi  vŕ̥ṣā hy ùgra śr̥ṇviṣé

translation.text: Against the Dasyu gusna thou, Indra, didst hurl thy during bolt: Thou, Dread one, hast a hero's fame.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न द्याव॒ इन्द्र॒मोज॑सा॒ नान्तरि॑क्षाणि व॒ज्रिण॑म् न वि॑व्यचन्त॒ भूम॑यः
verses.transliteration: ná dyā́va índram ójasā  nā́ntárikṣāṇi vajríṇam  ná vivyacanta bhū́mayaḥ

translation.text: Neither the heavens nor firmaments nor regions of the earth contain Indra, the Thunderer with his might.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्त॑ इन्द्र म॒हीर॒पः स्त॑भू॒यमा॑न॒ आश॑यत् नि तं पद्या॑सु शिश्नथः
verses.transliteration: yás ta indra mahī́r apáḥ-  stabhūyámāna ā́śayat  ní tám pádyāsu śiśnathaḥ

translation.text: O Indra him who lay at length staying thy copious waters thou, In his own footsteps, smotest down

verses.sanskrit_deva: य इ॒मे रोद॑सी म॒ही स॑मी॒ची स॒मज॑ग्रभीत् तमो॑भिरिन्द्र॒ तं गु॑हः
verses.transliteration: yá imé ródasī mahī́  samīcī́ samájagrabhīt  támobhir indra táṃ guhaḥ

translation.text: Thou hiddest deep in darkness itim, O Indra, who had set his grasp On spacious heaven and earth conjoined.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य इ॑न्द्र॒ यत॑यस्त्वा॒ भृग॑वो॒ ये च॑ तुष्टु॒वुः ममेदु॑ग्र श्रुधी॒ हव॑म्
verses.transliteration: yá indra yátayas tvā  bhŕ̥gavo yé ca tuṣṭuvúḥ  máméd ugra śrudhī hávam

translation.text: Indra, whatever Yatis and Bhr̥igus have offered praise to thee, Listen, thou Mighty, to my call.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मास्त॑ इन्द्र॒ पृश्न॑यो घृ॒तं दु॑हत आ॒शिर॑म् ए॒नामृ॒तस्य॑ पि॒प्युषीः॑
verses.transliteration: imā́s ta indra pŕ̥śnayo  ghr̥táṃ duhata āśíram  enā́m r̥tásya pipyúṣīḥ

translation.text: Indra, these spotted cows yield thee their butter and the milky draught; Aiders, thereby, of sacrifice;

verses.sanskrit_deva: या इ॑न्द्र प्र॒स्व॑स्त्वा॒सा गर्भ॒मच॑क्रिरन् परि॒ धर्मे॑व॒ सूर्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: yā́ indra prasvàs tvā-  -āsā́ gárbham ácakriran  pári dhármeva sū́ryam

translation.text: Which, teeming, have received thee as a life-germ, Indra, with their mouth, Like Sûrya who sustaineth all.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वामिच्छ॑वसस्पते॒ कण्वा॑ उ॒क्थेन॑ वावृधुः त्वां सु॒तास॒ इन्द॑वः
verses.transliteration: tvā́m íc chavasas pate  káṇvā ukthéna vāvr̥dhuḥ  tvā́ṃ sutā́sa índavaḥ

translation.text: O Lord of Might, with hymns of praise the Kaṇvas have increased thy power, The drops poured forth have strengthened thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तवेदि॑न्द्र॒ प्रणी॑तिषू॒त प्रश॑स्तिरद्रिवः य॒ज्ञो वि॑तन्त॒साय्यः॑
verses.transliteration: távéd indra práṇītiṣu-  -utá práśastir adrivaḥ  yajñó vitantasā́yyaḥ

translation.text: Under thy guidance, Indra, mid thy praises, Lord of Thunder, shall The sacrifice be soon performed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ न॑ इन्द्र म॒हीमिषं॒ पुरं॒ न द॑र्षि॒ गोम॑तीम् उ॒त प्र॒जां सु॒वीर्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: ā́ na indra mahī́m íṣam  púraṃ ná darṣi gómatīm  utá prajā́ṃ suvī́ryam

translation.text: Indra, disclose much food for us, like a stronghold with store of kine: Give progeny and heroic strength.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त त्यदा॒श्वश्व्यं॒ यदि॑न्द्र॒ नाहु॑षी॒ष्वा अग्रे॑ वि॒क्षु प्र॒दीद॑यत्
verses.transliteration: utá tyád āśváśvyam  yád indra nā́huṣīṣv ā́m̐  ágre vikṣú pradī́dayat

translation.text: And, Indra, grant us all that wealth of fleet steeds which shone bright of old Among the tribes of Nahushas.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भि व्र॒जं न त॑त्निषे॒ सूर॑ उपा॒कच॑क्षसम् यदि॑न्द्र मृ॒ळया॑सि नः
verses.transliteration: abhí vrajáṃ ná tatniṣe  sū́ra upākácakṣasam  yád indra mr̥ḷáyāsi naḥ

translation.text: Hither thou seemest to attract heaven's fold which shines before our eyes, When, Indra, thou art kind to us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यद॒ङ्ग त॑विषी॒यस॒ इन्द्र॑ प्र॒राज॑सि क्षि॒तीः म॒हाँ अ॑पा॒र ओज॑सा
verses.transliteration: yád aṅgá taviṣīyáse-  índra prarā́jasi kṣitī́ḥ  mahā́m̐ apārá ójasā

translation.text: Yea, when thou puttest forth thy power, Indra, thou governest the folk. Mighty, unlimited in strength.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं त्वा॑ ह॒विष्म॑ती॒र्विश॒ उप॑ ब्रुवत ऊ॒तये॑ उ॒रु॒ज्रय॑स॒मिन्दु॑भिः
verses.transliteration: táṃ tvā havíṣmatīr víśaḥ-  úpa bruvata ūtáye  urujráyasam índubhiḥ

translation.text: The tribes who bring oblations call to thee, to thee to give them help, With drops to thee who spreadest far.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒प॒ह्व॒रे गि॑री॒णां सं॑ग॒थे च॑ न॒दीना॑म् धि॒या विप्रो॑ अजायत
verses.transliteration: upahvaré girīṇā́ṃ  saṃgathé ca nadī́nām  dhiyā́ vípro ajāyata

translation.text: There where the mountains downward slope, there by the meeting of the streams The Sage was manifest with song.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अतः॑ समु॒द्रमु॒द्वत॑श्चिकि॒त्वाँ अव॑ पश्यति यतो॑ विपा॒न एज॑ति
verses.transliteration: átaḥ samudrám udvátaś  cikitvā́m̐ áva paśyati  yáto vipāná éjati

translation.text: Thence, marking, from his lofty place downward he looks upon the sea, And thence with rapid stir he moves.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आदित्प्र॒त्नस्य॒ रेत॑सो॒ ज्योति॑ष्पश्यन्ति वास॒रम् प॒रो यदि॒ध्यते॑ दि॒वा
verses.transliteration: ā́d ít pratnásya rétaso  jyótiṣ paśyanti vāsarám  paró yád idhyáte divā́

translation.text: Then, verify, they see the light refulgent of primeval seed, Kindled on yonder side of heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कण्वा॑स इन्द्र ते म॒तिं विश्वे॑ वर्धन्ति॒ पौंस्य॑म् उ॒तो श॑विष्ठ॒ वृष्ण्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: káṇvāsa indra te matíṃ  víśve vardhanti paúṃsyam  utó śaviṣṭha vŕ̥ṣṇyam

translation.text: Indra, the Kaṇvas all exalt thy wisdom and thy manly power, And, Mightiest! thine heroic strength.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मां म॑ इन्द्र सुष्टु॒तिं जु॒षस्व॒ प्र सु माम॑व उ॒त प्र व॑र्धया म॒तिम्
verses.transliteration: imā́m ma indra suṣṭutíṃ  juṣásva prá sú mā́m ava  utá prá vardhayā matím

translation.text: Accept this eulogy of mine, Indra, and guard me carefully: Strengthen my thought and prosper it.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त ब्र॑ह्म॒ण्या व॒यं तुभ्यं॑ प्रवृद्ध वज्रिवः विप्रा॑ अतक्ष्म जी॒वसे॑
verses.transliteration: utá brahmaṇyā́ vayáṃ  túbhyam pravr̥ddha vajrivaḥ  víprā atakṣma jīváse

translation.text: For thee, O Mighty, Thunder-armed, we singers through devotionhave Fashioned the hymn that we may live.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भि कण्वा॑ अनूष॒तापो॒ न प्र॒वता॑ य॒तीः इन्द्रं॒ वन॑न्वती म॒तिः
verses.transliteration: abhí káṇvā anūṣata-  -ā́po ná pravátā yatī́ḥ  índraṃ vánanvatī matíḥ

translation.text: To Indra have the Kaṇvas sung, like waters speeding down a slope: The song is fain to go to him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॑मु॒क्थानि॑ वावृधुः समु॒द्रमि॑व॒ सिन्ध॑वः अनु॑त्तमन्युम॒जर॑म्
verses.transliteration: índram ukthā́ni vāvr̥dhuḥ  samudrám iva síndhavaḥ  ánuttamanyum ajáram

translation.text: As rivers swell the ocean, so our hymns of praise make Indra strong, Eternal, of resistIess wrath.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नो॑ याहि परा॒वतो॒ हरि॑भ्यां हर्य॒ताभ्या॑म् इ॒ममि॑न्द्र सु॒तं पि॑ब
verses.transliteration: ā́ no yāhi parāváto  háribhyāṃ haryatā́bhyām  imám indra sutám piba

translation.text: Come with thy lovely Bay Steeds, come to us from regions far away O Indra, drink this Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वामिद्वृ॑त्रहन्तम॒ जना॑सो वृ॒क्तब॑र्हिषः हव॑न्ते॒ वाज॑सातये
verses.transliteration: tvā́m íd vr̥trahantama  jánāso vr̥ktábarhiṣaḥ  hávante vā́jasātaye

translation.text: Best slayer of Vr̥itras, men whose sacred grass is ready trimmed Invoke thee for the gain of spoil.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अनु॑ त्वा॒ रोद॑सी उ॒भे च॒क्रं न व॒र्त्येत॑शम् अनु॑ सुवा॒नास॒ इन्द॑वः
verses.transliteration: ánu tvā ródasī ubhé  cakráṃ ná varty étaśam  ánu suvānā́sa índavaḥ

translation.text: The heavens and earth come after thee as the wheel follows Etaṣa: To thee flow Sorna-drops effused.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मन्द॑स्वा॒ सु स्व॑र्णर उ॒तेन्द्र॑ शर्य॒णाव॑ति मत्स्वा॒ विव॑स्वतो म॒ती
verses.transliteration: mándasvā sú svàrṇare-  uténdra śaryaṇā́vati  mátsvā vívasvato matī́

translation.text: Rejoice, O Indra, in the light, rejoice in Ṣaryaṇâvân, be Glad in the sacrificer's hymn.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वा॒वृ॒धा॒न उप॒ द्यवि॒ वृषा॑ व॒ज्र्य॑रोरवीत् वृ॒त्र॒हा सो॑म॒पात॑मः
verses.transliteration: vāvr̥dhāná úpa dyávi  vŕ̥ṣā vajry àroravīt  vr̥trahā́ somapā́tamaḥ

translation.text: Grown strong in heaven, the Thunder-armed hath bellowed, Vr̥itra-slayer, Bull, Chief drinker of the Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋषि॒र्हि पू॑र्व॒जा अस्येक॒ ईशा॑न॒ ओज॑सा इन्द्र॑ चोष्कू॒यसे॒ वसु॑
verses.transliteration: ŕ̥ṣir hí pūrvajā́ ási-  éka ī́śāna ójasā  índra coṣkūyáse vásu

translation.text: Thou art a R̥ishi born of old, sole Ruler over all by might: Thou, Indra, guardest well our wealth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्माकं॑ त्वा सु॒ताँ उप॑ वी॒तपृ॑ष्ठा अ॒भि प्रयः॑ श॒तं व॑हन्तु॒ हर॑यः
verses.transliteration: asmā́kaṃ tvā sutā́m̐ úpa  vītápr̥ṣṭhā abhí práyaḥ  śatáṃ vahantu hárayaḥ

translation.text: May thy Bay Steeds with beauteous backs, a hundred, bring thee to the feast, Bring thee to these our Soma-draughts.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मां सु पू॒र्व्यां धियं॒ मधो॑र्घृ॒तस्य॑ पि॒प्युषी॑म् कण्वा॑ उ॒क्थेन॑ वावृधुः
verses.transliteration: imā́ṃ sú pūrvyā́ṃ dhíyam  mádhor ghr̥tásya pipyúṣīm  káṇvā ukthéna vāvr̥dhuḥ

translation.text: The Kaṇvas with their hymns of praise have magnified this ancient thought That swells with streams of meath and oil.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॒मिद्विम॑हीनां॒ मेधे॑ वृणीत॒ मर्त्यः॑ इन्द्रं॑ सनि॒ष्युरू॒तये॑
verses.transliteration: índram íd vímahīnām  médhe vr̥ṇīta mártyaḥ  índraṃ saniṣyúr ūtáye

translation.text: Mid mightiest Gods let mortal man choose Indra at the sacrifice, Indra, whoe'er would win, for help.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒र्वाञ्चं॑ त्वा पुरुष्टुत प्रि॒यमे॑धस्तुता॒ हरी॑ सो॒म॒पेया॑य वक्षतः
verses.transliteration: arvā́ñcaṃ tvā puruṣṭuta  priyámedhastutā hárī  somapéyāya vakṣataḥ

translation.text: Thy steeds, by Priyamedhas praised, shall bring thee, God whom all invoke, Hither to drink the Somajuice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श॒तम॒हं ति॒रिन्दि॑रे स॒हस्रं॒ पर्शा॒वा द॑दे राधां॑सि॒ याद्वा॑नाम्
verses.transliteration: śatám aháṃ tiríndire  sahásram párśāv ā́ dade  rā́dhāṃsi yā́dvānām

translation.text: A hundred thousand have I gained from Parṣu, from Tirindira, And presents of the Yadavas.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्रीणि॑ श॒तान्यर्व॑तां स॒हस्रा॒ दश॒ गोना॑म् द॒दुष्प॒ज्राय॒ साम्ने॑
verses.transliteration: trī́ṇi śatā́ny árvatāṃ  sahásrā dáśa gónām  dadúṣ pajrā́ya sā́mne

translation.text: Ten thousand head of kine, and steeds three times a hundred they bestowed On Pajra for the Sâma-song.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उदा॑नट् ककु॒हो दिव॒मुष्ट्रा॑ञ्चतु॒र्युजो॒ दद॑त् श्रव॑सा॒ याद्वं॒ जन॑म्
verses.transliteration: úd ānaṭ kakuhó dívam  úṣṭrāñ caturyújo dádat  śrávasā yā́dvaṃ jánam

translation.text: Kakuha hath reached up to heaven, bestowing buffaloes yoked in fours, And matched in fame the Yadavas.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र यद्व॑स्त्रि॒ष्टुभ॒मिषं॒ मरु॑तो॒ विप्रो॒ अक्ष॑रत् वि पर्व॑तेषु राजथ
verses.transliteration: prá yád vas triṣṭúbham íṣam  máruto vípro ákṣarat  ví párvateṣu rājatha

translation.text: O MARUTS, when the sage hath poured the Trishṭup forth as food for you, Ye shine amid the mountain-clouds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यद॒ङ्ग त॑विषीयवो॒ यामं॑ शुभ्रा॒ अचि॑ध्वम् नि पर्व॑ता अहासत
verses.transliteration: yád aṅgá taviṣīyavo  yā́maṃ śubhrā ácidhvam  ní párvatā ahāsata

translation.text: When, Bright Ones, fain to show your might ye have determined on your course, The mountain-clouds have bent them down.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उदी॑रयन्त वा॒युभि॑र्वा॒श्रासः॒ पृश्नि॑मातरः धु॒क्षन्त॑ पि॒प्युषी॒मिष॑म्
verses.transliteration: úd īrayanta vāyúbhir  vāśrā́saḥ pŕ̥śnimātaraḥ  dhukṣánta pipyúṣīm íṣam

translation.text: Loud roaring with the winds the Sons of Pr̥iṣni have upraised themselves: They have poured out the streaming food.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वप॑न्ति म॒रुतो॒ मिहं॒ प्र वे॑पयन्ति॒ पर्व॑तान् यद्यामं॒ यान्ति॑ वा॒युभिः॑
verses.transliteration: vápanti marúto míham  prá vepayanti párvatān  yád yā́maṃ yā́nti vāyúbhiḥ

translation.text: The Maruts spread the mist abroad and make mountains rock and reel, When with the winds they go their way

verses.sanskrit_deva: नि यद्यामा॑य वो गि॒रिर्नि सिन्ध॑वो॒ विध॑र्मणे म॒हे शुष्मा॑य येमि॒रे
verses.transliteration: ní yád yā́māya vo girír  ní síndhavo vídharmaṇe  mahé śúṣmāya yemiré

translation.text: What time the rivers and the hills before your coming bowed them down, So to sustain your mighty force.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒ष्माँ उ॒ नक्त॑मू॒तये॑ यु॒ष्मान्दिवा॑ हवामहे यु॒ष्मान्प्र॑य॒त्य॑ध्व॒रे
verses.transliteration: yuṣmā́m̐ u náktam ūtáye  yuṣmā́n dívā havāmahe  yuṣmā́n prayaty àdhvaré

translation.text: We call on you for aid by night, on you for succour in the day, On you while sacrifice proceeds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उदु॒ त्ये अ॑रु॒णप्स॑वश्चि॒त्रा यामे॑भिरीरते वा॒श्रा अधि॒ ष्णुना॑ दि॒वः
verses.transliteration: úd u tyé aruṇápsavaś  citrā́ yā́mebhir īrate  vāśrā́ ádhi ṣṇúnā diváḥ

translation.text: These, verily, wondrous, red of hue, speed on their courses with a roar Over the ridges of the sky.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सृ॒जन्ति॑ र॒श्मिमोज॑सा॒ पन्थां॒ सूर्या॑य॒ यात॑वे ते भा॒नुभि॒र्वि त॑स्थिरे
verses.transliteration: sr̥jánti raśmím ójasā  pánthāṃ sū́ryāya yā́tave  té bhānúbhir ví tasthire

translation.text: With might they drop the loosened rein so that the Sun may run his course, And spread themselves with beams of light.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मां मे॑ मरुतो॒ गिर॑मि॒मं स्तोम॑मृभुक्षणः इ॒मं मे॑ वनता॒ हव॑म्
verses.transliteration: imā́m me maruto gíram  imáṃ stómam r̥bhukṣaṇaḥ  imám me vanatā hávam

translation.text: Accept, ye Maruts, this my song, accept ye this mine hymn of praise, Accept, R̥ibhukshans, this my call.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्रीणि॒ सरां॑सि॒ पृश्न॑यो दुदु॒ह्रे व॒ज्रिणे॒ मधु॑ उत्सं॒ कव॑न्धमु॒द्रिण॑म्
verses.transliteration: trī́ṇi sárāṃsi pŕ̥śnayo  duduhré vajríṇe mádhu  útsaṃ kávandham udríṇam

translation.text: The dappled Cows have poured three lakes, meath for the Thunder-wielding God, From the great cask, the watery cloud.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मरु॑तो॒ यद्ध॑ वो दि॒वः सु॑म्ना॒यन्तो॒ हवा॑महे आ तू न॒ उप॑ गन्तन
verses.transliteration: máruto yád dha vo diváḥ  sumnāyánto hávāmahe  ā́ tū́ na úpa gantana

translation.text: O Maruts, quickly come to us when, longing for felicity, We call you hither from the sky.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यू॒यं हि ष्ठा सु॑दानवो॒ रुद्रा॑ ऋभुक्षणो॒ दमे॑ उ॒त प्रचे॑तसो॒ मदे॑
verses.transliteration: yūyáṃ hí ṣṭhā́ sudānavaḥ  rúdrā r̥bhukṣaṇo dáme  utá prácetaso máde

translation.text: For, Rudras and R̥ibhukshans, ye, Most Bountiful, are in the house, Wise when the gladdening draught is drunk.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नो॑ र॒यिं म॑द॒च्युतं॑ पुरु॒क्षुं वि॒श्वधा॑यसम् इय॑र्ता मरुतो दि॒वः
verses.transliteration: ā́ no rayím madacyútam  purukṣúṃ viśvádhāyasam  íyartā maruto diváḥ

translation.text: O Maruts, send us down from heaven riches distilling rapturous joy, With plenteous food, sustaining all.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अधी॑व॒ यद्गि॑री॒णां यामं॑ शुभ्रा॒ अचि॑ध्वम् सु॒वा॒नैर्म॑न्दध्व॒ इन्दु॑भिः
verses.transliteration: ádhīva yád girīṇā́ṃ  yā́maṃ śubhrā ácidhvam  suvānaír mandadhva índubhiḥ

translation.text: When, Bright Ones, hither from the hills ye have resolved to take your way, Ye revel in the drops effused.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ताव॑तश्चिदेषां सु॒म्नं भि॑क्षेत॒ मर्त्यः॑ अदा॑भ्यस्य॒ मन्म॑भिः
verses.transliteration: etā́vataś cid eṣāṃ  sumnám bhikṣeta mártyaḥ  ádābhyasya mánmabhiḥ

translation.text: Man should solicit with his lauds happiness which belongs to them, So great a band invincible.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ये द्र॒प्सा इ॑व॒ रोद॑सी॒ धम॒न्त्यनु॑ वृ॒ष्टिभिः॑ उत्सं॑ दु॒हन्तो॒ अक्षि॑तम्
verses.transliteration: yé drapsā́ iva ródasī  dhámanty ánu vr̥ṣṭíbhiḥ  útsaṃ duhánto ákṣitam

translation.text: They who like fiery sparks with showers of rain blow through the heaven and earth, Milking the spring that never fails.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उदु॑ स्वा॒नेभि॑रीरत॒ उद्रथै॒रुदु॑ वा॒युभिः॑ उत्स्तोमैः॒ पृश्नि॑मातरः
verses.transliteration: úd u svānébhir īrate-  úd ráthair úd u vāyúbhiḥ  út stómaiḥ pŕ̥śnimātaraḥ

translation.text: With chariots and tumultuous roar, with tempests and with hymns of praise The Sons of Pr̥iṣni hurry forth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: येना॒व तु॒र्वशं॒ यदुं॒ येन॒ कण्वं॑ धन॒स्पृत॑म् रा॒ये सु तस्य॑ धीमहि
verses.transliteration: yénāvá turváśaṃ yáduṃ  yéna káṇvaṃ dhanaspŕ̥tam  rāyé sú tásya dhīmahi

translation.text: For wealth, we think of that whereby ye aided Yadu, Turvaṣa, And Kaṇva who obtained the spoil.
