verses.sanskrit_deva: सो अ॒द्धा दा॒श्व॑ध्व॒रोऽग्ने॒ मर्तः॑ सुभग॒ स प्र॒शंस्यः॑ स धी॒भिर॑स्तु॒ सनि॑ता
verses.transliteration: só addhā́ dāśvàdhvaraḥ-  -ágne mártaḥ subhaga sá praśáṃsyaḥ  sá dhībhír astu sánitā

translation.text: That man, moreover, merits praise who brings, auspicious Agni, sacrificial gifts May he win riches by his thoughts.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्य॒ त्वमू॒र्ध्वो अ॑ध्व॒राय॒ तिष्ठ॑सि क्ष॒यद्वी॑रः॒ स सा॑धते सो अर्व॑द्भिः॒ सनि॑ता॒ स वि॑प॒न्युभिः॒ स शूरैः॒ सनि॑ता कृ॒तम्
verses.transliteration: yásya tvám ūrdhvó adhvarā́ya tíṣṭhasi  kṣayádvīraḥ sá sādhate  só árvadbhiḥ sánitā sá vipanyúbhiḥ  sá śū́raiḥ sánitā kr̥tám

translation.text: He for whose sacrifice thou standest up erect is prosperous and rules o'er men. He wins with coursers and with singers killed in song: with heroes he obtains the prize.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्या॒ग्निर्वपु॑र्गृ॒हे स्तोमं॒ चनो॒ दधी॑त वि॒श्ववा॑र्यः ह॒व्या वा॒ वेवि॑ष॒द्विषः॑
verses.transliteration: yásyāgnír vápur gr̥hé  stómaṃ cáno dádhīta viśvávāryaḥ  havyā́ vā véviṣad víṣaḥ

translation.text: He in whose dwelling Agni is chief ornament, and, all-desired, loves his laud well, And zealously tends his offerings-

verses.sanskrit_deva: विप्र॑स्य वा स्तुव॒तः स॑हसो यहो म॒क्षूत॑मस्य रा॒तिषु॑ अ॒वोदे॑वमु॒परि॑मर्त्यं कृधि॒ वसो॑ विवि॒दुषो॒ वचः॑
verses.transliteration: víprasya vā stuvatáḥ sahaso yaho  makṣū́tamasya rātíṣu  avódevam upárimartyaṃ kr̥dhi  váso vividúṣo vácaḥ

translation.text: His, or the lauding sage's word, his, Son of Strength! who Is most prompt with sacred gifts, Set thou beneath the Gods, Vasu, above mankind, the speech of the intelligent.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो अ॒ग्निं ह॒व्यदा॑तिभि॒र्नमो॑भिर्वा सु॒दक्ष॑मा॒विवा॑सति गि॒रा वा॑जि॒रशो॑चिषम्
verses.transliteration: yó agníṃ havyádātibhir  námobhir vā sudákṣam āvívāsati  girā́ vājiráśociṣam

translation.text: He who with sacrificial gifts or homage bringeth very skilful Agni nigh, Or him who flashes fast with song,

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒मिधा॒ यो निशि॑ती॒ दाश॒ददि॑तिं॒ धाम॑भिरस्य॒ मर्त्यः॑ विश्वेत्स धी॒भिः सु॒भगो॒ जनाँ॒ अति॑ द्यु॒म्नैरु॒द्न इ॑व तारिषत्
verses.transliteration: samídhā yó níśitī dā́śad áditiṃ  dhā́mabhir asya mártyaḥ  víśvét sá dhībhíḥ subhágo jánām̐ áti  dyumnaír udná iva tāriṣat

translation.text: The mortal who with blazing fuel, as his laws command, adores the Perfect God, Blest with his thoughts in splendour shall exceed all men, as though he overpassed the floods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तद॑ग्ने द्यु॒म्नमा भ॑र॒ यत्सा॒सह॒त्सद॑ने॒ कं चि॑द॒त्रिण॑म् म॒न्युं जन॑स्य दू॒ढ्यः॑
verses.transliteration: tád agne dyumnám ā́ bhara  yát sāsáhat sádane káṃ cid atríṇam  manyúṃ jánasya dūḍhyàḥ

translation.text: Give us the splendour, Agni, which may overcome each greedy fiend in our abode, The wrath of evil-hearted folk.

verses.sanskrit_deva: येन॒ चष्टे॒ वरु॑णो मि॒त्रो अ॑र्य॒मा येन॒ नास॑त्या॒ भगः॑ व॒यं तत्ते॒ शव॑सा गातु॒वित्त॑मा॒ इन्द्र॑त्वोता विधेमहि
verses.transliteration: yéna cáṣṭe váruṇo mitró aryamā́  yéna nā́satyā bhágaḥ  vayáṃ tát te śávasā gātuvíttamāḥ-  índratvotā vidhemahi

translation.text: That, wherewith Mitra, Varuṇa, and Aryaman, the Aṣvins, Bhaga give us light, That may we, by thy power finding best furtherance, worship, O Indra, helped by thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ते घेद॑ग्ने स्वा॒ध्यो॒३॒॑ ये त्वा॑ विप्र निदधि॒रे नृ॒चक्ष॑सम् विप्रा॑सो देव सु॒क्रतु॑म्
verses.transliteration: té ghéd agne svādhyò  yé tvā vipra nidadhiré nr̥cákṣasam  víprāso deva sukrátum

translation.text: O Agni, most devout are they, the sages who have set thee Sage exceeding wise, O God, for men to look upon:

verses.sanskrit_deva: त इद्वेदिं॑ सुभग॒ त आहु॑तिं॒ ते सोतुं॑ चक्रिरे दि॒वि त इद्वाजे॑भिर्जिग्युर्म॒हद्धनं॒ ये त्वे कामं॑ न्येरि॒रे
verses.transliteration: tá íd védiṃ subhaga tá ā́hutiṃ  té sótuṃ cakrire diví  tá íd vā́jebhir jigyur mahád dhánaṃ  yé tvé kā́maṃ nyeriré

translation.text: Who have arranged thine altar Blessed God, at morn brought thine oblation, pressed the juice. They by their deeds of strength have won diem, mighty wealth, who have set all their hope in thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भ॒द्रो नो॑ अ॒ग्निराहु॑तो भ॒द्रा रा॒तिः सु॑भग भ॒द्रो अ॑ध्व॒रः भ॒द्रा उ॒त प्रश॑स्तयः
verses.transliteration: bhadró no agnír ā́huto  bhadrā́ rātíḥ subhaga bhadró adhvaráḥ  bhadrā́ utá práśastayaḥ

translation.text: -May Agni worshipped bring us bliss, may the gift, Blessed One, and sacrifice bring bliss; Yea, may our praises bring us bliss.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भ॒द्रं मनः॑ कृणुष्व वृत्र॒तूर्ये॒ येना॑ स॒मत्सु॑ सा॒सहः॑ अव॑ स्थि॒रा त॑नुहि॒ भूरि॒ शर्ध॑तां व॒नेमा॑ ते अ॒भिष्टि॑भिः
verses.transliteration: bhadrám mánaḥ kr̥ṇuṣva vr̥tratū́rye  yénā samátsu sāsáhaḥ  áva sthirā́ tanuhi bhū́ri śárdhatāṃ  vanémā te abhíṣṭibhiḥ

translation.text: Show forth the mind that brings success in war with fiends, wherewith thou conquerest in fight. Bring down the many firm hopes of our enemies, and let us vanquish with thine aid.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ईळे॑ गि॒रा मनु॑र्हितं॒ यं दे॒वा दू॒तम॑र॒तिं न्ये॑रि॒रे यजि॑ष्ठं हव्य॒वाह॑नम्
verses.transliteration: ī́ḷe girā́ mánurhitaṃ  yáṃ devā́ dūtám aratíṃ nyeriré  yájiṣṭhaṃ havyavā́hanam

translation.text: I praise with song the Friend of man, whom Gods sent down to be herald and messenger, Best worshipper, bearer of our gifts.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ति॒ग्मज॑म्भाय॒ तरु॑णाय॒ राज॑ते॒ प्रयो॑ गायस्य॒ग्नये॑ यः पिं॒शते॑ सू॒नृता॑भिः सु॒वीर्य॑म॒ग्निर्घृ॒तेभि॒राहु॑तः
verses.transliteration: tigmájambhāya táruṇāya rā́jate  práyo gāyasy agnáye  yáḥ piṃśáte sūnŕ̥tābhiḥ suvī́ryam  agnír ghr̥tébhir ā́hutaḥ

translation.text: Thou unto sharp-toothed Agni, Young and Radiant God, proclaimest with thy song the feast- Agni, who for our sweet strains moulds heroic strength when sacred oil is offered him,

verses.sanskrit_deva: यदी॑ घृ॒तेभि॒राहु॑तो॒ वाशी॑म॒ग्निर्भर॑त॒ उच्चाव॑ च असु॑र इव नि॒र्णिज॑म्
verses.transliteration: yádī ghr̥tébhir ā́huto  vā́śīm agnír bhárata úc cā́va ca  ásura iva nirṇíjam

translation.text: While, served with sacrificial oil, now upward and now downward Agni moves his sword, As doth the Asura his robe.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो ह॒व्यान्यैर॑यता॒ मनु॑र्हितो दे॒व आ॒सा सु॑ग॒न्धिना॑ विवा॑सते॒ वार्या॑णि स्वध्व॒रो होता॑ दे॒वो अम॑र्त्यः
verses.transliteration: yó havyā́ny aírayatā mánurhito  devá āsā́ sugandhínā  vívāsate vā́ryāṇi svadhvaró  hótā devó ámartyaḥ

translation.text: The God, the Friend of man, who bears our gifts to heaven, the God with his sweet-smelling mouth, Distributes, skilled in sacrifice, his precious things, Invoking Priest, Immortal God.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यद॑ग्ने॒ मर्त्य॒स्त्वं स्याम॒हं मि॑त्रमहो॒ अम॑र्त्यः सह॑सः सूनवाहुत
verses.transliteration: yád agne mártyas tváṃ  syā́m ahám mitramaho ámartyaḥ  sáhasaḥ sūnav āhuta

translation.text: Son of Strength, Agni, if thou wert the mortal, bright as Mitra, I worshipped with our gifts! And I were the Immortal God

verses.sanskrit_deva: न त्वा॑ रासीया॒भिश॑स्तये वसो॒ न पा॑प॒त्वाय॑ सन्त्य न मे॑ स्तो॒ताम॑ती॒वा न दुर्हि॑तः॒ स्याद॑ग्ने॒ न पा॒पया॑
verses.transliteration: ná tvā rāsīyābhíśastaye vaso  ná pāpatvā́ya santya  ná me stotā́matīvā́ ná dúrhitaḥ  syā́d agne ná pāpáyā

translation.text: I would not give thee up, Vasu, to calumny, or misery, O Bounteous One. My worshipper should feel no hunger or distress, nor, Agni, should he live in sin.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पि॒तुर्न पु॒त्रः सुभृ॑तो दुरो॒ण आ दे॒वाँ ए॑तु॒ प्र णो॑ ह॒विः
verses.transliteration: pitúr ná putráḥ súbhr̥to duroṇá~ā́  devā́m̐ etu prá ṇo havíḥ

translation.text: Like a son cherished in his father's houi§e, let our oblation rise unto the Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तवा॒हम॑ग्न ऊ॒तिभि॒र्नेदि॑ष्ठाभिः सचेय॒ जोष॒मा व॑सो सदा॑ दे॒वस्य॒ मर्त्यः॑
verses.transliteration: távāhám agna ūtíbhir  nédiṣṭhābhiḥ saceya jóṣam ā́ vaso  sádā devásya mártyaḥ

translation.text: With thine immediate aid may I, excellent Agni, ever gain my wish A mortal with a God to help.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तव॒ क्रत्वा॑ सनेयं॒ तव॑ रा॒तिभि॒रग्ने॒ तव॒ प्रश॑स्तिभिः त्वामिदा॑हुः॒ प्रम॑तिं वसो॒ ममाग्ने॒ हर्ष॑स्व॒ दात॑वे
verses.transliteration: táva krátvā saneyaṃ táva rātíbhir  ágne táva práśastibhiḥ  tvā́m íd āhuḥ prámatiṃ vaso máma-  -ágne hárṣasva dā́tave

translation.text: O Agni, by thy wisdom, by thy bounties, by thy leading may I gather wealth. Excellent Agni, thou art called my Providence: delight thou to be liberal.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र सो अ॑ग्ने॒ तवो॒तिभिः॑ सु॒वीरा॑भिस्तिरते॒ वाज॑भर्मभिः यस्य॒ त्वं स॒ख्यमा॒वरः॑
verses.transliteration: prá só agne távotíbhiḥ  suvī́rābhis tirate vā́jabharmabhiḥ  yásya tváṃ sakhyám āváraḥ

translation.text: Agni, he conquers by thine aid that brings him store of noble heroes and great strength, Whose bond of friendship is thy choice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तव॑ द्र॒प्सो नील॑वान्वा॒श ऋ॒त्विय॒ इन्धा॑नः सिष्ण॒वा द॑दे त्वं म॑ही॒नामु॒षसा॑मसि प्रि॒यः क्ष॒पो वस्तु॑षु राजसि
verses.transliteration: táva drapsó nī́lavān vāśá r̥tvíyaḥ-  índhānaḥ siṣṇav ā́ dade  tvám mahīnā́m uṣásām asi priyáḥ  kṣapó vástuṣu rājasi

translation.text: Thy spark is black and crackling, kindled in due time, O Bounteous, it is taken up. Thou art the dear Friend of the mighty Mornings: thou shinest in glimmerings of the night.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तमाग॑न्म॒ सोभ॑रयः स॒हस्र॑मुष्कं स्वभि॒ष्टिमव॑से स॒म्राजं॒ त्रास॑दस्यवम्
verses.transliteration: tám ā́ganma sóbharayaḥ  sahásramuṣkaṃ svabhiṣṭím ávase  samrā́jaṃ trā́sadasyavam

translation.text: We Sobharis have come to him, for succour, who is good to help with thousand powers, The Sovran, Trasadasyu's Friend.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्य॑ ते अग्ने अ॒न्ये अ॒ग्नय॑ उप॒क्षितो॑ व॒या इ॑व विपो॒ न द्यु॒म्ना नि यु॑वे॒ जना॑नां॒ तव॑ क्ष॒त्राणि॑ व॒र्धय॑न्
verses.transliteration: yásya te agne anyé agnáyaḥ-  upakṣíto vayā́ iva  vípo ná dyumnā́ ní yuve jánānāṃ  táva kṣatrā́ṇi vardháyan

translation.text: O Agni, thou on whom all other fires depend, as branches on the parent stem, I make the treasures of the folk, like songs, mine own, while I exalt thy sovran might.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यमा॑दित्यासो अद्रुहः पा॒रं नय॑थ॒ मर्त्य॑म् म॒घोनां॒ विश्वे॑षां सुदानवः
verses.transliteration: yám ādityāso adruhaḥ  pāráṃ náyatha mártyam maghónāṃ  víśveṣāṃ sudānavaḥ

translation.text: The mortal whom, Âdityas, ye, Guilelew, lead to the farther bank Of all the princes, Bounteous Ones

verses.sanskrit_deva: यू॒यं रा॑जानः॒ कं चि॑च्चर्षणीसहः॒ क्षय॑न्तं॒ मानु॑षाँ॒ अनु॑ व॒यं ते वो॒ वरु॑ण॒ मित्रार्य॑म॒न्त्स्यामेदृ॒तस्य॑ र॒थ्यः॑
verses.transliteration: yūyáṃ rājānaḥ káṃ cic carṣaṇīsahaḥ  kṣáyantam mā́nuṣām̐ ánu  vayáṃ té vo váruṇa mítrā́ryaman  syā́méd r̥tásya rathyàḥ

translation.text: Whoe'er he be, Man-ruling Kings! the Regent of the race of men- May we, O Mitra, Varuṇa, and Aryaman, like him be furtherers of your law.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अदा॑न्मे पौरुकु॒त्स्यः प॑ञ्चा॒शतं॑ त्र॒सद॑स्युर्व॒धूना॑म् मंहि॑ष्ठो अ॒र्यः सत्प॑तिः
verses.transliteration: ádān me paurukutsyáḥ  pañcāśátaṃ trasádasyur vadhū́nām  máṃhiṣṭho aryáḥ sátpatiḥ

translation.text: A gift of fifty female slaves hath Trasadasyu given me, Purukutsa's son, Most liberal, kind, lord of the brave.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त मे॑ प्र॒यियो॑र्व॒यियोः॑ सु॒वास्त्वा॒ अधि॒ तुग्व॑नि ति॒सॄ॒णां स॑प्तती॒नां श्या॒वः प्र॑णे॒ता भु॑व॒द्वसु॒र्दिया॑नां॒ पतिः॑
verses.transliteration: utá me prayíyor vayíyoḥ  suvā́stvā ádhi túgvani  tisr̥̄ṇā́ṃ saptatīnā́ṃ  śyāváḥ praṇetā́ bhuvad  vásur díyānām pátiḥ

translation.text: And Ṣyâva too for me led forth a strong steed at Suvâstu's ford: A herd of three times seventy kine, good lord of gifts, he gave to me.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ ग॑न्ता॒ मा रि॑षण्यत॒ प्रस्था॑वानो॒ माप॑ स्थाता समन्यवः स्थि॒रा चि॑न्नमयिष्णवः
verses.transliteration: ā́ gantā mā́ riṣaṇyata  prásthāvāno mā́pa sthātā samanyavaḥ  sthirā́ cin namayiṣṇavaḥ

translation.text: LET none, Swift Travellers! check you: come hither, like-spirited, stay not far away, Ye benders even of what is firm.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वी॒ळु॒प॒विभि॑र्मरुत ऋभुक्षण॒ आ रु॑द्रासः सुदी॒तिभिः॑ इ॒षा नो॑ अ॒द्या ग॑ता पुरुस्पृहो य॒ज्ञमा सो॑भरी॒यवः॑
verses.transliteration: vīḷupavíbhir maruta r̥bhukṣaṇaḥ-  ā́ rudrāsaḥ sudītíbhiḥ  iṣā́ no adyā́ gatā puruspr̥ho  yajñám ā́ sobharīyávaḥ

translation.text: Maruts, R̥ibhukshans, Rudras come ye with your cars strong-fellied and exceeding bright. Come, ye for whom we long, with food, to sacrifice, come ye with love to Sobbari.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि॒द्मा हि रु॒द्रिया॑णां॒ शुष्म॑मु॒ग्रं म॒रुतां॒ शिमी॑वताम् विष्णो॑रे॒षस्य॑ मी॒ळ्हुषा॑म्
verses.transliteration: vidmā́ hí rudríyāṇāṃ  śúṣmam ugrám marútāṃ śímīvatām  víṣṇor eṣásya mīḷhúṣām

translation.text: For well we know the vigorous might of Rudra's Sons, the Martits, who are passing strong, Swift Vishṇu's band, who send the rain.,

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि द्वी॒पानि॒ पाप॑त॒न्तिष्ठ॑द्दु॒च्छुनो॒भे यु॑जन्त॒ रोद॑सी प्र धन्वा॑न्यैरत शुभ्रखादयो॒ यदेज॑थ स्वभानवः
verses.transliteration: ví dvīpā́ni pā́patan tíṣṭhad duchúnā-  -ubhé yujanta ródasī  prá dhánvāny airata śubhrakhādayo  yád éjatha svabhānavaḥ

translation.text: Islands are bursting forth and misery is stayed: the heaven and earth are joined in one. Decked with bright rings, ye spread the broad expanses out, when ye, Self. luminous, stirred yourselves.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अच्यु॑ता चिद्वो॒ अज्म॒न्ना नान॑दति॒ पर्व॑तासो॒ वन॒स्पतिः॑ भूमि॒र्यामे॑षु रेजते
verses.transliteration: ácyutā cid vo ájmann~ā́  nā́nadati párvatāso vánaspátiḥ  bhū́mir yā́meṣu rejate

translation.text: Even things immovable shake and reel, the mountains and the forest trees at your approach, And the earth trembles as ye come.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अमा॑य वो मरुतो॒ यात॑वे॒ द्यौर्जिही॑त॒ उत्त॑रा बृ॒हत् यत्रा॒ नरो॒ देदि॑शते त॒नूष्वा त्वक्षां॑सि बा॒ह्वो॑जसः
verses.transliteration: ámāya vo maruto yā́tave dyaúr  jíhīta úttarā br̥hát  yátrā náro dédiśate tanū́ṣv~ā́  tvákṣāṃsi bāhvòjasaḥ

translation.text: To lend free course, O Maruts, to your furious rush, heaven high and higher still gives way, Where they, the Heroes mighty with their arms, display their gleaming omaments on their forms.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्व॒धामनु॒ श्रियं॒ नरो॒ महि॑ त्वे॒षा अम॑वन्तो॒ वृष॑प्सवः वह॑न्ते॒ अह्रु॑तप्सवः
verses.transliteration: svadhā́m ánu śríyaṃ náro  máhi tveṣā́ ámavanto vŕ̥ṣapsavaḥ  váhante áhrutapsavaḥ

translation.text: After their Godlike nature they, the bull. like Heroes, dazzling and impetuous, wear Great splendour as they show erect.

verses.sanskrit_deva: गोभि॑र्वा॒णो अ॑ज्यते॒ सोभ॑रीणां॒ रथे॒ कोशे॑ हिर॒ण्यये॑ गोब॑न्धवः सुजा॒तास॑ इ॒षे भु॒जे म॒हान्तो॑ नः॒ स्पर॑से॒ नु
verses.transliteration: góbhir vāṇó ajyate sóbharīṇāṃ  ráthe kóśe hiraṇyáye  góbandhavaḥ sujātā́sa iṣé bhujé  mahā́nto na spárase nú

translation.text: The pivot of the Sobharis' chariot within the golden box is balmed with milk. May they the Well-born, Mighty, kindred of the Cow, aid us to food and to delight.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रति॑ वो वृषदञ्जयो॒ वृष्णे॒ शर्धा॑य॒ मारु॑ताय भरध्वम् ह॒व्या वृष॑प्रयाव्णे
verses.transliteration: práti vo vr̥ṣadañjayo  vŕ̥ṣṇe śárdhāya mā́rutāya bharadhvam  havyā́ vŕ̥ṣaprayāvṇe

translation.text: Bring, ye who sprinkle balmy drops. oblations to your vigorous Marut company, To those whose leader is the Bull.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वृ॒ष॒ण॒श्वेन॑ मरुतो॒ वृष॑प्सुना॒ रथे॑न॒ वृष॑नाभिना आ श्ये॒नासो॒ न प॒क्षिणो॒ वृथा॑ नरो ह॒व्या नो॑ वी॒तये॑ गत
verses.transliteration: vr̥ṣaṇaśvéna maruto vŕ̥ṣapsunā  ráthena vŕ̥ṣanābhinā  ā́ śyenā́so ná pakṣíṇo vŕ̥thā naro  havyā́ no vītáye gata

translation.text: Come hither, O ye Mares, on your stronghorsed car, solid in look, with solid naves. Lightly like winged falcons, O ye Heroes, come, come to enjoy our ofrerings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒मा॒नम॒ञ्ज्ये॑षां॒ वि भ्रा॑जन्ते रु॒क्मासो॒ अधि॑ बा॒हुषु॑ दवि॑द्युतत्यृ॒ष्टयः॑
verses.transliteration: samānám añjy èṣāṃ  ví bhrājante rukmā́so ádhi bāhúṣu  dávidyutaty r̥ṣṭáyaḥ

translation.text: Their decoration is the same: their omaments of gold are bright upon their arms; Their lances glitter splendidly.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त उ॒ग्रासो॒ वृष॑ण उ॒ग्रबा॑हवो॒ नकि॑ष्ट॒नूषु॑ येतिरे स्थि॒रा धन्वा॒न्यायु॑धा॒ रथे॑षु॒ वोऽनी॑के॒ष्वधि॒ श्रियः॑
verses.transliteration: tá ugrā́so vŕ̥ṣaṇa ugrábāhavo  nákiṣ ṭanū́ṣu yetire  sthirā́ dhánvāny ā́yudhā rátheṣu vaḥ-  -ánīkeṣv ádhi śríyaḥ

translation.text: They toil not to defend their bodies from attack, strong Heroes with their mighty arms. Strong are your bows and strong the weapons in your cars, and glory sits on every face.

verses.sanskrit_deva: येषा॒मर्णो॒ न स॒प्रथो॒ नाम॑ त्वे॒षं शश्व॑ता॒मेक॒मिद्भु॒जे वयो॒ न पित्र्यं॒ सहः॑
verses.transliteration: yéṣām árṇo ná saprátho  nā́ma tveṣáṃ śáśvatām ékam íd bhujé  váyo ná pítryaṃ sáhaḥ

translation.text: Whose name extendeth like a sea, alone, resplendent, so that all have joy in it, And life-power like ancestral might.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तान्व॑न्दस्व म॒रुत॒स्ताँ उप॑ स्तुहि॒ तेषां॒ हि धुनी॑नाम् अ॒राणां॒ न च॑र॒मस्तदे॑षां दा॒ना म॒ह्ना तदे॑षाम्
verses.transliteration: tā́n vandasva marútas tā́m̐ úpa stuhi  téṣāṃ hí dhúnīnām  arā́ṇāṃ ná caramás tád eṣāṃ  dānā́ mahnā́ tád eṣām

translation.text: Pay honour to these Maruts and sing praise to them, for of the wheel-spokes of the car Of these loud roarers none is last: this is their power, this moves them to give mighty gifts.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒भगः॒ स व॑ ऊ॒तिष्वास॒ पूर्वा॑सु मरुतो॒ व्यु॑ष्टिषु यो वा॑ नू॒नमु॒तास॑ति
verses.transliteration: subhágaḥ sá va ūtíṣu-  ā́sa pū́rvāsu maruto vyùṣṭiṣu  yó vā nūnám utā́sati

translation.text: Blest by your favouring help was he, O Maruts, at the earlier flushings of the morn, And even now shall he be blest.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्य॑ वा यू॒यं प्रति॑ वा॒जिनो॑ नर॒ आ ह॒व्या वी॒तये॑ ग॒थ अ॒भि ष द्यु॒म्नैरु॒त वाज॑सातिभिः सु॒म्ना वो॑ धूतयो नशत्
verses.transliteration: yásya vā yūyám práti vājíno naraḥ-  ā́ havyā́ vītáye gathá  abhí ṣá dyumnaír utá vā́jasātibhiḥ  sumnā́ vo dhūtayo naśat

translation.text: The strong man to whose sacrifice, O Heroes, ye approach that ye may taste thereof, With glories and with war that winneth spoil shall gain great bliss, ye Shakers of the world.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यथा॑ रु॒द्रस्य॑ सू॒नवो॑ दि॒वो वश॒न्त्यसु॑रस्य वे॒धसः॑ युवा॑न॒स्तथेद॑सत्
verses.transliteration: yáthā rudrásya sūnávo  divó váśanty ásurasya vedhásaḥ  yúvānas táthéd asat

translation.text: Even as Rudra's Sons, the brood of the Creator Dyaus, the Asura, desire, O Youthful Ones, so shall it be:

verses.sanskrit_deva: ये चार्ह॑न्ति म॒रुतः॑ सु॒दान॑वः॒ स्मन्मी॒ळ्हुष॒श्चर॑न्ति॒ ये अत॑श्चि॒दा न॒ उप॒ वस्य॑सा हृ॒दा युवा॑न॒ आ व॑वृध्वम्
verses.transliteration: yé cā́rhanti marútaḥ sudā́navaḥ  smán mīḷhúṣaś cáranti yé  átaś cid ā́ na úpa vásyasā hr̥dā́  yúvāna ā́ vavr̥dhvam

translation.text: And these the bounteous, worthy of the Maruts who move onward pouring down the rain- Even for their sake, O Youthful Ones, with kindest heart take us to you to be your own.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यून॑ ऊ॒ षु नवि॑ष्ठया॒ वृष्णः॑ पाव॒काँ अ॒भि सो॑भरे गि॒रा गाय॒ गा इ॑व॒ चर्कृ॑षत्
verses.transliteration: yū́na ū ṣú náviṣṭhayā  vŕ̥ṣṇaḥ pāvakā́m̐ abhí sobhare girā́  gā́ya gā́ iva cárkr̥ṣat

translation.text: O Sobhari, with newest song sing out unto the youthful purifying Bulls, Even as a plougher to his steers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सा॒हा ये सन्ति॑ मुष्टि॒हेव॒ हव्यो॒ विश्वा॑सु पृ॒त्सु होतृ॑षु वृष्ण॑श्च॒न्द्रान्न सु॒श्रव॑स्तमान्गि॒रा वन्द॑स्व म॒रुतो॒ अह॑
verses.transliteration: sāhā́ yé sánti muṣṭihéva hávyo  víśvāsu pr̥tsú hótr̥ṣu  vŕ̥ṣṇaś candrā́n ná suśrávastamān girā́  vándasva marúto áha

translation.text: Who, like a celebrated boxer, overcome the challengers in every fight: They who, like shining bulls, are most illustrious-honour those Maruts with thy song.

verses.sanskrit_deva: गाव॑श्चिद्घा समन्यवः सजा॒त्ये॑न मरुतः॒ सब॑न्धवः रि॒ह॒ते क॒कुभो॑ मि॒थः
verses.transliteration: gā́vaś cid ghā samanyavaḥ  sajātyèna marutaḥ sábandhavaḥ  rihaté kakúbho mitháḥ

translation.text: Allied by common ancestry, ye Maruts, even the Cows, alike in energy, Lick, all by turns, each other's head.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मर्त॑श्चिद्वो नृतवो रुक्मवक्षस॒ उप॑ भ्रातृ॒त्वमाय॑ति अधि॑ नो गात मरुतः॒ सदा॒ हि व॑ आपि॒त्वमस्ति॒ निध्रु॑वि
verses.transliteration: mártaś cid vo nr̥tavo rukmavakṣasaḥ-  úpa bhrātr̥tvám ā́yati  ádhi no gāta marutaḥ sádā hí vaḥ-  āpitvám ásti nídhruvi

translation.text: Even mortal man, ye Dancers breast adorned with gold, attains to brotherhood with you. Mark ye and notice us, O Maruts; evermore your friendship is secured to us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मरु॑तो॒ मारु॑तस्य न॒ आ भे॑ष॒जस्य॑ वहता सुदानवः यू॒यं स॑खायः सप्तयः
verses.transliteration: máruto mā́rutasya naḥ-  ā́ bheṣajásya vahatā sudānavaḥ  yūyáṃ sakhāyaḥ saptayaḥ

translation.text: O Maruts, rich in noble gifts, bring us a portion of the Maruts' medicine, Ye Coursers who are Friends to us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: याभिः॒ सिन्धु॒मव॑थ॒ याभि॒स्तूर्व॑थ॒ याभि॑र्दश॒स्यथा॒ क्रिवि॑म् मयो॑ नो भूतो॒तिभि॑र्मयोभुवः शि॒वाभि॑रसचद्विषः
verses.transliteration: yā́bhiḥ síndhum ávatha yā́bhis tū́rvatha  yā́bhir daśasyáthā krívim  máyo no bhūtotíbhir mayobhuvaḥ  śivā́bhir asacadviṣaḥ

translation.text: Haters of those who serve you not, bliss-bringers, bring us bliss with those auspicious aids Wherewith ye are victorious and guard Sindhu well, and succour Krvi in his need.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यत्सिन्धौ॒ यदसि॑क्न्यां॒ यत्स॑मु॒द्रेषु॑ मरुतः सुबर्हिषः यत्पर्व॑तेषु भेष॒जम्
verses.transliteration: yát síndhau yád ásiknyāṃ  yát samudréṣu marutaḥ subarhiṣaḥ  yát párvateṣu bheṣajám

translation.text: Maruts, who rest on fair trimmed grass, what balm soever Sindhu or Asikni hath, Or mountains or the seas contain.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विश्वं॒ पश्य॑न्तो बिभृथा त॒नूष्वा तेना॑ नो॒ अधि॑ वोचत क्ष॒मा रपो॑ मरुत॒ आतु॑रस्य न॒ इष्क॑र्ता॒ विह्रु॑तं॒ पुनः॑
verses.transliteration: víśvam páśyanto bibhr̥thā tanū́ṣv~ā́  ténā no ádhi vocata  kṣamā́ rápo maruta ā́turasya naḥ-  íṣkartā víhrutam púnaḥ

translation.text: Ye carry on your bodies, ye who see it all: so bless us graciously therewith. Cast, Maruts, to the ground our sick man's malady: replace the dislocated limb.

verses.sanskrit_deva: व॒यमु॒ त्वाम॑पूर्व्य स्थू॒रं न कच्चि॒द्भर॑न्तोऽव॒स्यवः॑ वाजे॑ चि॒त्रं ह॑वामहे
verses.transliteration: vayám u tvā́m apūrvya  sthūráṃ ná kác cid bháranto 'vasyávaḥ  vā́je citráṃ havāmahe

translation.text: WE call on thee, O Matchless One! We seeking help, possessing nothing firm ourselves, Call on thee wonderful in fight

verses.sanskrit_deva: उप॑ त्वा॒ कर्म॑न्नू॒तये॒ स नो॒ युवो॒ग्रश्च॑क्राम॒ यो धृ॒षत् त्वामिद्ध्य॑वि॒तारं॑ ववृ॒महे॒ सखा॑य इन्द्र सान॒सिम्
verses.transliteration: úpa tvā kármann ūtáye sá no yúvā-  -ugráś cakrāma yó dhr̥ṣát  tvā́m íd dhy àvitā́raṃ vavr̥máhe  sákhāya indra sānasím

translation.text: On thee for aid in sacrifice. This youth of ours, the bold, the mighty, hath gonse forth. We therefore, we thy friends, Indra, havie chosen thee, free-giver, as our Guardian God.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ या॑ही॒म इन्द॒वोऽश्व॑पते॒ गोप॑त॒ उर्व॑रापते सोमं॑ सोमपते पिब
verses.transliteration: ā́ yāhīmá índavaḥ-  -áśvapate gópata úrvarāpate  sómaṃ somapate piba

translation.text: Come hither, for the drops are here, O Lord of corn-lands. Lord of horses, Lord of kine: Drink thou the Soma, Soma's Lord!

verses.sanskrit_deva: व॒यं हि त्वा॒ बन्धु॑मन्तमब॒न्धवो॒ विप्रा॑स इन्द्र येमि॒म या ते॒ धामा॑नि वृषभ॒ तेभि॒रा ग॑हि॒ विश्वे॑भिः॒ सोम॑पीतये
verses.transliteration: vayáṃ hí tvā bándhumantam abandhávo  víprāsa indra yemimá  yā́ te dhā́māni vr̥ṣabha tébhir ā́ gahi  víśvebhiḥ sómapītaye

translation.text: For we the kinless singers have drawn hither thee, O Indra, who hast numerous kin. With all the forms thou hast, comic thou of bull-like strength, come near to drink the Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सीद॑न्तस्ते॒ वयो॑ यथा॒ गोश्री॑ते॒ मधौ॑ मदि॒रे वि॒वक्ष॑णे अ॒भि त्वामि॑न्द्र नोनुमः
verses.transliteration: sī́dantas te váyo yathā  góśrīte mádhau madiré vivákṣaṇe  abhí tvā́m indra nonumaḥ

translation.text: Sitting like birds beside thy meath., mingled with milk, that gladdeneth and exalteth thee, Indra, to thee we sing aloud.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अच्छा॑ च त्वै॒ना नम॑सा॒ वदा॑मसि॒ किं मुहु॑श्चि॒द्वि दी॑धयः सन्ति॒ कामा॑सो हरिवो द॒दिष्ट्वं स्मो व॒यं सन्ति॑ नो॒ धियः॑
verses.transliteration: áchā ca tvainā́ námasā vádāmasi  kím múhuś cid ví dīdhayaḥ  sánti kā́māso harivo dadíṣ ṭváṃ  smó vayáṃ sánti no dhíyaḥ

translation.text: We speak to thee with this our reverential prayer. Why art thou pondering yet awhile? Here are our wishes; thou art liberal, Lord of Bays: we and our hymns are present here.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नूत्ना॒ इदि॑न्द्र ते व॒यमू॒ती अ॑भूम न॒हि नू ते॑ अद्रिवः वि॒द्मा पु॒रा परी॑णसः
verses.transliteration: nū́tnā íd indra te vayám  ūtī́ abhūma nahí nū́ te adrivaḥ  vidmā́ purā́ párīṇasaḥ

translation.text: For not in recent times alone, O Indra, Thunder-armed, have we obtained thine aid. Of old we knew thy plenteous wealth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि॒द्मा स॑खि॒त्वमु॒त शू॑र भो॒ज्य१॒॑मा ते॒ ता व॑ज्रिन्नीमहे उ॒तो स॑मस्मि॒न्ना शि॑शीहि नो वसो॒ वाजे॑ सुशिप्र॒ गोम॑ति
verses.transliteration: vidmā́ sakhitvám utá śūra bhojyàm  ā́ te tā́ vajrinn īmahe  utó samasminn ā́ śiśīhi no vaso  vā́je suśipra gómati

translation.text: Hero, we knew thy friendship and thy rich rewards: these, Thunderer, now we crave of thee. O Vasu, for all wealth that cometh of the kine, sharpen our powers, fair-visored God.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो न॑ इ॒दमि॑दं पु॒रा प्र वस्य॑ आनि॒नाय॒ तमु॑ वः स्तुषे सखा॑य॒ इन्द्र॑मू॒तये॑
verses.transliteration: yó na idám-idam purā́  prá vásya āninā́ya tám u va stuṣe  sákhāya índram ūtáye

translation.text: Him who of old hath brought to us this and that blessing, him I magnify for you, Even Indra, O my friends, for help

verses.sanskrit_deva: हर्य॑श्वं॒ सत्प॑तिं चर्षणी॒सहं॒ स हि ष्मा॒ यो अम॑न्दत आ तु नः॒ स व॑यति॒ गव्य॒मश्व्यं॑ स्तो॒तृभ्यो॑ म॒घवा॑ श॒तम्
verses.transliteration: háryaśvaṃ sátpatiṃ carṣaṇīsáhaṃ  sá hí ṣmā yó ámandata  ā́ tú naḥ sá vayati gávyam áśvyaṃ  stotŕ̥bhyo maghávā śatám

translation.text: Borne by Bay Steeds, the Lord of heroes, ruling men, for it is he who takes; delight. May Maghavan bestow on us his worshippers hundreds of cattle and of steeds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वया॑ ह स्विद्यु॒जा व॒यं प्रति॑ श्व॒सन्तं॑ वृषभ ब्रुवीमहि सं॒स्थे जन॑स्य॒ गोम॑तः
verses.transliteration: tváyā ha svid yujā́ vayám  práti śvasántaṃ vr̥ṣabha bruvīmahi  saṃsthé jánasya gómataḥ

translation.text: Hero, may we, with thee for Friend, withstand the man who pants against us in his wrath, In fight with people rich in kine.

verses.sanskrit_deva: जये॑म का॒रे पु॑रुहूत का॒रिणो॒ऽभि ति॑ष्ठेम दू॒ढ्यः॑ नृभि॑र्वृ॒त्रं ह॒न्याम॑ शूशु॒याम॒ चावे॑रिन्द्र॒ प्र णो॒ धियः॑
verses.transliteration: jáyema kāré puruhūta kāríṇo  -abhí tiṣṭhema dūḍhyàḥ  nŕ̥bhir vr̥tráṃ hanyā́ma śūśuyā́ma ca-  -áver indra prá ṇo dhíyaḥ

translation.text: May we be victors in the singer's battlesong, and meet the wicked, Much invoked! With heroes smite the foeman and show forth our strength. O Indra, further thou our thoughts.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भ्रा॒तृ॒व्यो अ॒ना त्वमना॑पिरिन्द्र ज॒नुषा॑ स॒नाद॑सि यु॒धेदा॑पि॒त्वमि॑च्छसे
verses.transliteration: abhrātr̥vyó anā́ tvám  ánāpir indra janúṣā sanā́d asi  yudhéd āpitvám ichase

translation.text: O Indra, from all ancient time rivalless ever and companionless art thou: Thou seekest comradeship in war.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नकी॑ रे॒वन्तं॑ स॒ख्याय॑ विन्दसे॒ पीय॑न्ति ते सुरा॒श्वः॑ य॒दा कृ॒णोषि॑ नद॒नुं समू॑ह॒स्यादित्पि॒तेव॑ हूयसे
verses.transliteration: nákī revántaṃ sakhyā́ya vindase  pī́yanti te surāśvàḥ  yadā́ kr̥ṇóṣi nadanúṃ sám ūhasi-  ā́d ít pitéva hūyase

translation.text: Thou findest not the wealthy man to be thy friend: those scorn thee who are flown with wine. What time thou thunderest and gatherest, then thou, even as a Father, art invoked.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा ते॑ अमा॒जुरो॑ यथा मू॒रास॑ इन्द्र स॒ख्ये त्वाव॑तः नि ष॑दाम॒ सचा॑ सु॒ते
verses.transliteration: mā́ te amājúro yathā  mūrā́sa indra sakhyé tvā́vataḥ  ní ṣadāma sácā suté

translation.text: O Indra, let us not, like fools who waste their lives at home, with friendship such as thine Sit idly by the poured-out juice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा ते॑ गोदत्र॒ निर॑राम॒ राध॑स॒ इन्द्र॒ मा ते॑ गृहामहि दृ॒ळ्हा चि॑द॒र्यः प्र मृ॑शा॒भ्या भ॑र॒ न ते॑ दा॒मान॑ आ॒दभे॑
verses.transliteration: mā́ te godatra nír arāma rā́dhasaḥ-  índra mā́ te gr̥hāmahi  dr̥ḷhā́ cid aryáḥ prá mr̥śābhy ā́ bhara  ná te dāmā́na ādábhe

translation.text: Giver of kine, may we not miss thy gracious gifts: let us not rob thee of thine own. Strip even the strong places of the foe, and bring: thy gifts can never be made vain.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रो॑ वा॒ घेदिय॑न्म॒घं सर॑स्वती वा सु॒भगा॑ द॒दिर्वसु॑ त्वं वा॑ चित्र दा॒शुषे॑
verses.transliteration: índro vā ghéd íyan magháṃ  sárasvatī vā subhágā dadír vásu  tváṃ vā citra dāśúṣe

translation.text: Indra or blest Sarasvatî alone bestows such wealth, treasure so great, or thou, O Chitra, on the worshipper.

verses.sanskrit_deva: चित्र॒ इद्राजा॑ राज॒का इद॑न्य॒के य॒के सर॑स्वती॒मनु॑ प॒र्जन्य॑ इव त॒तन॒द्धि वृ॒ष्ट्या स॒हस्र॑म॒युता॒ दद॑त्
verses.transliteration: cítra íd rā́jā rājakā́ íd anyaké  yaké sárasvatīm ánu  parjánya iva tatánad dhí vr̥ṣṭyā́  sahásram ayútā dádat

translation.text: Chitra is King, and only kinglings are the rest who dwell beside Sarasvatî. He, like Parjanya with his rain, hath spread himself with thousand, yea, with myriad gifts.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ओ त्यम॑ह्व॒ आ रथ॑म॒द्या दंसि॑ष्ठमू॒तये॑ यम॑श्विना सुहवा रुद्रवर्तनी॒ आ सू॒र्यायै॑ त॒स्थथुः॑
verses.transliteration: ó tyám ahva ā́ rátham  adyā́ dáṃsiṣṭham ūtáye  yám aśvinā suhavā rudravartanī  ā́ sūryā́yai tastháthuḥ

translation.text: HITHERWARD have I called to-day, for succour, that most wondrous car Which ye ascended, Aṣvins, ye whose paths are red, swift to give Car, for Sûryâ's sake.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पू॒र्वा॒पुषं॑ सु॒हवं॑ पुरु॒स्पृहं॑ भु॒ज्युं वाजे॑षु॒ पूर्व्य॑म् स॒च॒नाव॑न्तं सुम॒तिभिः॑ सोभरे॒ विद्वे॑षसमने॒हस॑म्
verses.transliteration: pūrvāyúṣaṃ suhávam puruspŕ̥ham  bhujyúṃ vā́jeṣu pū́rvyam  sacanā́vantaṃ sumatíbhiḥ sobhare  vídveṣasam anehásam

translation.text: Car ever young, much longed-for, easily invoked, soon guided, first in deeds of might, Which waits and serves, O Sobhari, with benevolence, without a rival or a foe.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒ह त्या पु॑रु॒भूत॑मा दे॒वा नमो॑भिर॒श्विना॑ अ॒र्वा॒ची॒ना स्वव॑से करामहे॒ गन्ता॑रा दा॒शुषो॑ गृ॒हम्
verses.transliteration: ihá tyā́ purubhū́tamā  devā́ námobhir aśvínā  arvācīnā́ sv ávase karāmahe  gántārā dāśúṣo gr̥hám

translation.text: These Aṣvins with our homage, these Two Omnipresent Deities Hitherward will we bring for kind help, these who seek the dwelling of the worshipper.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वो रथ॑स्य॒ परि॑ च॒क्रमी॑यत ई॒र्मान्यद्वा॑मिषण्यति अ॒स्माँ अच्छा॑ सुम॒तिर्वां॑ शुभस्पती॒ आ धे॒नुरि॑व धावतु
verses.transliteration: yuvó ráthasya pári cakrám īyate-  īrmā́nyád vām iṣaṇyati  asmā́m̐ áchā sumatír vāṃ śubhas patī  ā́ dhenúr iva dhāvatu

translation.text: One of your chariot wheels is moving swiftly round, one speeds for you its onward course. Like a milch-cow, O Lords of splendour, and with haste let your benevolence come to us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: रथो॒ यो वां॑ त्रिवन्धु॒रो हिर॑ण्याभीशुरश्विना परि॒ द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी भूष॑ति श्रु॒तस्तेन॑ नास॒त्या ग॑तम्
verses.transliteration: rátho yó vāṃ trivandhuró  híraṇyābhīśur aśvinā  pári dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ bhū́ṣati śrutás  téna nāsatyā́ gataṃ

translation.text: That chariot of yours which hath a triple seat and reins of gold, The famous car that traverseth the heaven and earth, thereon Nâsatyas, Aṣvins, come.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द॒श॒स्यन्ता॒ मन॑वे पू॒र्व्यं दि॒वि यवं॒ वृके॑ण कर्षथः ता वा॑म॒द्य सु॑म॒तिभिः॑ शुभस्पती॒ अश्वि॑ना॒ प्र स्तु॑वीमहि
verses.transliteration: daśasyántā mánave pūrvyáṃ diví  yávaṃ vŕ̥keṇa karṣathaḥ  tā́ vām adyá sumatíbhiḥ śubhas patī  áśvinā prá stuvīmahi

translation.text: Ye with your plough, when favouring Manu with your help, ploughed the first harvest in the sky. As such will we exalt you, Lords of splendour, now, O Aṣvins, with our prayer and praise.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उप॑ नो वाजिनीवसू या॒तमृ॒तस्य॑ प॒थिभिः॑ येभि॑स्तृ॒क्षिं वृ॑षणा त्रासदस्य॒वं म॒हे क्ष॒त्राय॒ जिन्व॑थः
verses.transliteration: úpa no vājinīvasū  yātám r̥tásya pathíbhiḥ  yébhis tr̥kṣíṃ vr̥ṣaṇā trāsadasyavám  mahé kṣatrā́ya jínvathaḥ

translation.text: Come to us, Lords of ample wealth, by paths of everlasting Law, Whereby to high dominion ye with mighty strength raised Tr̥ikshi, Trasadasyu's son.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं वा॒मद्रि॑भिः सु॒तः सोमो॑ नरा वृषण्वसू आ या॑तं॒ सोम॑पीतये॒ पिब॑तं दा॒शुषो॑ गृ॒हे
verses.transliteration: ayáṃ vām ádribhiḥ sutáḥ  sómo narā vr̥ṣaṇvasū  ā́ yātaṃ sómapītaye  píbataṃ dāśúṣo gr̥hé

translation.text: This Soma pressed with stones is yours, ye Heroes, Lords of plenteous wealth. Approach to drink the Soma, come, drink in the worshipper's abode.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ हि रु॒हत॑मश्विना॒ रथे॒ कोशे॑ हिर॒ण्यये॑ वृषण्वसू यु॒ञ्जाथां॒ पीव॑री॒रिषः॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ hí ruhátam aśvinā  ráthe kóśe hiraṇyáye vr̥ṣaṇvasū  yuñjā́thām pī́varīr íṣaḥ

translation.text: O Aṣvins, mount the chariot, mount the golden seat, ye who are Lords of plenteous wealth, And bring to us abundant food.

verses.sanskrit_deva: याभिः॑ प॒क्थमव॑थो॒ याभि॒रध्रि॑गुं॒ याभि॑र्ब॒भ्रुं विजो॑षसम् ताभि॑र्नो म॒क्षू तूय॑मश्वि॒ना ग॑तं भिष॒ज्यतं॒ यदातु॑रम्
verses.transliteration: yā́bhiḥ pakthám ávatho yā́bhir ádhriguṃ  yā́bhir babhrúṃ víjoṣasam  tā́bhir no makṣū́ tū́yam aśvinā́ gatam  -bhiṣajyátaṃ yád ā́turam

translation.text: The aids wherewith ye helped Paktha and Adhrigt;, and Babhru severed from his friends,– With those, O Aṣvins, come hither with speed and soon, and heal whatever is diseased.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यदध्रि॑गावो॒ अध्रि॑गू इ॒दा चि॒दह्नो॑ अ॒श्विना॒ हवा॑महे व॒यं गी॒र्भिर्वि॑प॒न्यवः॑
verses.transliteration: yád ádhrigāvo ádhrigū  idā́ cid áhno aśvínā hávāmahe  vayáṃ gīrbhír vipanyávaḥ

translation.text: When we continually invoke the Aṣvins, the resistless, at this time of day, We lovers of the song, with songs.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ताभि॒रा या॑तं वृष॒णोप॑ मे॒ हवं॑ वि॒श्वप्सुं॑ वि॒श्ववा॑र्यम् इ॒षा मंहि॑ष्ठा पुरु॒भूत॑मा नरा॒ याभिः॒ क्रिविं॑ वावृ॒धुस्ताभि॒रा ग॑तम्
verses.transliteration: tā́bhir ā́ yātaṃ vr̥ṣaṇópa me hávaṃ  viśvápsuṃ viśvávāryam  iṣā́ máṃhiṣṭhā purubhū́tamā narā  yā́bhiḥ kríviṃ vāvr̥dhús tā́bhir ā́ gatam

translation.text: Through these, ye Mighty Ones, come hither to my call which brings all blessings, wears all forms,– Tlirough which, All-present Heroes, lavishest of food ye strengthened Krvi, come through these.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तावि॒दा चि॒दहा॑नां॒ ताव॒श्विना॒ वन्द॑मान॒ उप॑ ब्रुवे ता उ॒ नमो॑भिरीमहे
verses.transliteration: tā́v idā́ cid áhānāṃ  tā́v aśvínā vándamāna úpa bruve  tā́ u námobhir īmahe

translation.text: I speak to both of these as such, these Aṣvins whom I reverence at this time of day: With homage we entreat them both.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ताविद्दो॒षा ता उ॒षसि॑ शु॒भस्पती॒ ता याम॑न्रु॒द्रव॑र्तनी मा नो॒ मर्ता॑य रि॒पवे॑ वाजिनीवसू प॒रो रु॑द्रा॒वति॑ ख्यतम्
verses.transliteration: tā́v íd doṣā́ tā́ uṣási śubhás pátī  tā́ yā́man rudrávartanī  mā́ no mártāya ripáve vājinīvasū  paró rudrāv áti khyatam

translation.text: Ye who are Lords of splendour, ye whose paths are red, at eve, at mom, at sacrifice, Give us not utterly as prey to mortal foe, ye Rudras, Lords of ample wealth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ सुग्म्या॑य॒ सुग्म्यं॑ प्रा॒ता रथे॑ना॒श्विना॑ वा स॒क्षणी॑ हु॒वे पि॒तेव॒ सोभ॑री
verses.transliteration: ā́ súgmyāya súgmyam  prātā́ ráthenāśvínā vā sakṣáṇī  huvé pitéva sóbharī

translation.text: For bliss I call. the blissful car, at morn the inseparable Aṣvins with their car I call, like Sobhari our sire.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मनो॑जवसा वृषणा मदच्युता मक्षुंग॒माभि॑रू॒तिभिः॑ आ॒रात्ता॑च्चिद्भूतम॒स्मे अव॑से पू॒र्वीभिः॑ पुरुभोजसा
verses.transliteration: mánojavasā vr̥ṣaṇā madacyutā  makṣuṃgamā́bhir ūtíbhiḥ  ārā́ttāc cid bhūtam asmé ávase  pūrvī́bhiḥ purubhojasā

translation.text: Rapid as thought, and strong, and speeding to thejoy, bringing.your swiftly-coming help, Be to us a protection even from far away Lords of great wealth, with many aids.'

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नो॒ अश्वा॑वदश्विना व॒र्तिर्या॑सिष्टं मधुपातमा नरा गोम॑द्दस्रा॒ हिर॑ण्यवत्
verses.transliteration: ā́ no áśvāvad aśvinā  vartír yāsiṣṭam madhupātamā narā  gómad dasrā híraṇyavat

translation.text: Come, Wonder-Workers, to our home, our home, O Aṣvins, rich in cattle, steeds, and gold, Chief drinkers of the Soma's juice

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒प्रा॒व॒र्गं सु॒वीर्यं॑ सु॒ष्ठु वार्य॒मना॑धृष्टं रक्ष॒स्विना॑ अ॒स्मिन्ना वा॑मा॒याने॑ वाजिनीवसू॒ विश्वा॑ वा॒मानि॑ धीमहि
verses.transliteration: suprāvargáṃ suvī́ryaṃ suṣṭhú vā́ryam  ánādhr̥ṣṭaṃ rakṣasvínā  asmínn ā́ vām āyā́ne vājinīvasū  víśvā vāmā́ni dhīmahi

translation.text: Choice-worthy strength, heroic, firm and excellent, uninjured by the Raksas foe, At this your coming nigh, ye Lords of ample wealth and all good things, may we obtain.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ईळि॑ष्वा॒ हि प्र॑ती॒व्यं१॒॑ यज॑स्व जा॒तवे॑दसम् च॒रि॒ष्णुधू॑म॒मगृ॑भीतशोचिषम्
verses.transliteration: ī́ḷiṣvā hí pratīvyàṃ  yájasva jātávedasam  cariṣṇúdhūmam ágr̥bhītaśociṣam

translation.text: WORSHIP thou Jâtavedas, pray to him who willingly accepts, Whose smoke wanders at will, and none may grasp his flame.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दा॒मानं॑ विश्वचर्षणे॒ऽग्निं वि॑श्वमनो गि॒रा उ॒त स्तु॑षे॒ विष्प॑र्धसो॒ रथा॑नाम्
verses.transliteration: dāmā́naṃ viśvacarṣaṇe  -agníṃ viśvamano girā́  utá stuṣe víṣpardhaso ráthānām

translation.text: Thou, all men's friend, Viṣvamanas, exaltest Agni with thy song, The Giver, and his flames with which no cars contend.

verses.sanskrit_deva: येषा॑माबा॒ध ऋ॒ग्मिय॑ इ॒षः पृ॒क्षश्च॑ नि॒ग्रभे॑ उ॒प॒विदा॒ वह्नि॑र्विन्दते॒ वसु॑
verses.transliteration: yéṣām ābādhá r̥gmíyaḥ-  iṣáḥ pr̥kṣáś ca nigrábhe  upavídā váhnir vindate vásu

translation.text: Whose resolute assault, to win vigour and food, deserves our praise,– Through whose discovering power the priest obtaineth wealth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उद॑स्य शो॒चिर॑स्थाद्दीदि॒युषो॒ व्य१॒॑जर॑म् तपु॑र्जम्भस्य सु॒द्युतो॑ गण॒श्रियः॑
verses.transliteration: úd asya śocír asthād  dīdiyúṣo vy àjáram  tápurjambhasya sudyúto gaṇaśríyaḥ

translation.text: Up springs the imperishable flame, the flame of the Refulgent One Most bright, with glowing jaws and glory in his train.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उदु॑ तिष्ठ स्वध्वर॒ स्तवा॑नो दे॒व्या कृ॒पा अ॒भि॒ख्या भा॒सा बृ॑ह॒ता शु॑शु॒क्वनिः॑
verses.transliteration: úd u tiṣṭha svadhvara  stávāno devyā́ kr̥pā́  abhikhyā́ bhāsā́ br̥hatā́ śuśukvániḥ

translation.text: Skilled in fair sacrifice, extolled, arise in Godlike loveliness, Shining with lofty splendour, with effulgent light.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्ने॑ या॒हि सु॑श॒स्तिभि॑र्ह॒व्या जुह्वा॑न आनु॒षक् यथा॑ दू॒तो ब॒भूथ॑ हव्य॒वाह॑नः
verses.transliteration: ágne yāhí suśastíbhir  havyā́ júhvāna ānuṣák  yáthā dūtó babhū́tha havyavā́hanaḥ

translation.text: Called straight to our oblations, come, O Agni, through our eulogies, As thou hast been our envoy bearing up our gifts.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग्निं वः॑ पू॒र्व्यं हु॑वे॒ होता॑रं चर्षणी॒नाम् तम॒या वा॒चा गृ॑णे॒ तमु॑ वः स्तुषे
verses.transliteration: agníṃ vaḥ pūrvyáṃ huve  hótāraṃ carṣaṇīnā́m  tám ayā́ vācā́ gr̥ṇe tám u va stuṣe

translation.text: I call your Agni, from of old Invoking Priest of living men: Him with this song I laud and magnify for you.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य॒ज्ञेभि॒रद्भु॑तक्रतुं॒ यं कृ॒पा सू॒दय॑न्त॒ इत् मि॒त्रं न जने॒ सुधि॑तमृ॒ताव॑नि
verses.transliteration: yajñébhir ádbhutakratuṃ  yáṃ kr̥pā́ sūdáyanta ít  mitráṃ ná jáne súdhitam r̥tā́vani

translation.text: Whom, wondrous wise, they animate with solemn rites and his fair form, Kind as a friend to men who keep the holy Law.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋ॒तावा॑नमृतायवो य॒ज्ञस्य॒ साध॑नं गि॒रा उपो॑ एनं जुजुषु॒र्नम॑सस्प॒दे
verses.transliteration: r̥tā́vānam r̥tāyavo  yajñásya sā́dhanaṃ girā́  úpo enaṃ jujuṣur námasas padé

translation.text: Him, true to Law, who perfecteth the sacrifice,. Law-loving ones! Ye with your song have gratified in the place of prayer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अच्छा॑ नो॒ अङ्गि॑रस्तमं य॒ज्ञासो॑ यन्तु सं॒यतः॑ होता॒ यो अस्ति॑ वि॒क्ष्वा य॒शस्त॑मः
verses.transliteration: áchā no áṅgirastamaṃ  yajñā́so yantu saṃyátaḥ  hótā yó ásti vikṣv ā́ yaśástamaḥ

translation.text: May all our sacrifices go to him the truest Angiras, Who is among mankind the most illustrious Priest.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्ने॒ तव॒ त्ये अ॑ज॒रेन्धा॑नासो बृ॒हद्भाः अश्वा॑ इव॒ वृष॑णस्तविषी॒यवः॑
verses.transliteration: ágne táva tyé ajara-  -índhānāso br̥hád bhā́ḥ  áśvā iva vŕ̥ṣaṇas taviṣīyávaḥ

translation.text: Imperishable Agni, thine are all these high enkindled lights, Like horses and like stallions showing forth their strength.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स त्वं न॑ ऊर्जां पते र॒यिं रा॑स्व सु॒वीर्य॑म् प्राव॑ नस्तो॒के तन॑ये स॒मत्स्वा
verses.transliteration: sá tváṃ na ūrjām pate  rayíṃ rāsva suvī́ryam  prā́va nas toké tánaye samátsv ā́

translation.text: So give us, Lord of Power and Might, riches combined with hero strength, And guard us with our sons and grand. sons in our frays.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यद्वा उ॑ वि॒श्पतिः॑ शि॒तः सुप्री॑तो॒ मनु॑षो वि॒शि विश्वेद॒ग्निः प्रति॒ रक्षां॑सि सेधति
verses.transliteration: yád vā́ u viśpátiḥ śitáḥ  súprīto mánuṣo viśí  víśvéd agníḥ práti rákṣāṃsi sedhati

translation.text: Soon as the eager Lord of men is friendly unto Manti's race, Agni averteth from us all the demon host.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श्रु॒ष्ट्य॑ग्ने॒ नव॑स्य मे॒ स्तोम॑स्य वीर विश्पते नि मा॒यिन॒स्तपु॑षा र॒क्षसो॑ दह
verses.transliteration: śruṣṭy àgne návasya me  stómasya vīra viśpate  ní māyínas tápuṣā rakṣáso daha

translation.text: O Hero Agni, Lord of men, on hearing this new laud of mine, Burn down the Raksasas, enchanters, with thy flame.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न तस्य॑ मा॒यया॑ च॒न रि॒पुरी॑शीत॒ मर्त्यः॑ यो अ॒ग्नये॑ द॒दाश॑ ह॒व्यदा॑तिभिः
verses.transliteration: ná tásya māyáyā caná  ripúr īśīta mártyaḥ  yó agnáye dadā́śa havyádātibhiḥ

translation.text: No mortal foe can e'er prevail by arts of magic over him Who serveth Agni well with sacrificial gifts.

verses.sanskrit_deva: व्य॑श्वस्त्वा वसु॒विद॑मुक्ष॒ण्युर॑प्रीणा॒दृषिः॑ म॒हो रा॒ये तमु॑ त्वा॒ समि॑धीमहि
verses.transliteration: vyàśvas tvā vasuvídam  ukṣaṇyúr aprīṇād ŕ̥ṣiḥ  mahó rāyé tám u tvā sám idhīmahi

translation.text: Vyaṣva the sage, who sought the Bull, hath won thee, finder of good things: As such may we enkindle thee for ample wealth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒शना॑ का॒व्यस्त्वा॒ नि होता॑रमसादयत् आ॒य॒जिं त्वा॒ मन॑वे जा॒तवे॑दसम्
verses.transliteration: uśánā kāvyás tvā  ní hótāram asādayat  āyajíṃ tvā mánave jātávedasam

translation.text: Uṣanâ Kâvya stablished thee, O Agni, as Invoking Priest: Thee, Jâtavedas, Sacrificing Priest for man.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विश्वे॒ हि त्वा॑ स॒जोष॑सो दे॒वासो॑ दू॒तमक्र॑त श्रु॒ष्टी दे॑व प्रथ॒मो य॒ज्ञियो॑ भुवः
verses.transliteration: víśve hí tvā sajóṣaso  devā́so dūtám ákrata  śruṣṭī́ deva prathamó yajñíyo bhuvaḥ

translation.text: All Deities of one accord appointed thee their messenger: Thou, God, through hearing, hadst first claim to sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मं घा॑ वी॒रो अ॒मृतं॑ दू॒तं कृ॑ण्वीत॒ मर्त्यः॑ पा॒व॒कं कृ॒ष्णव॑र्तनिं॒ विहा॑यसम्
verses.transliteration: imáṃ ghā vīró amŕ̥taṃ  dūtáṃ kr̥ṇvīta mártyaḥ  pāvakáṃ kr̥ṣṇávartaniṃ víhāyasam

translation.text: Him may the mortal hero make his own immortal messenger. Far-spreading, Purifier, him whose path is black.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं हु॑वेम य॒तस्रु॑चः सु॒भासं॑ शु॒क्रशो॑चिषम् वि॒शाम॒ग्निम॒जरं॑ प्र॒त्नमीड्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: táṃ huvema yatásrucaḥ  subhā́saṃ śukráśociṣam  viśā́m agním ajáram pratnám ī́ḍyam

translation.text: With lifted ladles let us call him splendid with his brilliant flame, Men's ancient Agni, wasting not, adorable.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो अ॑स्मै ह॒व्यदा॑तिभि॒राहु॑तिं॒ मर्तोऽवि॑धत् भूरि॒ पोषं॒ स ध॑त्ते वी॒रव॒द्यशः॑
verses.transliteration: yó asmai havyádātibhir  ā́hutim mártó 'vidhat  bhū́ri póṣaṃ sá dhatte vīrávad yáśaḥ

translation.text: The man who pays the worship due to him with sacrificial gifts Obtains both plenteous nourishment and hero fame.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र॒थ॒मं जा॒तवे॑दसम॒ग्निं य॒ज्ञेषु॑ पू॒र्व्यम् प्रति॒ स्रुगे॑ति॒ नम॑सा ह॒विष्म॑ती
verses.transliteration: prathamáṃ jātávedasam  agníṃ yajñéṣu pūrvyám  práti srúg eti námasā havíṣmatī

translation.text: To Jâtavedas Agni, chief in sacrifices, first of all With homage goes the ladle rich with sacred gifts.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आभि॑र्विधेमा॒ग्नये॒ ज्येष्ठा॑भिर्व्यश्व॒वत् मंहि॑ष्ठाभिर्म॒तिभिः॑ शु॒क्रशो॑चिषे
verses.transliteration: ā́bhir vidhemāgnáye  jyéṣṭhābhir vyaśvavát  máṃhiṣṭhābhir matíbhiḥ śukráśociṣe

translation.text: Even as Vyatya did, may we with these most high and liberal hymns Pay worship unto Agni of the splendid flame.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नू॒नम॑र्च॒ विहा॑यसे॒ स्तोमे॑भिः स्थूरयूप॒वत् ऋषे॑ वैयश्व॒ दम्या॑या॒ग्नये॑
verses.transliteration: nūnám arca víhāyase  stómebhi sthūrayūpavát  ŕ̥ṣe vaiyaśva dámyāyāgnáye

translation.text: Now sing, as Sthurayupa sang, with lands to him who spreadeth far, To Agni of the home, O R̥ishi, Vyaṣva's son.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अति॑थिं॒ मानु॑षाणां सू॒नुं वन॒स्पती॑नाम् विप्रा॑ अ॒ग्निमव॑से प्र॒त्नमी॑ळते
verses.transliteration: átithim mā́nuṣāṇām  sūnúṃ vánaspátīnām  víprā agním ávase pratnám īḷate

translation.text: As welcome guest of human kind, as offspring of the forest kings, The sages worship ancient Agni for his aid.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒हो विश्वाँ॑ अ॒भि ष॒तो॒३॒॑ऽभि ह॒व्यानि॒ मानु॑षा अग्ने॒ नि ष॑त्सि॒ नम॒साधि॑ ब॒र्हिषि॑
verses.transliteration: mahó víśvām̐ abhí ṣatáḥ-  -abhí havyā́ni mā́nuṣā  ágne ní ṣatsi námasā́dhi barhíṣi

translation.text: For men's oblations brought to him who is the mighty Lord of all, Sit, Agni, mid our homage, on the sacred grass.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वंस्वा॑ नो॒ वार्या॑ पु॒रु वंस्व॑ रा॒यः पु॑रु॒स्पृहः॑ सु॒वीर्य॑स्य प्र॒जाव॑तो॒ यश॑स्वतः
verses.transliteration: váṃsvā no vā́ryā purú  váṃsva rāyáḥ puruspŕ̥haḥ  suvī́ryasya prajā́vato yáśasvataḥ

translation.text: Grant us abundant. treasures, grant the opulence which many crave, With store of heroes, progeny, and high renown.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं व॑रो सु॒षाम्णेऽग्ने॒ जना॑य चोदय सदा॑ वसो रा॒तिं य॑विष्ठ॒ शश्व॑ते
verses.transliteration: tváṃ varo suṣā́mṇe-  -ágne jánāya codaya  sádā vaso rātíṃ yaviṣṭha śáśvate

translation.text: Agni, Most Youthful of the Gods, send evermore the gift of wealth Unto Varosushâman and to all his folk.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं हि सु॑प्र॒तूरसि॒ त्वं नो॒ गोम॑ती॒रिषः॑ म॒हो रा॒यः सा॒तिम॑ग्ने॒ अपा॑ वृधि
verses.transliteration: tváṃ hí supratū́r ási  tváṃ no gómatīr íṣaḥ  mahó rāyáḥ sātím agne ápā vr̥dhi

translation.text: A mighty Conqueror art thou, O Agni, so disclose to us Food in our herds of kine and gain of ample wealth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्ने॒ त्वं य॒शा अ॒स्या मि॒त्रावरु॑णा वह ऋ॒तावा॑ना स॒म्राजा॑ पू॒तद॑क्षसा
verses.transliteration: ágne tváṃ yaśā́ asi-  ā́ mitrā́váruṇā vaha  r̥tā́vānā samrā́jā pūtádakṣasā

translation.text: Thou, Agni, art a glorious God: bring hither Mitra, Varuṇa, Imperial Sovrans, holy-minded, true to Law.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सखा॑य॒ आ शि॑षामहि॒ ब्रह्मेन्द्रा॑य व॒ज्रिणे॑ स्तु॒ष ऊ॒ षु वो॒ नृत॑माय धृ॒ष्णवे॑
verses.transliteration: sákhāya ā́ śiṣāmahi  bráhméndrāya vajríṇe  stuṣá ū ṣú vo nŕ̥tamāya dhr̥ṣṇáve

translation.text: COMPANIONS, let us learn a prayer to Indra. whom the thunder arms, To glorify your bold and most heroic Friend.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शव॑सा॒ ह्यसि॑ श्रु॒तो वृ॑त्र॒हत्ये॑न वृत्र॒हा म॒घैर्म॒घोनो॒ अति॑ शूर दाशसि
verses.transliteration: śávasā hy ási śrutó  vr̥trahátyena vr̥trahā́  maghaír maghóno áti śūra dāśasi

translation.text: For thou by slaying Vr̥itra art the Vr̥itra-slayer, famed for might. Thou, Hero, in rich gifts surpassest wealthy chiefs.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स नः॒ स्तवा॑न॒ आ भ॑र र॒यिं चि॒त्रश्र॑वस्तमम् नि॒रे॒के चि॒द्यो ह॑रिवो॒ वसु॑र्द॒दिः
verses.transliteration: sá na stávāna ā́ bhara  rayíṃ citráśravastamam  nireké cid yó harivo vásur dadíḥ

translation.text: As such, when glorified, bring us riches of very wondrous fame, Set in the highest rank, Wealth-giver, Lord of Bays!

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नि॑रे॒कमु॒त प्रि॒यमिन्द्र॒ दर्षि॒ जना॑नाम् धृ॒ष॒ता धृ॑ष्णो॒ स्तव॑मान॒ आ भ॑र
verses.transliteration: ā́ nirekám utá priyám  índra dárṣi jánānām  dhr̥ṣatā́ dhr̥ṣṇo stávamāna ā́ bhara

translation.text: Yea, Indra, thou disclosest that preeminent dear wealth of men: Boldly, O Bold One, glorified, bring it to us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न ते॑ स॒व्यं न दक्षि॑णं॒ हस्तं॑ वरन्त आ॒मुरः॑ न प॑रि॒बाधो॑ हरिवो॒ गवि॑ष्टिषु
verses.transliteration: ná te savyáṃ ná dákṣiṇaṃ  hástaṃ varanta āmúraḥ  ná paribā́dho harivo gáviṣṭiṣu

translation.text: The workers of destruction stay neither thy right hand nor thy left: Nor hosts that press about thee, Lord of Bays, in fight.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ त्वा॒ गोभि॑रिव व्र॒जं गी॒र्भिर्ऋ॑णोम्यद्रिवः आ स्मा॒ कामं॑ जरि॒तुरा मनः॑ पृण
verses.transliteration: ā́ tvā góbhir iva vrajáṃ  gīrbhír r̥ṇomy adrivaḥ  ā́ smā kā́maṃ jaritúr ā́ mánaḥ pr̥ṇa

translation.text: O Thunder-armed, I come with songs to thee as to a stall with kine: Fulfil the wish and thought of him who sings thy praise.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विश्वा॑नि वि॒श्वम॑नसो धि॒या नो॑ वृत्रहन्तम उग्र॑ प्रणेत॒रधि॒ षू व॑सो गहि
verses.transliteration: víśvāni viśvámanaso  dhiyā́ no vr̥trahantama  úgra praṇetar ádhi ṣū́ vaso gahi

translation.text: Chief Vr̥itra-slayer, through the hymn of Viṣvamanas think of all, All that concerneth us, Excellent, Mighty Guide.

verses.sanskrit_deva: व॒यं ते॑ अ॒स्य वृ॑त्रहन्वि॒द्याम॑ शूर॒ नव्य॑सः वसोः॑ स्पा॒र्हस्य॑ पुरुहूत॒ राध॑सः
verses.transliteration: vayáṃ te asyá vr̥trahan  vidyā́ma śūra návyasaḥ  váso spārhásya puruhūta rā́dhasaḥ

translation.text: May we, O Vr̥itra-slayer, O Hero, find this thy newest boon, Longed-for, and excellent, thou who art much invoked!

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॒ यथा॒ ह्यस्ति॒ तेऽप॑रीतं नृतो॒ शवः॑ अमृ॑क्ता रा॒तिः पु॑रुहूत दा॒शुषे॑
verses.transliteration: índra yáthā hy ásti te-  -áparītaṃ nr̥to śávaḥ  ámr̥ktā rātíḥ puruhūta dāśúṣe

translation.text: O Indra, Dancer, Much-invoked! as thy great power is unsurpassed, So be thy bounty to the worshipper unchecked.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ वृ॑षस्व महामह म॒हे नृ॑तम॒ राध॑से दृ॒ळ्हश्चि॑द्दृह्य मघवन्म॒घत्त॑ये
verses.transliteration: ā́ vr̥ṣasva mahāmaha  mahé nr̥tama rā́dhase  dr̥ḷháś cid dr̥hya maghavan magháttaye

translation.text: Most Mighty, most heroic One, for mighty bounty fill thee full. Though strong, strengthen thyself to win wealth, Maghavan!

verses.sanskrit_deva: नू अ॒न्यत्रा॑ चिदद्रिव॒स्त्वन्नो॑ जग्मुरा॒शसः॑ मघ॑वञ्छ॒ग्धि तव॒ तन्न॑ ऊ॒तिभिः॑
verses.transliteration: nū́ anyátrā cid adrivas  tván no jagmur āśásaḥ  mághavañ chagdhí táva tán na ūtíbhiḥ

translation.text: O Thunderer, never have our prayers gone forth to any God but thee: So help us, Maghavan, with thine assistance now.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न॒ह्य१॒॑ङ्ग नृ॑तो॒ त्वद॒न्यं वि॒न्दामि॒ राध॑से रा॒ये द्यु॒म्नाय॒ शव॑से च गिर्वणः
verses.transliteration: nahy àṅgá nr̥to tvád  anyáṃ vindā́mi rā́dhase  rāyé dyumnā́ya śávase ca girvaṇaḥ

translation.text: For, Dancer, verily I find none else for bounty, saving thee, For splendid wealth and power, thou Lover of the Song.

verses.sanskrit_deva: एन्दु॒मिन्द्रा॑य सिञ्चत॒ पिबा॑ति सो॒म्यं मधु॑ प्र राध॑सा चोदयाते महित्व॒ना
verses.transliteration: éndum índrāya siñcata  píbāti somyám mádhu  prá rā́dhasā codayāte mahitvanā́

translation.text: For Indra pour ye out the drops meath blent with Soma let him drink With bounty and with majesty will he further us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उपो॒ हरी॑णां॒ पतिं॒ दक्षं॑ पृ॒ञ्चन्त॑मब्रवम् नू॒नं श्रु॑धि स्तुव॒तो अ॒श्व्यस्य॑
verses.transliteration: úpo hárīṇām pátiṃ  dákṣam pr̥ñcántam abravam  nūnáṃ śrudhi stuvató aśvyásya

translation.text: I spake to the Bay Coursers' Lord, to him who gives ability: Now hear the son of Aṣva as he praises thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न॒ह्य१॒॑ङ्ग पु॒रा च॒न ज॒ज्ञे वी॒रत॑र॒स्त्वत् नकी॑ रा॒या नैवथा॒ न भ॒न्दना॑
verses.transliteration: nahy àṅgá purā́ caná  jajñé vīrátaras tvát  nákī rāyā́ naíváthā ná bhandánā

translation.text: Never was any Hero born before thee mightier than thou: None certairdy like thee in goodness and in wealth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: एदु॒ मध्वो॑ म॒दिन्त॑रं सि॒ञ्च वा॑ध्वर्यो॒ अन्ध॑सः ए॒वा हि वी॒रः स्तव॑ते स॒दावृ॑धः
verses.transliteration: éd u mádhvo madíntaraṃ  siñcá vādhvaryo ándhasaḥ  evā́ hí vīrá stávate sadā́vr̥dhaḥ

translation.text: O ministering priest, pour out of the sweet juice what gladdens most: So is the Hero praised who ever prospers us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॑ स्थातर्हरीणां॒ नकि॑ष्टे पू॒र्व्यस्तु॑तिम् उदा॑नंश॒ शव॑सा॒ न भ॒न्दना॑
verses.transliteration: índra sthātar harīṇāṃ  nákiṣ ṭe pūrvyástutim  úd ānaṃśa śávasā ná bhandánā

translation.text: Indra, whom Tawny Coursers bear, praise such as thine, preeminent, None by his power or by his goodness hath attained.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं वो॒ वाजा॑नां॒ पति॒महू॑महि श्रव॒स्यवः॑ अप्रा॑युभिर्य॒ज्ञेभि॑र्वावृ॒धेन्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: táṃ vo vā́jānām pátim  áhūmahi śravasyávaḥ  áprāyubhir yajñébhir vāvr̥dhényam

translation.text: We, seeking glory, have invoked this Master of all power and might Who must be glorified by constant sacri fice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: एतो॒ न्विन्द्रं॒ स्तवा॑म॒ सखा॑यः॒ स्तोम्यं॒ नर॑म् कृ॒ष्टीर्यो विश्वा॑ अ॒भ्यस्त्येक॒ इत्
verses.transliteration: éto nv índraṃ stávāma  sákhāya stómyaṃ náram  kr̥ṣṭī́r yó víśvā abhy ásty éka ít

translation.text: Come, sing we praise to Indra, friends, the Hero who deserves the laud, Him who with none to aid o'ercomes all tribes of men.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अगो॑रुधाय ग॒विषे॑ द्यु॒क्षाय॒ दस्म्यं॒ वचः॑ घृ॒तात्स्वादी॑यो॒ मधु॑नश्च वोचत
verses.transliteration: ágorudhāya gavíṣe  dyukṣā́ya dásmyaṃ vácaḥ  ghr̥tā́t svā́dīyo mádhunaś ca vocata

translation.text: To him who wins the kine, who keeps no cattle back, Celestial God, Speak wondrous speech more sweet than butter and than meath.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्यामि॑तानि वी॒र्या॒३॒॑ न राधः॒ पर्ये॑तवे ज्योति॒र्न विश्व॑म॒भ्यस्ति॒ दक्षि॑णा
verses.transliteration: yásyā́mitāni vīryā̀  ná rā́dhaḥ páryetave  jyótir ná víśvam abhy ásti dákṣiṇā

translation.text: Whose hero powers are measureless, whose bounty ne'er may be surpassed, Whose liberality, like light, is over all.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्तु॒हीन्द्रं॑ व्यश्व॒वदनू॑र्मिं वा॒जिनं॒ यम॑म् अ॒र्यो गयं॒ मंह॑मानं॒ वि दा॒शुषे॑
verses.transliteration: stuhī́ndraṃ vyaśvavád  ánūrmiṃ vājínaṃ yámam  aryó gáyam máṃhamānaṃ ví dāśúṣe

translation.text: As Vyaṣva did, praise Indra, praise the Strong unfluctuating Guide, Who gives the foe's possessions to the worshipper.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒वा नू॒नमुप॑ स्तुहि॒ वैय॑श्व दश॒मं नव॑म् सुवि॑द्वांसं च॒र्कृत्यं॑ च॒रणी॑नाम्
verses.transliteration: evā́ nūnám úpa stuhi  vaíyaśva daśamáṃ návam  súvidvāṃsaṃ carkŕ̥tyaṃ caráṇīnām

translation.text: Now, son of Vyaṣva, praise thou him who to the tenth time still is new, The very Wise, whom living men must glorify

verses.sanskrit_deva: वेत्था॒ हि निर्ऋ॑तीनां॒ वज्र॑हस्त परि॒वृज॑म् अह॑रहः शु॒न्ध्युः प॑रि॒पदा॑मिव
verses.transliteration: vétthā hí nírr̥tīnāṃ  vájrahasta parivŕ̥jam  áhar-ahaḥ śundhyúḥ paripádām iva

translation.text: Thou knowest, Indra, Thunder-armed, how to avoid destructive powers, As one secure from pitfalls each returning day.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तदि॒न्द्राव॒ आ भ॑र॒ येना॑ दंसिष्ठ॒ कृत्व॑ने द्वि॒ता कुत्सा॑य शिश्नथो॒ नि चो॑दय
verses.transliteration: tád indrā́va ā́ bhara  yénā daṃsiṣṭha kŕ̥tvane  dvitā́ kútsāya śiśnatho ní codaya

translation.text: O Indra, bring that aid wherewith of old, Most Wondrous! thou didst slay His foes for active Kutsa: send it down to us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तमु॑ त्वा नू॒नमी॑महे॒ नव्यं॑ दंसिष्ठ॒ सन्य॑से स त्वं नो॒ विश्वा॑ अ॒भिमा॑तीः स॒क्षणिः॑
verses.transliteration: tám u tvā nūnám īmahe  návyaṃ daṃsiṣṭha sányase  sá tváṃ no víśvā abhímātīḥ sakṣáṇiḥ

translation.text: So now we seek thee fresh in might, Most Wonderful in act! for gain: For thou art he who conquers all our foes for us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य ऋक्षा॒दंह॑सो मु॒चद्यो वार्या॑त्स॒प्त सिन्धु॑षु वध॑र्दा॒सस्य॑ तुविनृम्ण नीनमः
verses.transliteration: yá ŕ̥kṣād áṃhaso mucád  yó vā́ryāt saptá síndhuṣu  vádhar dāsásya tuvinr̥mṇa nīnamaḥ

translation.text: Who will set free from ruinous woe, or Ârya on the Seven Streams: O valiant Hero, bend the Dâsa's weapon down.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यथा॑ वरो सु॒षाम्णे॑ स॒निभ्य॒ आव॑हो र॒यिम् व्य॑श्वेभ्यः सुभगे वाजिनीवति
verses.transliteration: yáthā varo suṣā́mṇe  saníbhya ā́vaho rayím  vyàśvebhyaḥ subhage vājinīvati

translation.text: As to Varosushâman thou broughtest great riches, for their gain, To Vyaṣva's sons, Blest Lady, rich in ample wealth!

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ ना॒र्यस्य॒ दक्षि॑णा॒ व्य॑श्वाँ एतु सो॒मिनः॑ स्थू॒रं च॒ राधः॑ श॒तव॑त्स॒हस्र॑वत्
verses.transliteration: ā́ nāryásya dákṣiṇā  vyàśvām̐ etu somínaḥ  sthūráṃ ca rā́dhaḥ śatávat sahásravat

translation.text: Let Nârya's sacrificial meed reach Vyaṣva's Soma-bearing sons: In hundreds and in thousands be the great reward.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यत्त्वा॑ पृ॒च्छादी॑जा॒नः कु॑ह॒या कु॑हयाकृते ए॒षो अप॑श्रितो व॒लो गो॑म॒तीमव॑ तिष्ठति
verses.transliteration: yát tvā pr̥chā́d ījānáḥ  kuhayā́ kuhayākr̥te  eṣó ápaśrito való  gomatī́m áva tiṣṭhati

translation.text: If one should ask thee, Where is he who sacrificed? Whither lookest thou? Like Vala he hath passed away and dwelleth now on Gomatî.

suktas.deity: Mitra and Varuna and Other Gods

verses.sanskrit_deva: ता वां॒ विश्व॑स्य गो॒पा दे॒वा दे॒वेषु॑ य॒ज्ञिया॑ ऋ॒तावा॑ना यजसे पू॒तद॑क्षसा
verses.transliteration: tā́ vāṃ víśvasya gopā́  devā́ devéṣu yajñíyā  r̥tā́vānā yajase pūtádakṣasā

translation.text: I WORSHIP you who guard this All, Gods, holiest among the Gods, You, faithful to the Law, whose power is sanctified.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मि॒त्रा तना॒ न र॒थ्या॒३॒॑ वरु॑णो॒ यश्च॑ सु॒क्रतुः॑ स॒नात्सु॑जा॒ता तन॑या धृ॒तव्र॑ता
verses.transliteration: mitrā́ tánā ná rathyā̀  váruṇo yáś ca sukrátuḥ  sanā́t sujātā́ tánayā dhr̥távratā

translation.text: So, too, like charioteers are they, Mitra and sapient Varuṇa, Sons high-born from of old, whose holy laws stand fast.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ता मा॒ता वि॒श्ववे॑दसासु॒र्या॑य॒ प्रम॑हसा म॒ही ज॑जा॒नादि॑तिर्ऋ॒ताव॑री
verses.transliteration: tā́ mātā́ viśvávedasā-  asuryā̀ya prámahasā  mahī́ jajānā́ditir r̥tā́varī

translation.text: These Twain, possessors of all wealth, most glorious, for supremest sway Aditi, Mighty Mother, true to Law, brought forth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒हान्ता॑ मि॒त्रावरु॑णा स॒म्राजा॑ दे॒वावसु॑रा ऋ॒तावा॑नावृ॒तमा घो॑षतो बृ॒हत्
verses.transliteration: mahā́ntā mitrā́váruṇā  samrā́jā devā́v ásurā  r̥tā́vānāv r̥tám ā́ ghoṣato br̥hát

translation.text: Great Varuṇa and Mitra, Gods, Asuras and imperial Lords, True to Eternal Law proclaim the high decree.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नपा॑ता॒ शव॑सो म॒हः सू॒नू दक्ष॑स्य सु॒क्रतू॑ सृ॒प्रदा॑नू इ॒षो वास्त्वधि॑ क्षितः
verses.transliteration: nápātā śávaso maháḥ  sūnū́ dákṣasya sukrátū  sr̥prádānū iṣó vā́stv ádhi kṣitaḥ

translation.text: The offspring of a lofty Power, Daksha's Two Sons exceeding strong, Who, Lords of flowing rain, dwell in the place of food.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सं या दानू॑नि ये॒मथु॑र्दि॒व्याः पार्थि॑वी॒रिषः॑ नभ॑स्वती॒रा वां॑ चरन्तु वृ॒ष्टयः॑
verses.transliteration: sáṃ yā́ dā́nūni yemáthur  divyā́ḥ pā́rthivīr íṣaḥ  nábhasvatīr ā́ vāṃ carantu vr̥ṣṭáyaḥ

translation.text: Ye who have gathered up your gifts, celestial and terrestrial food, Let your rain come to us fraught with the mist of heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अधि॒ या बृ॑ह॒तो दि॒वो॒३॒॑ऽभि यू॒थेव॒ पश्य॑तः ऋ॒तावा॑ना स॒म्राजा॒ नम॑से हि॒ता
verses.transliteration: ádhi yā́ br̥ható diváḥ-  -abhí yūthéva páśyataḥ  r̥tā́vānā samrā́jā námase hitā́

translation.text: The Twain, who from the lofty sky seem to look down on herds below, Holy, imperial Lords, are set to be revered.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋ॒तावा॑ना॒ नि षे॑दतुः॒ साम्रा॑ज्याय सु॒क्रतू॑ धृ॒तव्र॑ता क्ष॒त्रिया॑ क्ष॒त्रमा॑शतुः
verses.transliteration: r̥tā́vānā ní ṣedatuḥ  sā́mrājyāya sukrátū  dhr̥távratā kṣatríyā kṣatrám āśatuḥ

translation.text: They, true to Law, exceeding strong, have sat them down for savran rule: Princes whose laws stand fast, they have obtained their sway.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒क्ष्णश्चि॑द्गातु॒वित्त॑रानुल्ब॒णेन॒ चक्ष॑सा नि चि॑न्मि॒षन्ता॑ निचि॒रा नि चि॑क्यतुः
verses.transliteration: akṣṇáś cid gātuvíttarā-  -anulbaṇéna cákṣasā  ní cin miṣántā nicirā́ ní cikyatuḥ

translation.text: Pathfinders even better than the eye, with unobstructed sight, Even when they close their lids, observant, they perceive.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त नो॑ दे॒व्यदि॑तिरुरु॒ष्यतां॒ नास॑त्या उ॒रु॒ष्यन्तु॑ म॒रुतो॑ वृ॒द्धश॑वसः
verses.transliteration: utá no devy áditir  uruṣyátāṃ nā́satyā  uruṣyántu marúto vr̥ddháśavasaḥ

translation.text: So may the Goddess Aditi, may the Nâsatyas guard us well, The Martits guard us well,.endowed with mighty strength.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ते नो॑ ना॒वमु॑रुष्यत॒ दिवा॒ नक्तं॑ सुदानवः अरि॑ष्यन्तो॒ नि पा॒युभिः॑ सचेमहि
verses.transliteration: té no nāvám uruṣyata  dívā náktaṃ sudānavaḥ  áriṣyanto ní pāyúbhiḥ sacemahi

translation.text: Do ye, O Bounteous Gods, protect our dwelling lace by day and night: With you for our defenders may we go unharmed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अघ्न॑ते॒ विष्ण॑वे व॒यमरि॑ष्यन्तः सु॒दान॑वे श्रु॒धि स्व॑यावन्त्सिन्धो पू॒र्वचि॑त्तये
verses.transliteration: ághnate víṣṇave vayám  áriṣyantaḥ sudā́nave  śrudhí svayāvan sindho pūrvácittaye

translation.text: May we, unharmed, serve bountiful Vishṇu, the God who slayeth none: Self-moving Sindhu hear and be the first to mark.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तद्वार्यं॑ वृणीमहे॒ वरि॑ष्ठं गोप॒यत्य॑म् मि॒त्रो यत्पान्ति॒ वरु॑णो॒ यद॑र्य॒मा
verses.transliteration: tád vā́ryaṃ vr̥ṇīmahe  váriṣṭhaṃ gopayátyam  mitró yát pā́nti váruṇo yád aryamā́

translation.text: This sure protection we elect, desirable and reaching far, Which Mitra, Varuṇa, and Aryaman afford.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त नः॒ सिन्धु॑र॒पां तन्म॒रुत॒स्तद॒श्विना॑ इन्द्रो॒ विष्णु॑र्मी॒ढ्वांसः॑ स॒जोष॑सः
verses.transliteration: utá naḥ síndhur apā́ṃ  tán marútas tád aśvínā  índro víṣṇur mīḍhvā́ṃsaḥ sajóṣasaḥ

translation.text: And may the Sindhu of the floods, the Maruts, and the ASvin Pair, Boon Indra, and boon Vishṇu have one mind with us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ते हि ष्मा॑ व॒नुषो॒ नरो॒ऽभिमा॑तिं॒ कय॑स्य चित् ति॒ग्मं न क्षोदः॑ प्रति॒घ्नन्ति॒ भूर्ण॑यः
verses.transliteration: té hí ṣmā vanúṣo náro  -abhímātiṃ káyasya cit  tigmáṃ ná kṣódaḥ pratighnánti bhū́rṇayaḥ

translation.text: Because these warring Heroes stay the enmity of every foe, As the fierce water-flood repels the furious ones.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यमेक॑ इ॒त्था पु॒रूरु च॑ष्टे॒ वि वि॒श्पतिः॑ तस्य॑ व्र॒तान्यनु॑ वश्चरामसि
verses.transliteration: ayám éka itthā́ purú-  -urú caṣṭe ví viśpátiḥ  tásya vratā́ny ánu vaś carāmasi

translation.text: Here this one God, the Lord of men, looks forth exceeding far and wide: And we, for your advantage, keep his holy laws.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अनु॒ पूर्वा॑ण्यो॒क्या॑ साम्रा॒ज्यस्य॑ सश्चिम मि॒त्रस्य॑ व्र॒ता वरु॑णस्य दीर्घ॒श्रुत्
verses.transliteration: ánu pū́rvāṇy okyā̀  sāmrājyásya saścima  mitrásya vratā́ váruṇasya dīrghaśrút

translation.text: We keep the old accustomed laws, the statutes of supremacy, The Iong-known laws of Mitra and of Varuṇa.

verses.sanskrit_deva: परि॒ यो र॒श्मिना॑ दि॒वोऽन्ता॑न्म॒मे पृ॑थि॒व्याः उ॒भे आ प॑प्रौ॒ रोद॑सी महि॒त्वा
verses.transliteration: pári yó raśmínā divó  -ántān mamé pr̥thivyā́ḥ  ubhé ā́ paprau ródasī mahitvā́

translation.text: He who hath measured with his ray the boundaries of heaven and earth, And with his majesty hath filled the two worlds full,

verses.sanskrit_deva: उदु॒ ष्य श॑र॒णे दि॒वो ज्योति॑रयंस्त॒ सूर्यः॑ अ॒ग्निर्न शु॒क्रः स॑मिधा॒न आहु॑तः
verses.transliteration: úd u ṣyá śaraṇé divó  jyótir ayaṃsta sū́ryaḥ  agnír ná śukráḥ samidhāná ā́hutaḥ

translation.text: Sûrya hath spread his light aloft up to the region of the sky, Like Agni all aflame when gifts are offered him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वचो॑ दी॒र्घप्र॑सद्म॒नीशे॒ वाज॑स्य॒ गोम॑तः ईशे॒ हि पि॒त्वो॑ऽवि॒षस्य॑ दा॒वने॑
verses.transliteration: váco dīrgháprasadmani-  -ī́śe vā́jasya gómataḥ  ī́śe hí pitvò 'viṣásya dāváne

translation.text: With him who sits afar the word is lord of food that comes from kine, Controller of the gift of unempoisoned food.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तत्सूर्यं॒ रोद॑सी उ॒भे दो॒षा वस्तो॒रुप॑ ब्रुवे भो॒जेष्व॒स्माँ अ॒भ्युच्च॑रा॒ सदा॑
verses.transliteration: tát sū́ryaṃ ródasī ubhé  doṣā́ vástor úpa bruve  bhojéṣv asmā́m̐ abhy úc carā sádā

translation.text: So unto Sûrya, Heaven, and Earth at morning and at eve I speak. Bringing enjoyments ever rise thou up for us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋ॒ज्रमु॑क्ष॒ण्याय॑ने रज॒तं हर॑याणे रथं॑ यु॒क्तम॑सनाम सु॒षाम॑णि
verses.transliteration: r̥jrám ukṣaṇyā́yane  rajatáṃ hárayāṇe  ráthaṃ yuktám asanāma suṣā́maṇi

translation.text: From Ukshaṇyâyana a bay, from Harayâṇa a white steed, And from Sushâman we obtained a hamessed car.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ता मे॒ अश्व्या॑नां॒ हरी॑णां नि॒तोश॑ना उ॒तो नु कृत्व्या॑नां नृ॒वाह॑सा
verses.transliteration: tā́ me áśvyānāṃ  hárīṇāṃ nitóśanā  utó nú kŕ̥tvyānāṃ nr̥vā́hasā

translation.text: These two shall bring me further gain of troops of tawny-coloured steeds, The carriers shall they be of active men of war.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्मद॑भीशू॒ कशा॑वन्ता॒ विप्रा॒ नवि॑ष्ठया म॒ती म॒हो वा॒जिना॒वर्व॑न्ता॒ सचा॑सनम्
verses.transliteration: smádabhīśū káśāvantā  víprā náviṣṭhayā matī́  mahó vājínāv árvantā sácāsanam

translation.text: And the two sages have I gained who hold the reins and bear the whip, And the two great strong coursers, with my newest song.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वोरु॒ षू रथं॑ हुवे स॒धस्तु॑त्याय सू॒रिषु॑ अतू॑र्तदक्षा वृषणा वृषण्वसू
verses.transliteration: yuvór u ṣū́ ráthaṃ huve  sadhástutyāya sūríṣu  átūrtadakṣā vr̥ṣaṇā vr̥ṣaṇvasū

translation.text: I CALL your chariot to receive united praise mid princely men, Strong Gods who pour down wealth, of never vanquished might!

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वं व॑रो सु॒षाम्णे॑ म॒हे तने॑ नासत्या अवो॑भिर्याथो वृषणा वृषण्वसू
verses.transliteration: yuváṃ varo suṣā́mṇe  mahé táne nāsatyā  ávobhir yātho vr̥ṣaṇā vr̥ṣaṇvasū

translation.text: Ye to Varosushâman come, Nâsatyas, for this glorious rite. With your protecting aid. Strong Gods, who pour down wealth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ता वा॑म॒द्य ह॑वामहे ह॒व्येभि॑र्वाजिनीवसू पू॒र्वीरि॒ष इ॒षय॑न्ता॒वति॑ क्ष॒पः
verses.transliteration: tā́ vām adyá havāmahe  havyébhir vājinīvasū  pūrvī́r iṣá iṣáyantāv áti kṣapáḥ

translation.text: So with oblations we invoke you, rich in ample wealth, to-day, When night hath passed, O ye who send us plenteous food. O Aṣvins, Heroes, let your car, famed, best to travel, come to us, And, for his glory, mark your zealous servant's lauds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ वां॒ वाहि॑ष्ठो अश्विना॒ रथो॑ यातु श्रु॒तो न॑रा उप॒ स्तोमा॑न्तु॒रस्य॑ दर्शथः श्रि॒ये
verses.transliteration: ā́ vāṃ vā́hiṣṭho aśvinā  rátho yātu śrutó narā  úpa stómān turásya darśathaḥ śriyé

translation.text: O Aṣvins, Heroes, let your car, famed, best to travel, come to us, And, for his glory, mark your zealous servant's lauds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: जु॒हु॒रा॒णा चि॑दश्वि॒ना म॑न्येथां वृषण्वसू यु॒वं हि रु॑द्रा॒ पर्ष॑थो॒ अति॒ द्विषः॑
verses.transliteration: juhurāṇā́ cid aśvinā-  -ā́ manyethāṃ vr̥ṣaṇvasū  yuváṃ hí rudrā párṣatho áti dvíṣaḥ

translation.text: Aṣvins, who send us precious gifts, even when offended, think of him: For ye, O Rudras, lead us safe beyond our foes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द॒स्रा हि विश्व॑मानु॒षङ्म॒क्षूभिः॑ परि॒दीय॑थः धि॒यं॒जि॒न्वा मधु॑वर्णा शु॒भस्पती॑
verses.transliteration: dasrā́ hí víśvam ānuṣák-  makṣū́bhiḥ paridī́yathaḥ  dhiyaṃjinvā́ mádhuvarṇā śubhás pátī

translation.text: For, Wonder-Workers, with fleet steeds ye fly completely round this All, Stirring our thoughts, ye Lords of splendour, honey-hued.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उप॑ नो यातमश्विना रा॒या वि॑श्व॒पुषा॑ स॒ह म॒घवा॑ना सु॒वीरा॒वन॑पच्युता
verses.transliteration: úpa no yātam aśvinā  rāyā́ viśvapúṣā sahá  maghávānā suvī́rāv ánapacyutā

translation.text: With all-sustaining opulence, Aṣvins, come hitherward to us, Ye rich and noble Heroes, ne'er to be o'erthrown.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ मे॑ अ॒स्य प्र॑ती॒व्य१॒॑मिन्द्र॑नासत्या गतम् दे॒वा दे॒वेभि॑र॒द्य स॒चन॑स्तमा
verses.transliteration: ā́ me asyá pratīvyàm  índranāsatyā gatam  devā́ devébhir adyá sacánastamā

translation.text: To welcome this mine offering, O ye Indra-like Nâsatyas, come As Gods of best accord this day with other Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: व॒यं हि वां॒ हवा॑मह उक्ष॒ण्यन्तो॑ व्यश्व॒वत् सु॒म॒तिभि॒रुप॑ विप्रावि॒हा ग॑तम्
verses.transliteration: vayáṃ hí vāṃ hávāmahe-  ukṣaṇyánto vyaśvavát  sumatíbhir úpa viprāv ihā́ gatam

translation.text: For we, like Vyaṣva, lifting up our voice like oxen, call on you: With all your loving kindness, Sages, come to us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒श्विना॒ स्वृ॑षे स्तुहि कु॒वित्ते॒ श्रव॑तो॒ हव॑म् नेदी॑यसः कूळयातः प॒णीँरु॒त
verses.transliteration: aśvínā sv r̥̀ṣe stuhi  kuvít te śrávato hávam  nédīyasaḥ kūḷayātaḥ paṇī́m̐r utá

translation.text: O R̥ishi, laud the Aṣvins well. Will they not listen to thy call? Will they not bum the Paṇis who are nearer them?

verses.sanskrit_deva: वै॒य॒श्वस्य॑ श्रुतं नरो॒तो मे॑ अ॒स्य वे॑दथः स॒जोष॑सा॒ वरु॑णो मि॒त्रो अ॑र्य॒मा
verses.transliteration: vaiyaśvásya śrutaṃ narā-  -utó me asyá vedathaḥ  sajóṣasā váruṇo mitró aryamā́

translation.text: O Heroes, listen to the son of Vyaṣva, and regard me here, Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman, of one accord.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वाद॑त्तस्य धिष्ण्या यु॒वानी॑तस्य सू॒रिभिः॑ अह॑रहर्वृषण॒ मह्यं॑ शिक्षतम्
verses.transliteration: yuvā́dattasya dhiṣṇyā  yuvā́nītasya sūríbhiḥ  áhar-ahar vr̥ṣaṇa máhyaṃ śikṣatam

translation.text: Gods whom we yearn for, of your gifts, of what ye bring to us, bestow By princes' hands on me, ye Mighty, day by day.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो वां॑ य॒ज्ञेभि॒रावृ॒तोऽधि॑वस्त्रा व॒धूरि॑व स॒प॒र्यन्ता॑ शु॒भे च॑क्राते अ॒श्विना॑
verses.transliteration: yó vāṃ yajñébhir ā́vr̥taḥ-  -ádhivastrā vadhū́r iva  saparyántā śubhé cakrāte aśvínā

translation.text: Him whom your sacrifices clothe, even as a woman with her robe, The Aṣvins help to glory honouring him well.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो वा॑मुरु॒व्यच॑स्तमं॒ चिके॑तति नृ॒पाय्य॑म् व॒र्तिर॑श्विना॒ परि॑ यातमस्म॒यू
verses.transliteration: yó vām uruvyácastamaṃ  cíketati nr̥pā́yyam  vartír aśvinā pári yātam asmayū́

translation.text: Whoso regards your care of men as succour widest in its reach, About his dwelling go, ye Aṣvins, loving us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्मभ्यं॒ सु वृ॑षण्वसू या॒तं व॒र्तिर्नृ॒पाय्य॑म् वि॒षु॒द्रुहे॑व य॒ज्ञमू॑हथुर्गि॒रा
verses.transliteration: asmábhyaṃ sú vr̥ṣaṇvasū  yātáṃ vartír nr̥pā́yyam  viṣudrúheva yajñám ūhathur girā́

translation.text: Come to us ye who pour down wealth, come to the home which men must guard: Like shafts, ye are made meet for sacrifice by song.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वाहि॑ष्ठो वां॒ हवा॑नां॒ स्तोमो॑ दू॒तो हु॑वन्नरा यु॒वाभ्यां॑ भूत्वश्विना
verses.transliteration: vā́hiṣṭho vāṃ hávānāṃ  stómo dūtó huvan narā  yuvā́bhyām bhūtv aśvinā

translation.text: Most fetching of all calls, the laud, as envoy, Heroes, called to you Be it your own, O Aṣvin Pair.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यद॒दो दि॒वो अ॑र्ण॒व इ॒षो वा॒ मद॑थो गृ॒हे श्रु॒तमिन्मे॑ अमर्त्या
verses.transliteration: yád adó divó arṇavé-  iṣó vā mádatho gr̥hé  śrutám ín me amartyā

translation.text: Be ye in yonder sea of heaven, or joying in the home of food, Listen to me, Immortal Ones.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त स्या श्वे॑त॒याव॑री॒ वाहि॑ष्ठा वां न॒दीना॑म् सिन्धु॒र्हिर॑ण्यवर्तनिः
verses.transliteration: utá syā́ śvetayā́varī  vā́hiṣṭhā vāṃ nadī́nām  síndhur híraṇyavartaniḥ

translation.text: This river with his lucid flow attracts you, more than all the streams,– Even Sindhu with his path of gold.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्मदे॒तया॑ सुकी॒र्त्याश्वि॑ना श्वे॒तया॑ धि॒या वहे॑थे शुभ्रयावाना
verses.transliteration: smád etáyā sukīrtyā́-  -áśvinā śvetáyā dhiyā́  váhethe śubhrayāvānā

translation.text: O Aṣvins, with that glorious fame come hither, through our brilliant song, Come ye whose ways are marked with light.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒क्ष्वा हि त्वं र॑था॒सहा॑ यु॒वस्व॒ पोष्या॑ वसो आन्नो॑ वायो॒ मधु॑ पिबा॒स्माकं॒ सव॒ना ग॑हि
verses.transliteration: yukṣvā́ hí tváṃ rathāsáhā  yuvásva póṣyā vaso  ā́n no vāyo mádhu piba-  -asmā́kaṃ sávanā́ gahi

translation.text: Harness the steeds who draw the car, O Vasu, bring the well-fed pair. O Vâyu, drink thou of our meath: come unto our drink-offerings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तव॑ वायवृतस्पते॒ त्वष्टु॑र्जामातरद्भुत अवां॒स्या वृ॑णीमहे
verses.transliteration: táva vāyav r̥taspate  tváṣṭur jāmātar adbhuta  ávāṃsy ā́ vr̥ṇīmahe

translation.text: Wonderful Vâyu, Lord of Right, thou who art Tvashṭar's son-in-law, Thy saving succour we elect.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वष्टु॒र्जामा॑तरं व॒यमीशा॑नं रा॒य ई॑महे सु॒ताव॑न्तो वा॒युं द्यु॒म्ना जना॑सः
verses.transliteration: tváṣṭur jā́mātaraṃ vayám  ī́śānaṃ rāyá īmahe  sutā́vanto vāyúṃ dyumnā́ jánāsaḥ

translation.text: To Tvashṭar's son-in-law we pray for wealth whereof he hath control: For glory we seek Vâyu, men with juice effused.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वायो॑ या॒हि शि॒वा दि॒वो वह॑स्वा॒ सु स्वश्व्य॑म् वह॑स्व म॒हः पृ॑थु॒पक्ष॑सा॒ रथे॑
verses.transliteration: vā́yo yāhí śivā́ divó  váhasvā sú sváśvyam  váhasva maháḥ pr̥thupákṣasā ráthe

translation.text: From heaven, auspicious Vâyu, come drive hither with thy noble steeds: Come on thy mighty car with wide-extending seat.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वां हि सु॒प्सर॑स्तमं नृ॒षद॑नेषु हू॒महे॑ ग्रावा॑णं॒ नाश्व॑पृष्ठं मं॒हना॑
verses.transliteration: tvā́ṃ hí supsárastamaṃ  nr̥ṣádaneṣu hūmáhe  grā́vāṇaṃ nā́śvapr̥ṣṭham maṃhánā

translation.text: We call thee to the homes of men, thee wealthiest in noble food, And liberal as a press-stone with a horse's back.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स त्वं नो॑ देव॒ मन॑सा॒ वायो॑ मन्दा॒नो अ॑ग्रि॒यः कृ॒धि वाजाँ॑ अ॒पो धियः॑
verses.transliteration: sá tváṃ no deva mánasā  vā́yo mandānó agriyáḥ  kr̥dhí vā́jām̐ apó dhíyaḥ

translation.text: So, glad and joyful in thine heart, do thou, God, Vâyu, first of all Vouchsafe us water, strength, and thought.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग्निरु॒क्थे पु॒रोहि॑तो॒ ग्रावा॑णो ब॒र्हिर॑ध्व॒रे ऋ॒चा या॑मि म॒रुतो॒ ब्रह्म॑ण॒स्पतिं॑ दे॒वाँ अवो॒ वरे॑ण्यम्
verses.transliteration: agnír ukthé puróhito  grā́vāṇo barhír adhvaré  r̥cā́ yāmi marúto bráhmaṇas pátiṃ  devā́m̐ ávo váreṇyam

translation.text: CHEIF Priest is Agni at the laud, as stones and grass at sacrifice: With song I seek the Maruts, Brahmaṇaspati, Gods for help much to be desired.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ प॒शुं गा॑सि पृथि॒वीं वन॒स्पती॑नु॒षासा॒ नक्त॒मोष॑धीः विश्वे॑ च नो वसवो विश्ववेदसो धी॒नां भू॑त प्रावि॒तारः॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ paśúṃ gāsi pr̥thivī́ṃ vánaspátīn  uṣā́sā náktam óṣadhīḥ  víśve ca no vasavo viśvavedaso  dhīnā́m bhūta prāvitā́raḥ

translation.text: I sing to cattle and to Earth, to trees, to Dawns, to Night, to plants. O all ye Vasus, ye possessors of all wealth, be ye the furtherers of our thoughts.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र सू न॑ एत्वध्व॒रो॒३॒॑ऽग्ना दे॒वेषु॑ पू॒र्व्यः आ॒दि॒त्येषु॒ प्र वरु॑णे धृ॒तव्र॑ते म॒रुत्सु॑ वि॒श्वभा॑नुषु
verses.transliteration: prá sū́ na etv adhvaráḥ-  -agnā́ devéṣu pūrvyáḥ  ādityéṣu prá váruṇe dhr̥távrate  marútsu viśvábhānuṣu

translation.text: Forth go, with Agni, to the Gods our sacrifice of ancient use, To the Âdityas, Varuṇa whose Law stands fast, and the all-lightening Marut troop.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विश्वे॒ हि ष्मा॒ मन॑वे वि॒श्ववे॑दसो॒ भुव॑न्वृ॒धे रि॒शाद॑सः अरि॑ष्टेभिः पा॒युभि॑र्विश्ववेदसो॒ यन्ता॑ नोऽवृ॒कं छ॒र्दिः
verses.transliteration: víśve hí ṣmā mánave viśvávedaso  bhúvan vr̥dhé riśā́dasaḥ  áriṣṭebhiḥ pāyúbhir viśvavedaso  yántā no 'vr̥káṃ chardíḥ

translation.text: Lords of all wealth, may they be strengtheners of man, destroyers of his enemies. Lords of all wealth, do ye, with guards which none may harm, preserve our dwelling free from foes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नो॑ अ॒द्य सम॑नसो॒ गन्ता॒ विश्वे॑ स॒जोष॑सः ऋ॒चा गि॒रा मरु॑तो॒ देव्यदि॑ते॒ सद॑ने॒ पस्त्ये॑ महि
verses.transliteration: ā́ no adyá sámanaso  gántā víśve sajóṣasaḥ  r̥cā́ girā́ máruto dévy ádite  sádane pástye mahi

translation.text: Come to us with one mind to-day, come to us all with one accord, Maruts with holy song, and, Goddess Aditi, Mighty One, to our house and home.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भि प्रि॒या म॑रुतो॒ या वो॒ अश्व्या॑ ह॒व्या मि॑त्र प्रया॒थन॑ आ ब॒र्हिरिन्द्रो॒ वरु॑णस्तु॒रा नर॑ आदि॒त्यासः॑ सदन्तु नः
verses.transliteration: abhí priyā́ maruto yā́ vo áśvyā  havyā́ mitra prayāthána  ā́ barhír índro váruṇas turā́ náraḥ-  ādityā́saḥ sadantu naḥ

translation.text: Send us delightful things, ye Maruts, on your steeds: come ye, O Mitra, to our gifts. Let Indra, Varuṇa, and the Âdityas sit, swift Heroes, on our sacred grass.

verses.sanskrit_deva: व॒यं वो॑ वृ॒क्तब॑र्हिषो हि॒तप्र॑यस आनु॒षक् सु॒तसो॑मासो वरुण हवामहे मनु॒ष्वदि॒द्धाग्न॑यः
verses.transliteration: vayáṃ vo vr̥ktábarhiṣo  hitáprayasa ānuṣák  sutásomāso varuṇa havāmahe  manuṣvád iddhā́gnayaḥ

translation.text: We who have trimmed the grass for you, and set the banquet in array, And pressed the Soma, call you, Varuina, like men, with sacrificial fires aflame.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ प्र या॑त॒ मरु॑तो॒ विष्णो॒ अश्वि॑ना॒ पूष॒न्माकी॑नया धि॒या इन्द्र॒ आ या॑तु प्रथ॒मः स॑नि॒ष्युभि॒र्वृषा॒ यो वृ॑त्र॒हा गृ॒णे
verses.transliteration: ā́ prá yāta máruto víṣṇo áśvinā  pū́ṣan mā́kīnayā dhiyā́  índra ā́ yātu prathamáḥ saniṣyúbhir  vŕ̥ṣā yó vr̥trahā́ gr̥ṇé

translation.text: O Maruts, Visinu, Aṣvins, Pûshan, haste away with minds turned hitherward to Me. Let the Strong Indra, famed as Vr̥itra's slayer, come first with the winners of the spoil.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि नो॑ देवासो अद्रु॒होऽच्छि॑द्रं॒ शर्म॑ यच्छत न यद्दू॒राद्व॑सवो॒ नू चि॒दन्ति॑तो॒ वरू॑थमाद॒धर्ष॑ति
verses.transliteration: ví no devāso adruhaḥ-  -áchidraṃ śárma yachata  ná yád dūrā́d vasavo nū́ cid ántito  várūtham ādadhárṣati

translation.text: Ye Guileless Gods, bestow on us a refuge strong on every side, A sure protection, Vasus, unassailable from near at hand or from afar.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अस्ति॒ हि वः॑ सजा॒त्यं॑ रिशादसो॒ देवा॑सो॒ अस्त्याप्य॑म् प्र णः॒ पूर्व॑स्मै सुवि॒ताय॑ वोचत म॒क्षू सु॒म्नाय॒ नव्य॑से
verses.transliteration: ásti hí vaḥ sajātyàṃ riśādaso  dévāso ásty ā́pyam  prá ṇaḥ pū́rvasmai suvitā́ya vocata  makṣū́ sumnā́ya návyase

translation.text: Kinship have I with you, and close alliance O ye Gods, destroyers of our foes. Call us to our prosperity of former days, and soon to new klicity.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒दा हि व॒ उप॑स्तुतिमि॒दा वा॒मस्य॑ भ॒क्तये॑ उप॑ वो विश्ववेदसो नम॒स्युराँ असृ॒क्ष्यन्या॑मिव
verses.transliteration: idā́ hí va úpastutim  idā́ vāmásya bhaktáye  úpa vo viśvavedaso namasyúr ā́m̐  ásr̥kṣy ányām iva

translation.text: For now have I sent forth to you, that I may win a fair reward, Lords of all wealth, with homage, this my song of praise. like a milch-cow that faileth not.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उदु॒ ष्य वः॑ सवि॒ता सु॑प्रणीत॒योऽस्था॑दू॒र्ध्वो वरे॑ण्यः नि द्वि॒पाद॒श्चतु॑ष्पादो अ॒र्थिनोऽवि॑श्रन्पतयि॒ष्णवः॑
verses.transliteration: úd u ṣyá vaḥ savitā́ supraṇītayaḥ-  -ásthād ūrdhvó váreṇyaḥ  ní dvipā́daś cátuṣpādo arthínaḥ-  -áviśran patayiṣṇávaḥ

translation.text: Excellent Savitar hath mounted up on high for you, ye sure and careful Guides. Bipeds and quadrupeds, with several hopes and aims, and birds have settled to their tasks.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दे॒वंदे॑वं॒ वोऽव॑से दे॒वंदे॑वम॒भिष्ट॑ये दे॒वंदे॑वं हुवेम॒ वाज॑सातये गृ॒णन्तो॑ दे॒व्या धि॒या
verses.transliteration: deváṃ-devaṃ vó 'vase-  deváṃ-devam abhíṣṭaye  deváṃ-devaṃ huvema vā́jasātaye  gr̥ṇánto devyā́ dhiyā́

translation.text: Singing their praise with God-like thought let us invoke each God for grace, Each God to bring you help, each God to strengthen you.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दे॒वासो॒ हि ष्मा॒ मन॑वे॒ सम॑न्यवो॒ विश्वे॑ सा॒कं सरा॑तयः ते नो॑ अ॒द्य ते अ॑प॒रं तु॒चे तु नो॒ भव॑न्तु वरिवो॒विदः॑
verses.transliteration: devā́so hí ṣmā mánave sámanyavo  víśve sākáṃ sárātayaḥ  té no adyá té aparáṃ tucé tú no  bhávantu varivovídaḥ

translation.text: For of one spirit are the Gods with mortal man, co-sharers all of gracious gifts. May they increase our strength hereafter and to-day, providing case and ample room.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र वः॑ शंसाम्यद्रुहः सं॒स्थ उप॑स्तुतीनाम् न तं धू॒र्तिर्व॑रुण मित्र॒ मर्त्यं॒ यो वो॒ धाम॒भ्योऽवि॑धत्
