verses.transliteration: yás te sā́dhiṣṭhó 'vase-  té syāma bháreṣu te  vayáṃ hótrābhir utá deváhūtibhiḥ  sasavā́ṃso manāmahe

translation.text: May we be such in battle as are surest to obtain thy grace: With holy offerings and invocations of the Gods, we mean, that we may win the spoil.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒हं हि ते॑ हरिवो॒ ब्रह्म॑ वाज॒युरा॒जिं यामि॒ सदो॒तिभिः॑ त्वामिदे॒व तममे॒ सम॑श्व॒युर्ग॒व्युरग्रे॑ मथी॒नाम्
verses.transliteration: aháṃ hí te harivo bráhma vājayúr  ājíṃ yā́mi sádotíbhiḥ  tvā́m íd evá tám áme sám aśvayúr  gavyúr ágre mathīnā́m

translation.text: Thine, Lord of Bays, am I. Prayer longeth for the spoil. Still with thy help I seek the fight. So, at the raiders' head, I, craving steeds and kine, unite myself with thee alone.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒तत्त॑ इन्द्र वी॒र्यं॑ गी॒र्भिर्गृ॒णन्ति॑ का॒रवः॑ ते स्तोभ॑न्त॒ ऊर्ज॑मावन्घृत॒श्चुतं॑ पौ॒रासो॑ नक्षन्धी॒तिभिः॑
verses.transliteration: etát ta indra vīryàṃ  gīrbhír gr̥ṇánti kārávaḥ  té stóbhanta ū́rjam āvan ghr̥taścútam  paurā́so nakṣan dhītíbhiḥ

translation.text: INDRA, the poets with their hymns extol this hero might of thine: They strengthened, loud in song, thy power that droppeth oil. With hymns the Pauras came to thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नक्ष॑न्त॒ इन्द्र॒मव॑से सुकृ॒त्यया॒ येषां॑ सु॒तेषु॒ मन्द॑से यथा॑ संव॒र्ते अम॑दो॒ यथा॑ कृ॒श ए॒वास्मे इ॑न्द्र मत्स्व
verses.transliteration: nákṣanta índram ávase sukr̥tyáyā  yéṣāṃ sutéṣu mándase  yáthā saṃvarté ámado yáthā kr̥śé-  evā́smé indra matsva

translation.text: Through piety they came to Indra for his aid, they whose libations give theejoy. As thou with, Kr̥iṣa and Samvarta hast rejoiced, so, Indra, be thou glad with us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नो॒ विश्वे॑ स॒जोष॑सो॒ देवा॑सो॒ गन्त॒नोप॑ नः वस॑वो रु॒द्रा अव॑से न॒ आ ग॑मञ्छृ॒ण्वन्तु॑ म॒रुतो॒ हव॑म्
verses.transliteration: ā́ no víśve sajóṣaso  dévāso gántanópa naḥ  vásavo rudrā́ ávase na ā́ gamañ  -śr̥ṇvántu marúto hávam

translation.text: Agreeing in your spirit, all ye Deities, come nigh to us. Vasus and Rudras shall come near to give us aid, and Maruts listen to our call.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पू॒षा विष्णु॒र्हव॑नं मे॒ सर॑स्व॒त्यव॑न्तु स॒प्त सिन्ध॑वः आपो॒ वातः॒ पर्व॑तासो॒ वन॒स्पतिः॑ शृ॒णोतु॑ पृथि॒वी हव॑म्
verses.transliteration: pūṣā́ víṣṇur hávanam me sárasvatī-  ávantu saptá síndhavaḥ  ā́po vā́taḥ párvatāso vánaspátiḥ  śr̥ṇótu pr̥thivī́ hávam

translation.text: May Pûshan, Vishṇu, and Sarasvatî befriend, and the Seven Streams, this call of mine: May Waters, Wind, the Mountains, and the Forest-Lord, and Earth give ear unto my cry.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यदि॑न्द्र॒ राधो॒ अस्ति॑ ते॒ माघो॑नं मघवत्तम तेन॑ नो बोधि सध॒माद्यो॑ वृ॒धे भगो॑ दा॒नाय॑ वृत्रहन्
verses.transliteration: yád indra rā́dho ásti te  mā́ghonam maghavattama  téna no bodhi sadhamā́dyo vr̥dhé  bhágo dānā́ya vr̥trahan

translation.text: Indra, with thine own bounteous gift, most liberal of the Mighty Ones, Be our boon benefactor, Vr̥itra-slayer, be our feast-companion for our weal.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आजि॑पते नृपते॒ त्वमिद्धि नो॒ वाज॒ आ व॑क्षि सुक्रतो वी॒ती होत्रा॑भिरु॒त दे॒ववी॑तिभिः सस॒वांसो॒ वि शृ॑ण्विरे
verses.transliteration: ā́jipate nr̥pate tvám íd dhí no  vā́ja ā́ vakṣi sukrato  vītī́ hótrābhir utá devávītibhiḥ  sasavā́ṃso ví śr̥ṇvire

translation.text: Leader of heroes, Lord of battle, lead thou us to combat, thou Most Sapient One. High fame is theirs who win by invocations, feasts and entertainment of the Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सन्ति॒ ह्य१॒॑र्य आ॒शिष॒ इन्द्र॒ आयु॒र्जना॑नाम् अ॒स्मान्न॑क्षस्व मघव॒न्नुपाव॑से धु॒क्षस्व॑ पि॒प्युषी॒मिष॑म्
verses.transliteration: sánti hy àryá āśíṣaḥ-  índra ā́yur jánānām  asmā́n nakṣasva maghavann úpā́vase  dhukṣásva pipyúṣīm íṣam

translation.text: Our hopes rest on the Faithful One: in Indra is the people's life. O Maghavan, come nigh that thou mayst give us aid: make plenteous food stream forth for us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: व॒यं त॑ इन्द्र॒ स्तोमे॑भिर्विधेम॒ त्वम॒स्माकं॑ शतक्रतो महि॑ स्थू॒रं श॑श॒यं राधो॒ अह्र॑यं॒ प्रस्क॑ण्वाय॒ नि तो॑शय
verses.transliteration: vayáṃ ta indra stómebhir vidhema  tvám asmā́kaṃ śatakrato  máhi sthūráṃ śaśayáṃ rā́dho áhrayam  práskaṇvāya ní tośaya

translation.text: Thee would we worship, Indra, with our songs of praise: O Ṣatakratu, be thou ours. Pour down upon Praskaṇva bounty vast and firm, exuberant, that shall never fail.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भूरीदिन्द्र॑स्य वी॒र्यं१॒॑ व्यख्य॑म॒भ्याय॑ति राध॑स्ते दस्यवे वृक
verses.transliteration: bhū́rī́d índrasya vīryàṃ  vy ákhyam abhy ā́yati  rā́dhas te dasyave vr̥ka

translation.text: GREAT, verily, is Indra's might. I have beheld, and hither comes Thy bounty, Dasyave-vr̥ika!

verses.sanskrit_deva: श॒तं श्वे॒तास॑ उ॒क्षणो॑ दि॒वि तारो॒ न रो॑चन्ते म॒ह्ना दिवं॒ न त॑स्तभुः
verses.transliteration: śatáṃ śvetā́sa ukṣáṇo  diví tā́ro ná rocante  mahnā́ dívaṃ ná tastabhuḥ

translation.text: A hundred oxen white of hue are shining like the stars in heaven, So tall, they seem to prop the sky.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श॒तं वे॒णूञ्छ॒तं शुनः॑ श॒तं चर्मा॑णि म्ला॒तानि॑ श॒तं मे॑ बल्बजस्तु॒का अरु॑षीणां॒ चतुः॑शतम्
verses.transliteration: śatáṃ veṇū́ñ chatáṃ śúnaḥ  śatáṃ cármāṇi mlātā́ni  śatám me balbajastukā́ḥ-  áruṣīṇāṃ cátuḥśatam

translation.text: Bamboos a hundred, a hundred dogs, a hundred skins of beasts well-tanned, A hundred tufts of Balbaja, four hundred red-hued mares are mine.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒दे॒वाः स्थ॑ काण्वायना॒ वयो॑वयो विच॒रन्तः॑ अश्वा॑सो॒ न च॑ङ्क्रमत
verses.transliteration: sudevā́ stha kāṇvāyanāḥ-  váyo-vayo vicarántaḥ  áśvāso ná caṅkramata

translation.text: Blest by the Gods, Kinvayanas! be ye who spread through life on life: Like horses have ye stridden forth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आदित्सा॒प्तस्य॑ चर्किर॒न्नानू॑नस्य॒ महि॒ श्रवः॑ श्यावी॑रतिध्व॒सन्प॒थश्चक्षु॑षा च॒न सं॒नशे॑
verses.transliteration: ā́d ít sāptásya carkirann  ā́nūnasya máhi śrávaḥ  śyā́vīr atidhvasán patháś  cákṣuṣā caná saṃnáśe

translation.text: Then men extolled the team of seven not yet full-grown, its fame is great. The dark mares rushed along the paths, so that no eye could follow them.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रति॑ ते दस्यवे वृक॒ राधो॑ अद॒र्श्यह्र॑यम् द्यौर्न प्र॑थि॒ना शवः॑
verses.transliteration: práti te dasyave vr̥ka  rā́dho adarśy áhrayam  dyaúr ná prathinā́ śávaḥ

translation.text: THY bounty, Dasyave-vr̥ika, exhaustless hath displayed itself: Its fulness is as broad as heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दश॒ मह्यं॑ पौतक्र॒तः स॒हस्रा॒ दस्य॑वे॒ वृकः॑ नित्या॑द्रा॒यो अ॑मंहत
verses.transliteration: dáśa máhyam pautakratáḥ  sahásrā dásyave vŕ̥kaḥ  nítyād rāyó amaṃhata

translation.text: Ten thousand Dasyave-vr̥ika, the son of Pûtakratu, hath From his own wealth bestowed on me.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श॒तं मे॑ गर्द॒भानां॑ श॒तमूर्णा॑वतीनाम् श॒तं दा॒साँ अति॒ स्रजः॑
verses.transliteration: śatám me gardabhā́nāṃ  śatám ū́rṇāvatīnām  śatáṃ dāsā́m̐ áti srájaḥ

translation.text: A hundred asses hath he given, a hundred head of fleecy sheep, A hundred slaves, and wreaths besides.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तत्रो॒ अपि॒ प्राणी॑यत पू॒तक्र॑तायै॒ व्य॑क्ता अश्वा॑ना॒मिन्न यू॒थ्या॑म्
verses.transliteration: tátro ápi prā́ṇīyata  pūtákratāyai vyàktā  áśvānām ín ná yūthyā̀m

translation.text: There also was a mare led forth, picked out for Putakrata's sake, Not of the horses of the herd.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अचे॑त्य॒ग्निश्चि॑कि॒तुर्ह॑व्य॒वाट् स सु॒मद्र॑थः अ॒ग्निः शु॒क्रेण॑ शो॒चिषा॑ बृ॒हत्सूरो॑ अरोचत दि॒वि सूर्यो॑ अरोचत
verses.transliteration: ácety agníś cikitúr  havyavā́ṭ sá sumádrathaḥ  agníḥ śukréṇa śocíṣā  br̥hát sū́ro arocata  diví sū́ryo arocata

translation.text: Observant Agni hath appeared, oblation-bearer with his car. Agni with his resplendent flame hath shone on high as shines the Sun, hath shone like Sûrya in the heavens.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वं दे॑वा॒ क्रतु॑ना पू॒र्व्येण॑ यु॒क्ता रथे॑न तवि॒षं य॑जत्रा आग॑च्छतं नासत्या॒ शची॑भिरि॒दं तृ॒तीयं॒ सव॑नं पिबाथः
verses.transliteration: yuváṃ devā krátunā pūrvyéṇa  yuktā́ ráthena taviṣáṃ yajatrā  ā́gachataṃ nāsatyā śácībhir  idáṃ tr̥tī́yaṃ sávanam pibāthaḥ

translation.text: ENDOWED, O Gods, with your primeval wisdom, come quickly with your chariot, O ye Holy. Come with your mighty powers, O ye Nâsatyas; come hither, drink ye this the third libation.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वां दे॒वास्त्रय॑ एकाद॒शासः॑ स॒त्याः स॒त्यस्य॑ ददृशे पु॒रस्ता॑त् अ॒स्माकं॑ य॒ज्ञं सव॑नं जुषा॒णा पा॒तं सोम॑मश्विना॒ दीद्य॑ग्नी
verses.transliteration: yuvā́ṃ devā́s tráya ekādaśā́saḥ  satyā́ḥ satyásya dadr̥śe purástāt  asmā́kaṃ yajñáṃ sávanaṃ juṣāṇā́  pātáṃ sómam aśvinā dī́dyagnī

translation.text: The truthful Deities, the Three-and-Thirty, saw you approach before the Ever-Truthful. Accepting this our worship and libation, O Aṣvins bright with fire, drink ye the Soma.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प॒नाय्यं॒ तद॑श्विना कृ॒तं वां॑ वृष॒भो दि॒वो रज॑सः पृथि॒व्याः स॒हस्रं॒ शंसा॑ उ॒त ये गवि॑ष्टौ॒ सर्वाँ॒ इत्ताँ उप॑ याता॒ पिब॑ध्यै
verses.transliteration: panā́yyaṃ tád aśvinā kr̥táṃ vāṃ  vr̥ṣabhó divó rájasaḥ pr̥thivyā́ḥ  sahásraṃ śáṃsā utá yé gáviṣṭau  sárvām̐ ít tā́m̐ úpa yātā píbadhyai

translation.text: Aṣvins, that work of yours deserves our wonder,– the Bull of heaven and earth and air's mid region; Yea, and your thousand promises in battle, -to all of these come near and drink beside us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं वां॑ भा॒गो निहि॑तो यजत्रे॒मा गिरो॑ नास॒त्योप॑ यातम् पिब॑तं॒ सोमं॒ मधु॑मन्तम॒स्मे प्र दा॒श्वांस॑मवतं॒ शची॑भिः
verses.transliteration: ayáṃ vām bhāgó níhito yajatrā-  -imā́ gíro nāsatyópa yātam  píbataṃ sómam mádhumantam asmé  prá dāśvā́ṃsam avataṃ śácībhiḥ

translation.text: Here is your portion laid for you, ye Holy: come to these songs of ours, O ye Nâsatyas. Drink among us the Soma full of sweetness, and with your powers assist the man who worships.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यमृ॒त्विजो॑ बहु॒धा क॒ल्पय॑न्तः॒ सचे॑तसो य॒ज्ञमि॒मं वह॑न्ति यो अ॑नूचा॒नो ब्रा॑ह्म॒णो यु॒क्त आ॑सी॒त्का स्वि॒त्तत्र॒ यज॑मानस्य सं॒वित्
verses.transliteration: yám r̥tvíjo bahudhā́ kalpáyantaḥ  sácetaso yajñám imáṃ váhanti  yó anūcānó brāhmaṇó yuktá āsīt  kā́ svit tátra yájamānasya saṃvít

translation.text: HE whom the priests in sundry ways arranging the sacrifice, of one accord, bring hither, Who was appointed as a learned Brahman, -what is the sacrificer's knowledge of him?

verses.sanskrit_deva: एक॑ ए॒वाग्निर्ब॑हु॒धा समि॑द्ध॒ एकः॒ सूर्यो॒ विश्व॒मनु॒ प्रभू॑तः एकै॒वोषाः सर्व॑मि॒दं वि भा॒त्येकं॒ वा इ॒दं वि ब॑भूव॒ सर्व॑म्
verses.transliteration: éka evā́gnír bahudhā́ sámiddhaḥ-  ékaḥ sū́ryo víśvam ánu prábhūtaḥ  ékaivóṣā́ḥ sárvam idáṃ ví bhāti-  ékaṃ vā́ idáṃ ví babhūva sárvam

translation.text: Kindled in many a spot, still One is Agni; Sûrya is One though high o'er all he shineth. Illumining this All, still One is Ushas. That which is One hath into All developed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ज्योति॑ष्मन्तं केतु॒मन्तं॑ त्रिच॒क्रं सु॒खं रथं॑ सु॒षदं॒ भूरि॑वारम् चि॒त्राम॑घा॒ यस्य॒ योगे॑ऽधिजज्ञे॒ तं वां॑ हु॒वे अति॑ रिक्तं॒ पिब॑ध्यै
verses.transliteration: jyótiṣmantaṃ ketumántaṃ tricakráṃ  sukháṃ ráthaṃ suṣádam bhū́rivāram  citrā́maghā yásya yóge 'dhijajñe  táṃ vāṃ huvé átiriktam píbadhyai

translation.text: The chariot bright and radiant, treasure-laden, three-wheeled, with easy seat, and lightly rolling, Which She of Wondrous Wealth was born to harness,– this car of yours I call. Drink what remaineth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मानि॑ वां भाग॒धेया॑नि सिस्रत॒ इन्द्रा॑वरुणा॒ प्र म॒हे सु॒तेषु॑ वाम् य॒ज्ञेय॑ज्ञे ह॒ सव॑ना भुर॒ण्यथो॒ यत्सु॑न्व॒ते यज॑मानाय॒ शिक्ष॑थः
verses.transliteration: imā́ni vām bhāgadhéyāni sisrate-  índrāvaruṇā prá mahé sutéṣu vām  yajñé-yajñe ha sávanā bhuraṇyátho  yát sunvaté yájamānāya śíkṣathaḥ

translation.text: IN offerings poured to you, O Indra-Varuṇa, these shares of yours stream forth to glorify your state. Ye haste to the libations at each sacrifice when ye assist the worshipper who sheds the juice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नि॒ष्षिध्व॑री॒रोष॑धी॒राप॑ आस्ता॒मिन्द्रा॑वरुणा महि॒मान॒माश॑त या सिस्र॑तू॒ रज॑सः पा॒रे अध्व॑नो॒ ययोः॒ शत्रु॒र्नकि॒रादे॑व॒ ओह॑ते
verses.transliteration: niṣṣídhvarīr óṣadhīr ā́pa āstām  índrāvaruṇā mahimā́nam ā́śata  yā́ sísratū rájasaḥ pāré ádhvano  yáyoḥ śátrur nákir ā́deva óhate

translation.text: The waters and the plants, O Indra-Varuṇa, had efficacious vigour, and attained to might: Ye who have gone beyond the path of middle air,– no godless man is worthy to be called your foe.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒त्यं तदि॑न्द्रावरुणा कृ॒शस्य॑ वां॒ मध्व॑ ऊ॒र्मिं दु॑हते स॒प्त वाणीः॑ ताभि॑र्दा॒श्वांस॑मवतं शुभस्पती॒ यो वा॒मद॑ब्धो अ॒भि पाति॒ चित्ति॑भिः
verses.transliteration: satyáṃ tád indrāvaruṇā kr̥śásya vām  mádhva ūrmíṃ duhate saptá vā́ṇīḥ  tā́bhir dāśvā́ṃsam avataṃ śubhas patī  yó vām ádabdho abhí pā́ti cíttibhiḥ

translation.text: True is your Kr̥iṣa's word, Indra and Varuṇa: The seven holy voices pour a wave of meath. For their sake, Lords of splendour! aid the pious man who, unbewildered, keeps you ever in his thoughts.

verses.sanskrit_deva: घृ॒त॒प्रुषः॒ सौम्या॑ जी॒रदा॑नवः स॒प्त स्वसा॑रः॒ सद॑न ऋ॒तस्य॑ या ह॑ वामिन्द्रावरुणा घृत॒श्चुत॒स्ताभि॑र्धत्तं॒ यज॑मानाय शिक्षतम्
verses.transliteration: ghr̥taprúṣaḥ saúmyā jīrádānavaḥ  saptá svásāraḥ sádana r̥tásya  yā́ ha vām indrāvaruṇā ghr̥taścútas  tā́bhir dhattaṃ yájamānāya śikṣatam

translation.text: Dropping oil, sweet with Soma, pouring forth their stream, are the Seven Sisters in the seat of sacrifice. These, dropping oil, are yours, O Indra-Varuṇa: with these enrich with gifts and help the worshipper.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अवो॑चाम मह॒ते सौभ॑गाय स॒त्यं त्वे॒षाभ्यां॑ महि॒मान॑मिन्द्रि॒यम् अ॒स्मान्त्स्वि॑न्द्रावरुणा घृत॒श्चुत॒स्त्रिभिः॑ सा॒प्तेभि॑रवतं शुभस्पती
verses.transliteration: ávocāma mahaté saúbhagāya  satyáṃ tveṣā́bhyām mahimā́nam indriyám  asmā́n sv ìndrāvaruṇā ghr̥taścútas  tríbhiḥ sāptébhir avataṃ śubhas patī

translation.text: To our great happiness have we ascribed to these Two Bright Ones truthfulness, great strength, and majesty. O Lords of splendour, aid us through the Three-times-Seven, as we pour holy oil, O Indra-Varuṇa.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रा॑वरुणा॒ यदृ॒षिभ्यो॑ मनी॒षां वा॒चो म॒तिं श्रु॒तम॑दत्त॒मग्रे॑ यानि॒ स्थाना॑न्यसृजन्त॒ धीरा॑ य॒ज्ञं त॑न्वा॒नास्तप॑सा॒भ्य॑पश्यम्
verses.transliteration: índrāvaruṇā yád r̥ṣíbhyo manīṣā́ṃ  vācó matíṃ śrutám adattam ágre  yā́ni sthā́nāny asr̥janta dhī́rāḥ-  yajñáṃ tanvānā́s tápasābhy àpaśyam

translation.text: What ye in time of old Indra and Varuṇa, gave R̥ishis revelation, thought, and power of song, And places which the wise made, weaving sacrifice,– these through my spirit's fervid glow have I beheld.,

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रा॑वरुणा सौमन॒समदृ॑प्तं रा॒यस्पोषं॒ यज॑मानेषु धत्तम् प्र॒जां पु॒ष्टिं भू॑तिम॒स्मासु॑ धत्तं दीर्घायु॒त्वाय॒ प्र ति॑रतं न॒ आयुः॑
verses.transliteration: índrāvaruṇā saumanasám ádr̥ptaṃ  rāyás póṣaṃ yájamāneṣu dhattam  prajā́m puṣṭím bhūtim asmā́su dhattaṃ  dīrghāyutvā́ya prá tirataṃ na ā́yuḥ

translation.text: O Indra-Varuṇa, grant to the worshippers cheerfulness void of pride, and wealth to nourish them. Vouchsafe us food, prosperity, and progeny, and lengthen out our days that we may see long life.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्न॒ आ या॑ह्य॒ग्निभि॒र्होता॑रं त्वा वृणीमहे आ त्वाम॑नक्तु॒ प्रय॑ता ह॒विष्म॑ती॒ यजि॑ष्ठं ब॒र्हिरा॒सदे॑
verses.transliteration: ágna ā́ yāhy agníbhir  hótāraṃ tvā vr̥ṇīmahe-  ā́ tvā́m anaktu práyatā havíṣmatī  yájiṣṭham barhír āsáde

translation.text: AGNI, come hither with thy fires; we choose thee as Invoking Priest. Let the extended ladle full of oil balm thee, best Priest, to sit on sacred grass.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अच्छा॒ हि त्वा॑ सहसः सूनो अङ्गिरः॒ स्रुच॒श्चर॑न्त्यध्व॒रे ऊ॒र्जो नपा॑तं घृ॒तके॑शमीमहे॒ऽग्निं य॒ज्ञेषु॑ पू॒र्व्यम्
verses.transliteration: áchā hí tvā sahasaḥ sūno aṅgiraḥ  srúcaś cáranty adhvaré  ūrjó nápātaṃ ghr̥tákeśam īmahe  agníṃ yajñéṣu pūrvyám

translation.text: -For unto thee, O Angiras, O Son of Strength, move ladles in the sacrifice. To Agni, Child of Force, whose locks drop oil, we seek foremost in sacrificial rites.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्ने॑ क॒विर्वे॒धा अ॑सि॒ होता॑ पावक॒ यक्ष्यः॑ म॒न्द्रो यजि॑ष्ठो अध्व॒रेष्वीड्यो॒ विप्रे॑भिः शुक्र॒ मन्म॑भिः
verses.transliteration: ágne kavír vedhā́ asi  hótā pāvaka yákṣyaḥ  mandró yájiṣṭho adhvaréṣv ī́ḍyo  víprebhiḥ śukra mánmabhiḥ

translation.text: Agni, thou art Disposer, Sage, Herald, bright God! and worshipful, Best offerer, cheerful, to be praised in holy rites, pure Lord! by singers with their hymns.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अद्रो॑घ॒मा व॑होश॒तो य॑विष्ठ्य दे॒वाँ अ॑जस्र वी॒तये॑ अ॒भि प्रयां॑सि॒ सुधि॒ता व॑सो गहि॒ मन्द॑स्व धी॒तिभि॑र्हि॒तः
verses.transliteration: ádrogham ā́ vahośató yaviṣṭhya  devā́m̐ ajasra vītáye  abhí práyāṃsi súdhitā́ vaso gahi  mándasva dhītíbhir hitáḥ

translation.text: Most Youthful and Eternal, bring the longing Gods to me, the guileless, for the feast. Come, Vasu, to the banquet that is well-prepared: rejoice thee, gracious, with our songs.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वमित्स॒प्रथा॑ अ॒स्यग्ने॑ त्रातर्ऋ॒तस्क॒विः त्वां विप्रा॑सः समिधान दीदिव॒ आ वि॑वासन्ति वे॒धसः॑
verses.transliteration: tvám ít sapráthā asi-  ágne trātar r̥tás kavíḥ  tvā́ṃ víprāsaḥ samidhāna dīdivaḥ-  ā́ vivāsanti vedhásaḥ

translation.text: Famed art thou, Agni, far and wide, Preserver, righteous, and a Sage. The holy singers, O refulgent kindled God! arrangers, call on thee to come.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शोचा॑ शोचिष्ठ दीदि॒हि वि॒शे मयो॒ रास्व॑ स्तो॒त्रे म॒हाँ अ॑सि दे॒वानां॒ शर्म॒न्मम॑ सन्तु सू॒रयः॑ शत्रू॒षाहः॑ स्व॒ग्नयः॑
verses.transliteration: śócā śociṣṭha dīdihí viśé máyo  rā́sva stotré mahā́m̐ asi  devā́nāṃ śárman máma santu sūráyaḥ  śatrūṣā́haḥ svagnáyaḥ

translation.text: Shine, Most Resplendent! blaze, send bliss unto the folk, and to thy worshipper: Great art thou. So may my princes, with good fires, subduing foes, rest in the keeping of the Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यथा॑ चिद्वृ॒द्धम॑त॒समग्ने॑ सं॒जूर्व॑सि॒ क्षमि॑ ए॒वा द॑ह मित्रमहो॒ यो अ॑स्म॒ध्रुग्दु॒र्मन्मा॒ कश्च॒ वेन॑ति
verses.transliteration: yáthā cid vr̥ddhám atasám  ágne saṃjū́rvasi kṣámi  evā́ daha mitramaho yó asmadhrúg  durmánmā káś ca vénati

translation.text: Agni, as thou burnest down to earth even high-grown underwood, So, bright as Mitra is, burn him who injures us, him who plots ill against thy friend.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा नो॒ मर्ता॑य रि॒पवे॑ रक्ष॒स्विने॒ माघशं॑साय रीरधः अस्रे॑धद्भिस्त॒रणि॑भिर्यविष्ठ्य शि॒वेभिः॑ पाहि पा॒युभिः॑
verses.transliteration: mā́ no mártāya ripáve rakṣasvíne  mā́gháśaṃsāya rīradhaḥ  ásredhadbhis taráṇibhir yaviṣṭhya  śivébhiḥ pāhi pāyúbhiḥ

translation.text: Give us not as a prey to mortal enemy, nor to the wicked friend of fiends. With conquering guards, auspicious, unassailable, protect us, O Most Youthful God.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पा॒हि नो॑ अग्न॒ एक॑या पा॒ह्यु१॒॑त द्वि॒तीय॑या पा॒हि गी॒र्भिस्ति॒सृभि॑रूर्जां पते पा॒हि च॑त॒सृभि॑र्वसो
verses.transliteration: pāhí no agna ékayā  pāhy ùtá dvitī́yayā  pāhí gīrbhís tisŕ̥bhir ūrjām pate  pāhí catasŕ̥bhir vaso

translation.text: Protect us, Agni, through the first, protect us through the second hymn, Protect us through three hymns, O Lord of Power and Might, through four hymns, Vasu, guard thou us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पा॒हि विश्व॑स्माद्र॒क्षसो॒ अरा॑व्णः॒ प्र स्म॒ वाजे॑षु नोऽव त्वामिद्धि नेदि॑ष्ठं दे॒वता॑तय आ॒पिं नक्षा॑महे वृ॒धे
verses.transliteration: pāhí víśvasmād rakṣáso árāvṇaḥ  prá sma vā́jeṣu no 'va  tvā́m íd dhí nédiṣṭhaṃ devátātaye-  āpíṃ nákṣāmahe vr̥dhé

translation.text: Preserve us from each fiend who brings the Gods no gift, preserve thou us in deeds of strength: For we possess in thee the nearest Friend of all, for service of the Gods and weal.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नो॑ अग्ने वयो॒वृधं॑ र॒यिं पा॑वक॒ शंस्य॑म् रास्वा॑ च न उपमाते पुरु॒स्पृहं॒ सुनी॑ती॒ स्वय॑शस्तरम्
verses.transliteration: ā́ no agne vayovŕ̥dhaṃ  rayím pāvaka śáṃsyam  rā́svā ca na upamāte puruspŕ̥haṃ  súnītī sváyaśastaram

translation.text: O Holy Agni, give us wealth renowned with men and strengthening life. Bestow on us, O Helper, that which many crave, more glorious still by righteousness;

verses.sanskrit_deva: येन॒ वंसा॑म॒ पृत॑नासु॒ शर्ध॑त॒स्तर॑न्तो अ॒र्य आ॒दिशः॑ स त्वं नो॑ वर्ध॒ प्रय॑सा शचीवसो॒ जिन्वा॒ धियो॑ वसु॒विदः॑
verses.transliteration: yéna váṃsāma pŕ̥tanāsu śárdhatas  táranto aryá ādíśaḥ  sá tváṃ no vardha práyasā śacīvaso  jínvā dhíyo vasuvídaḥ

translation.text: Wherewith we may o’ercome our rivals in the war, o’erpowering the foe’s designs. So wax thou by our food, O Excellent in strength. Quicken our thoughts that find out wealth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शिशा॑नो वृष॒भो य॑था॒ग्निः शृङ्गे॒ दवि॑ध्वत् ति॒ग्मा अ॑स्य॒ हन॑वो॒ न प्र॑ति॒धृषे॑ सु॒जम्भः॒ सह॑सो य॒हुः
verses.transliteration: śíśāno vr̥ṣabhó yathā-  -agníḥ śŕ̥ṅge dávidhvat  tigmā́ asya hánavo ná pratidhŕ̥ṣe  sujámbhaḥ sáhaso yahúḥ

translation.text: Agni is even as a bull who whets and brandishes his horns. Well-sharpened are his jaws which may not be withstood: the Child of Strength hath powerful teeth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न॒हि ते॑ अग्ने वृषभ प्रति॒धृषे॒ जम्भा॑सो॒ यद्वि॒तिष्ठ॑से स त्वं नो॑ होतः॒ सुहु॑तं ह॒विष्कृ॑धि॒ वंस्वा॑ नो॒ वार्या॑ पु॒रु
verses.transliteration: nahí te agne vr̥ṣabha pratidhŕ̥ṣe  jámbhāso yád vitíṣṭhase  sá tváṃ no hotaḥ súhutaṃ havíṣ kr̥dhi  váṃsvā no vā́ryā purú

translation.text: Not to be stayed, O Bull, O Agni, are thy teeth when thou art spreading far and wide. Make our oblations duly offered up, O Priest, and give us store of precious things.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शेषे॒ वने॑षु मा॒त्रोः सं त्वा॒ मर्ता॑स इन्धते अत॑न्द्रो ह॒व्या व॑हसि हवि॒ष्कृत॒ आदिद्दे॒वेषु॑ राजसि
verses.transliteration: śéṣe váneṣu mātróḥ  sáṃ tvā mártāsa indhate  átandro havyā́ vahasi haviṣkŕ̥taḥ-  ā́d íd devéṣu rājasi

translation.text: Thou liest in the wood: from both thy Mothers mortals kindle thee. Unweariedly thou bearest up the offerer’s gifts, then shinest bright among the Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒प्त होता॑र॒स्तमिदी॑ळते॒ त्वाग्ने॑ सु॒त्यज॒मह्र॑यम् भि॒नत्स्यद्रिं॒ तप॑सा॒ वि शो॒चिषा॒ प्राग्ने॑ तिष्ठ॒ जनाँ॒ अति॑
verses.transliteration: saptá hótāras tám íd īḷate tvā-  -ágne sutyájam áhrayam  bhinátsy ádriṃ tápasā ví śocíṣā  prā́gne tiṣṭha jánām̐ áti

translation.text: And so the seven priests, O Agni, worship thee, Free-giver, Everlasting One. Thou cleavest through the rock with heat and fervent glow. Agni, rise up above the men.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग्निम॑ग्निं वो॒ अध्रि॑गुं हु॒वेम॑ वृ॒क्तब॑र्हिषः अ॒ग्निं हि॒तप्र॑यसः शश्व॒तीष्वा होता॑रं चर्षणी॒नाम्
verses.transliteration: agním-agniṃ vo ádhriguṃ  huvéma vr̥ktábarhiṣaḥ  agníṃ hitáprayasaḥ śaśvatī́ṣv~ā́  hótāraṃ carṣaṇīnā́m

translation.text: For you let us whose grass is trimmed call Agni, Agni, restless God. Let us whose food is offered call to all the tribes Agni the Invoking Priest of men.

verses.sanskrit_deva: केते॑न॒ शर्म॑न्त्सचते सुषा॒मण्यग्ने॒ तुभ्यं॑ चिकि॒त्वना॑ इ॒ष॒ण्यया॑ नः पुरु॒रूप॒मा भ॑र॒ वाजं॒ नेदि॑ष्ठमू॒तये॑
verses.transliteration: kétena śárman sacate suṣāmáṇi-  ágne túbhyaṃ cikitvánā  iṣaṇyáyā naḥ pururū́pam ā́ bhara  vā́jaṃ nédiṣṭham ūtáye

translation.text: Agni, with noble psalm that tells his wish he dwells, thinking on thee who guardest him. Speedily bring us strength of many varied sorts to be most near to succour us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्ने॒ जरि॑तर्वि॒श्पति॑स्तेपा॒नो दे॑व र॒क्षसः॑ अप्रो॑षिवान्गृ॒हप॑तिर्म॒हाँ अ॑सि दि॒वस्पा॒युर्दु॑रोण॒युः
verses.transliteration: ágne járitar viśpátis  tepānó deva rakṣásaḥ  áproṣivān gr̥hápatir mahā́m̐ asi  divás pāyúr duroṇayúḥ

translation.text: Agni, Praise-singer! Lord of men, God! burner-up of Rakshasas, Mighty art thou, the ever-present Household-Lord, Home-friend and Guardian from the sky.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा नो॒ रक्ष॒ आ वे॑शीदाघृणीवसो॒ मा या॒तुर्या॑तु॒माव॑ताम् प॒रो॒ग॒व्यू॒त्यनि॑रा॒मप॒ क्षुध॒मग्ने॒ सेध॑ रक्ष॒स्विनः॑
verses.transliteration: mā́ no rákṣa ā́ veśīd āghr̥ṇīvaso  mā́ yātúr yātumā́vatām  parogavyūty ánirām ápa kṣúdham  ágne sédha rakṣasvínaḥ

translation.text: Let no fiend come among us, O thou rich in light, no spell of those who deal in spells. To distant pastures drive faint hunger: far away, O Agni, chase the demons’ friends.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒भयं॑ शृ॒णव॑च्च न॒ इन्द्रो॑ अ॒र्वागि॒दं वचः॑ स॒त्राच्या॑ म॒घवा॒ सोम॑पीतये धि॒या शवि॑ष्ठ॒ आ ग॑मत्
verses.transliteration: ubháyaṃ śr̥ṇávac ca naḥ-  índro arvā́g idáṃ vácaḥ  satrā́cyā maghávā sómapītaye  dhiyā́ śáviṣṭha ā́ gamat

translation.text: BOTH boons, – may Indra, hitherward turned, listen to this prayer of ours, And mightiest Maghavan with thought inclined to us come near to drink the Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं हि स्व॒राजं॑ वृष॒भं तमोज॑से धि॒षणे॑ निष्टत॒क्षतुः॑ उ॒तोप॒मानां॑ प्रथ॒मो नि षी॑दसि॒ सोम॑कामं॒ हि ते॒ मनः॑
verses.transliteration: táṃ hí svarā́jaṃ vr̥ṣabháṃ tám ójase  dhiṣáṇe niṣṭatakṣátuḥ  utópamā́nām prathamó ní ṣīdasi  sómakāmaṃ hí te mánaḥ

translation.text: For him, strong, independent Ruler, Heaven and Earth have fashioned forth for power and might. Thou seatest thee as first among thy peers in place, for thy soul longs for Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ वृ॑षस्व पुरूवसो सु॒तस्ये॒न्द्रान्ध॑सः वि॒द्मा हि त्वा॑ हरिवः पृ॒त्सु सा॑स॒हिमधृ॑ष्टं चिद्दधृ॒ष्वणि॑म्
verses.transliteration: ā́ vr̥ṣasva purūvaso  sutásyendrā́ndhasaḥ  vidmā́ hí tvā harivaḥ pr̥tsú sāsahím  ádhr̥ṣṭaṃ cid dadhr̥ṣváṇim

translation.text: Fill thyself full, O Lord of wealth, O Indra, with the juice we shed. We know thee, Lord of Bay Steeds! victor in the fight, vanquishing e'en the invincible.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अप्रा॑मिसत्य मघव॒न्तथेद॑स॒दिन्द्र॒ क्रत्वा॒ यथा॒ वशः॑ स॒नेम॒ वाजं॒ तव॑ शिप्रि॒न्नव॑सा म॒क्षू चि॒द्यन्तो॑ अद्रिवः
verses.transliteration: áprāmisatya maghavan táthéd asad  índra krátvā yáthā váśaḥ  sanéma vā́jaṃ táva śiprinn ávasā  makṣū́ cid yánto adrivaḥ

translation.text: Changeless in truth, O Maghavan Indra, let it be as thou in wisdom willest it. May we, O fair of check, win booty with thine aid, O Thunderer, swiftly seeking it.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श॒ग्ध्यू॒३॒॑ षु श॑चीपत॒ इन्द्र॒ विश्वा॑भिरू॒तिभिः॑ भगं॒ न हि त्वा॑ य॒शसं॑ वसु॒विद॒मनु॑ शूर॒ चरा॑मसि
verses.transliteration: śagdhy ū̀ ṣú śacīpate-  índra víśvābhir ūtíbhir  bhágaṃ ná hí tvā yaśásaṃ vasuvídam  ánu śūra cárāmasi

translation.text: Indra, with all thy saving helps give us assistance, Lord of power. For after thee we follow even as glorious bliss, thee, Hero, finder-out of wealth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पौ॒रो अश्व॑स्य पुरु॒कृद्गवा॑म॒स्युत्सो॑ देव हिर॒ण्ययः॑ नकि॒र्हि दानं॑ परि॒मर्धि॑ष॒त्त्वे यद्य॒द्यामि॒ तदा भ॑र
verses.transliteration: pauró áśvasya purukŕ̥d gávām asi-  útso deva hiraṇyáyaḥ  nákir hí dā́nam parimárdhiṣat tvé  yád-yad yā́mi tád ā́ bhara

translation.text: Increaser of our steeds and multiplying kine, a golden well, O God, art thou, For no one may impair the gifts laid up in thee. Bring me whatever thing I ask.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं ह्येहि॒ चेर॑वे वि॒दा भगं॒ वसु॑त्तये उद्वा॑वृषस्व मघव॒न्गवि॑ष्टय॒ उदि॒न्द्राश्व॑मिष्टये
verses.transliteration: tváṃ hy éhi cérave  vidā́ bhágaṃ vásuttaye  úd vāvr̥ṣasva maghavan gáviṣṭaye-  úd indrā́śvamiṣṭaye

translation.text: For thou, – come to the worshipper! – wilt find great wealth to make us rich. Fill thyself full, O Maghavan, for gain of kine, full, Indra, for the gain of steeds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं पु॒रू स॒हस्रा॑णि श॒तानि॑ च यू॒था दा॒नाय॑ मंहसे आ पु॑रंद॒रं च॑कृम॒ विप्र॑वचस॒ इन्द्रं॒ गाय॒न्तोऽव॑से
verses.transliteration: tvám purū́ sahásrāṇi śatā́ni ca  yūthā́ dānā́ya maṃhase  ā́ puraṃdaráṃ cakr̥ma vípravacasaḥ-  índraṃ gā́yantó 'vase

translation.text: Thou as thy gift bestowest many hundred herds, yea, many thousands dost thou give. With singers' hymns have we brought the Fort-render near, singing to Indra for his grace.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒वि॒प्रो वा॒ यदवि॑ध॒द्विप्रो॑ वेन्द्र ते॒ वचः॑ स प्र म॑मन्दत्त्वा॒या श॑तक्रतो॒ प्राचा॑मन्यो॒ अहं॑सन
verses.transliteration: avipró vā yád ávidhad  vípro vendra te vácaḥ  sá prá mamandat tvāyā́ śatakrato  prā́cāmanyo áhaṃsana

translation.text: Whether the simple or the sage, Indra, have offered praise to thee, He, Ṣatakratu! by his love hath gladdened thee, ambitious! ever pressing on!

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒ग्रबा॑हुर्म्रक्ष॒कृत्वा॑ पुरंद॒रो यदि॑ मे शृ॒णव॒द्धव॑म् व॒सू॒यवो॒ वसु॑पतिं श॒तक्र॑तुं॒ स्तोमै॒रिन्द्रं॑ हवामहे
verses.transliteration: ugrábāhur mrakṣakŕ̥tvā puraṃdaró  yádi me śr̥ṇávad dhávam  vasūyávo vásupatiṃ śatákratuṃ  stómair índraṃ havāmahe

translation.text: If he the Strong of arm, the breaker-down of forts, the great Destroyer, hear my call, We, seeking riches cry to Indra, Lord of wealth, to Ṣatakratu with our lauds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न पा॒पासो॑ मनामहे॒ नारा॑यासो॒ न जळ्ह॑वः यदिन्न्विन्द्रं॒ वृष॑णं॒ सचा॑ सु॒ते सखा॑यं कृ॒णवा॑महै
verses.transliteration: ná pāpā́so manāmahe  nā́rāyāso ná jáḷhavaḥ  yád ín nv índraṃ vŕ̥ṣaṇaṃ sácā suté  sákhāyaṃ kr̥ṇávāmahai

translation.text: We count not then as sinners, nor as niggardly or foolish men, When with the Soma juice which we have shed we make Indra, the Mighty One, our Friend.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒ग्रं यु॑युज्म॒ पृत॑नासु सास॒हिमृ॒णका॑ति॒मदा॑भ्यम् वेदा॑ भृ॒मं चि॒त्सनि॑ता र॒थीत॑मो वा॒जिनं॒ यमिदू॒ नश॑त्
verses.transliteration: ugráṃ yuyujma pŕ̥tanāsu sāsahím  r̥ṇákātim ádābhyam  védā bhr̥máṃ cit sánitā rathī́tamo  vājínaṃ yám íd ū náśat

translation.text: Him have we yoked in fight, the powerful Conqueror, debt-claimer, not to be deceived. Best charioteer, the Victor marks each fault, he knows the strong to whom he will come near.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यत॑ इन्द्र॒ भया॑महे॒ ततो॑ नो॒ अभ॑यं कृधि मघ॑वञ्छ॒ग्धि तव॒ तन्न॑ ऊ॒तिभि॒र्वि द्विषो॒ वि मृधो॑ जहि
verses.transliteration: yáta indra bháyāmahe  táto no ábhayaṃ kr̥dhi  mághavañ chagdhí táva tán na ūtíbhiḥ  ví dvíṣo ví mŕ̥dho jahi

translation.text: Indra, give us security from that whereof we are afraid. Help us, O Maghavan, let thy succour give us this: drive away foes and enemies.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं हि रा॑धस्पते॒ राध॑सो म॒हः क्षय॒स्यासि॑ विध॒तः तं त्वा॑ व॒यं म॑घवन्निन्द्र गिर्वणः सु॒ताव॑न्तो हवामहे
verses.transliteration: tváṃ hí rādhaspate rā́dhaso maháḥ  kṣáyasyā́si vidhatáḥ  táṃ tvā vayám maghavann indra girvaṇaḥ  sutā́vanto havāmahe

translation.text: For thou, O liberal Lord of bounty, strengthenest his ample home who worships thee. So Indra, Maghavan, thou Lover of the Song, we with pressed Soma call on thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रः॒ स्पळु॒त वृ॑त्र॒हा प॑र॒स्पा नो॒ वरे॑ण्यः स नो॑ रक्षिषच्चर॒मं स म॑ध्य॒मं स प॒श्चात्पा॑तु नः पु॒रः
verses.transliteration: índra spáḷ utá vr̥trahā́  paraspā́ no váreṇyaḥ  sá no rakṣiṣac caramáṃ sá madhyamáṃ  sá paścā́t pātu naḥ puráḥ

translation.text: Indra is Vritra-slayer, guard, our best defender from the foe. May he preserve our last and middlemost, and keep watch from behind us and before.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं नः॑ प॒श्चाद॑ध॒रादु॑त्त॒रात्पु॒र इन्द्र॒ नि पा॑हि वि॒श्वतः॑ आ॒रे अ॒स्मत्कृ॑णुहि॒ दैव्यं॑ भ॒यमा॒रे हे॒तीरदे॑वीः
verses.transliteration: tváṃ naḥ paścā́d adharā́d uttarā́t puráḥ-  índra ní pāhi viśvátaḥ  āré asmát kr̥ṇuhi daívyam bhayám  āré hetī́r ádevīḥ

translation.text: Defend us from behind, below, above, in front, on all sides, Indra, shield us well. Keep far away from us the terror seat from heaven: keep impious weapons far away.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒द्याद्या॒ श्वःश्व॒ इन्द्र॒ त्रास्व॑ प॒रे च॑ नः विश्वा॑ च नो जरि॒तॄन्त्स॑त्पते॒ अहा॒ दिवा॒ नक्तं॑ च रक्षिषः
verses.transliteration: adyā́dyā śváḥ-śvaḥ-  índra trā́sva paré ca naḥ  víśvā ca no jaritr̥̄́n satpate áhā  dívā náktaṃ ca rakṣiṣaḥ

translation.text: Protect us, Indra, each to-day, each morrow, and each following day. Our singers, through all days, shalt thou, Lord of the brave, keep safely both by day and night.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र॒भ॒ङ्गी शूरो॑ म॒घवा॑ तु॒वीम॑घः॒ सम्मि॑श्लो वि॒र्या॑य॒ कम् उ॒भा ते॑ बा॒हू वृष॑णा शतक्रतो॒ नि या वज्रं॑ मिमि॒क्षतुः॑
verses.transliteration: prabhaṅgī́ śū́ro maghávā tuvī́maghaḥ  sámmiślo vīryā̀ya kám  ubhā́ te bāhū́ vŕ̥ṣaṇā śatakrato  ní yā́ vájram mimikṣátuḥ

translation.text: A crushing Warrior, passing rich is Maghavan, endowed with all heroic might. Thine arms, O Ṣatakratu, are exceeding strong, arms which have grasped the thunderbolt.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रो अ॑स्मा॒ उप॑स्तुतिं॒ भर॑ता॒ यज्जुजो॑षति उ॒क्थैरिन्द्र॑स्य॒ माहि॑नं॒ वयो॑ वर्धन्ति सो॒मिनो॑ भ॒द्रा इन्द्र॑स्य रा॒तयः॑
verses.transliteration: pró asmā úpastutim  bháratā yáj jújoṣati  ukthaír índrasya mā́hinaṃ  váyo vardhanti somíno  bhadrā́ índrasya rātáyaḥ

translation.text: OFFER ye up as praise to him that wherein Indra takes delight. The Soma-bringers magnify Indra's great energy with hymns. Good are the gifts that Indra gives.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यु॒जो अस॑मो॒ नृभि॒रेकः॑ कृ॒ष्टीर॒यास्यः॑ पू॒र्वीरति॒ प्र वा॑वृधे॒ विश्वा॑ जा॒तान्योज॑सा भ॒द्रा इन्द्र॑स्य रा॒तयः॑
verses.transliteration: ayujó ásamo nŕ̥bhir  ékaḥ kr̥ṣṭī́r ayā́syaḥ  pūrvī́r áti prá vāvr̥dhe  víśvā jātā́ny ójasā  bhadrā́ índrasya rātáyaḥ

translation.text: Sole among chiefs, companionless, impetuous, and peerless, he Hath waxen great o'er many folk, yea., over all things born, in might.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अहि॑तेन चि॒दर्व॑ता जी॒रदा॑नुः सिषासति प्र॒वाच्य॑मिन्द्र॒ तत्तव॑ वी॒र्या॑णि करिष्य॒तो भ॒द्रा इन्द्र॑स्य रा॒तयः॑
verses.transliteration: áhitena cid árvatā  jīrádānuḥ siṣāsati  pravā́cyam indra tát táva  vīryā̀ṇi kariṣyató  bhadrā́ índrasya rātáyaḥ

translation.text: Call hither with thy newest song Indra who lacks not hymns of praise, Him who observes and knows, inspirer of the sage, him who seems eager to enjoy.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ या॑हि कृ॒णवा॑म त॒ इन्द्र॒ ब्रह्मा॑णि॒ वर्ध॑ना येभिः॑ शविष्ठ चा॒कनो॑ भ॒द्रमि॒ह श्र॑वस्य॒ते भ॒द्रा इन्द्र॑स्य रा॒तयः॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ yāhi kr̥ṇávāma te-  índra bráhmāṇi várdhanā  yébhiḥ śaviṣṭha cākáno  bhadrám ihá śravasyaté  bhadrā́ índrasya rātáyaḥ

translation.text: Come to us.hither: let us pay devotions that enhance thy might, For which, Most Potent! thou wouldst fain bless the man here who strives for fame.

verses.sanskrit_deva: धृ॒ष॒तश्चि॑द्धृ॒षन्मनः॑ कृ॒णोषी॑न्द्र॒ यत्त्वम् ती॒व्रैः सोमैः॑ सपर्य॒तो नमो॑भिः प्रति॒भूष॑तो भ॒द्रा इन्द्र॑स्य रा॒तयः॑
verses.transliteration: dhr̥ṣatáś cid dhr̥ṣán mánaḥ  kr̥ṇóṣīndra yát tvám  tīvraíḥ sómaiḥ saparyató  námobhiḥ pratibhū́ṣato  bhadrā́ índrasya rātáyaḥ

translation.text: For thou, O Indra, makest yet more bold the spirit of the bold Who with strong Soma serveth thee, still ready with his reverent prayers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अव॑ चष्ट॒ ऋची॑षमोऽव॒ताँ इ॑व॒ मानु॑षः जु॒ष्ट्वी दक्ष॑स्य सो॒मिनः॒ सखा॑यं कृणुते॒ युजं॑ भ॒द्रा इन्द्र॑स्य रा॒तयः॑
verses.transliteration: áva caṣṭa ŕ̥cīṣamo  -avatā́m̐ iva mā́nuṣaḥ  juṣṭvī́ dákṣasya somínaḥ  sákhāyaṃ kr̥ṇute yújam  bhadrā́ índrasya rātáyaḥ

translation.text: Worthy of song, he looketh down as a man looketh into wells. Pleased with the Soma-bringer's skill he maketh him his mate and friend.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विश्वे॑ त इन्द्र वी॒र्यं॑ दे॒वा अनु॒ क्रतुं॑ ददुः भुवो॒ विश्व॑स्य॒ गोप॑तिः पुरुष्टुत भ॒द्रा इन्द्र॑स्य रा॒तयः॑
verses.transliteration: víśve ta indra vīryàṃ  devā́ ánu krátuṃ daduḥ  bhúvo víśvasya gópatiḥ  puruṣṭuta  bhadrā́ índrasya rātáyaḥ

translation.text: In strength and wisdom all the Gods, Indra, have yielded unto thee. Be thou the Guard of all, O thou whom many praise.

verses.sanskrit_deva: गृ॒णे तदि॑न्द्र ते॒ शव॑ उप॒मं दे॒वता॑तये यद्धंसि॑ वृ॒त्रमोज॑सा शचीपते भ॒द्रा इन्द्र॑स्य रा॒तयः॑
verses.transliteration: gr̥ṇé tád indra te śávaḥ-  upamáṃ devátātaye  yád dháṃsi vr̥trám ójasā  śacīpate-  bhadrā́ índrasya rātáyaḥ

translation.text: Praised, Indra, is this might of thine, best for the service of the Gods, That thou with power dost slay Vr̥itra, O Lord of Strength.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सम॑नेव वपुष्य॒तः कृ॒णव॒न्मानु॑षा यु॒गा वि॒दे तदिन्द्र॒श्चेत॑न॒मध॑ श्रु॒तो भ॒द्रा इन्द्र॑स्य रा॒तयः॑
verses.transliteration: sámaneva vapuṣyatáḥ  kr̥ṇávan mā́nuṣā yugā́  vidé tád índraś cétanam  ádha śrutó  bhadrā́ índrasya rātáyaḥ

translation.text: He makes the races of mankind like synods of the Beauteous One. Indra knows this his manifest deed, and is renowned.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उज्जा॒तमि॑न्द्र ते॒ शव॒ उत्त्वामुत्तव॒ क्रतु॑म् भूरि॑गो॒ भूरि॑ वावृधु॒र्मघ॑व॒न्तव॒ शर्म॑णि भ॒द्रा इन्द्र॑स्य रा॒तयः॑
verses.transliteration: új jātám indra te śávaḥ-  út tvā́m út táva krátum  bhū́rigo bhū́ri vāvr̥dhur  mághavan táva śármaṇi  bhadrā́ índrasya rātáyaḥ

translation.text: Thy might, O Indra, at its birth, thee also, and thy mental power, In thy care, Maghavan rich in kine! they have increased exceedingly.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒हं च॒ त्वं च॑ वृत्रह॒न्त्सं यु॑ज्याव स॒निभ्य॒ आ अ॒रा॒ती॒वा चि॑दद्रि॒वोऽनु॑ नौ शूर मंसते भ॒द्रा इन्द्र॑स्य रा॒तयः॑
verses.transliteration: aháṃ ca tváṃ ca vr̥trahan  sáṃ yujyāva saníbhya ā́  arātīvā́ cid adrivaḥ-  -ánu nau śūra maṃsate  bhadrā́ índrasya rātáyaḥ

translation.text: O Vritra-slayer, thou and I will both combine for winning spoil. Even malignity will consent, O Bolt-armed Hero, unto us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒त्यमिद्वा उ॒ तं व॒यमिन्द्रं॑ स्तवाम॒ नानृ॑तम् म॒हाँ असु॑न्वतो व॒धो भूरि॒ ज्योतीं॑षि सुन्व॒तो भ॒द्रा इन्द्र॑स्य रा॒तयः॑
verses.transliteration: satyám íd vā́ u táṃ vayám  índraṃ stavāma nā́nr̥tam  mahā́m̐ ásunvato vadhó  bhū́ri jyótīṃṣi sunvató  bhadrā́ índrasya rātáyaḥ

translation.text: Let us extol this Indra as truthful and never as untrue. Dire is his death who pours no gifts: great light hath he who offers them. Good are the gifts that Indra gives.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स पू॒र्व्यो म॒हानां॑ वे॒नः क्रतु॑भिरानजे यस्य॒ द्वारा॒ मनु॑ष्पि॒ता दे॒वेषु॒ धिय॑ आन॒जे
verses.transliteration: sá pūrvyó mahā́nāṃ  venáḥ krátubhir ānaje  yásya dvā́rā mánuṣ pitā́  devéṣu dhíya ānajé

translation.text: WITH powers of Mighty Ones hath he, Ancient, Beloved, been equipped, Through whom the Father Manu made prayers efficacious with the Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दि॒वो मानं॒ नोत्स॑द॒न्त्सोम॑पृष्ठासो॒ अद्र॑यः उ॒क्था ब्रह्म॑ च॒ शंस्या॑
verses.transliteration: divó mā́naṃ nót sadan  sómapr̥ṣṭhāso ádrayaḥ  ukthā́ bráhma ca śáṃsyā

translation.text: Him, Maker of the sky, let stones wet with the Soma ne'er forsake, Nor hymns and prayer that must be said.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स वि॒द्वाँ अङ्गि॑रोभ्य॒ इन्द्रो॒ गा अ॑वृणो॒दप॑ स्तु॒षे तद॑स्य॒ पौंस्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: sá vidvā́m̐ áṅgirobhyaḥ-  índro gā́ avr̥ṇod ápa  stuṣé tád asya paúṃsyam

translation.text: Indra who knew full well disclosed the kine to the Angirases. This his great deed must be extolled.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स प्र॒त्नथा॑ कविवृ॒ध इन्द्रो॑ वा॒कस्य॑ व॒क्षणिः॑ शि॒वो अ॒र्कस्य॒ होम॑न्यस्म॒त्रा ग॒न्त्वव॑से
verses.transliteration: sá pratnáthā kavivr̥dháḥ-  índro vākásya vakṣáṇiḥ  śivó arkásya hómani-  asmatrā́ gantv ávase

translation.text: Indra, promoter of the song, the sage's Strengthener as of old, Shall come to bless and succour us at presentation of this laud.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आदू॒ नु ते॒ अनु॒ क्रतुं॒ स्वाहा॒ वर॑स्य॒ यज्य॑वः श्वा॒त्रम॒र्का अ॑नूष॒तेन्द्र॑ गो॒त्रस्य॑ दा॒वने॑
verses.transliteration: ā́d ū nú te ánu krátuṃ  svā́hā várasya yájyavaḥ  śvātrám arkā́ anūṣata-  -índra gotrásya dāváne

translation.text: Now after their desire's intent the pious singers with the cry Of Hail! have sung loud hymns to thee, Indra, to gain a stall of kine.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रे॒ विश्वा॑नि वी॒र्या॑ कृ॒तानि॒ कर्त्वा॑नि च यम॒र्का अ॑ध्व॒रं वि॒दुः
verses.transliteration: índre víśvāni vīryā̀  kr̥tā́ni kártvāni ca  yám arkā́ adhvaráṃ vidúḥ

translation.text: With Indra rest all deeds of might, deeds done and yet to be performed, Whom singers know devoid of guile.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यत्पाञ्च॑जन्यया वि॒शेन्द्रे॒ घोषा॒ असृ॑क्षत अस्तृ॑णाद्ब॒र्हणा॑ वि॒पो॒३॒॑ऽर्यो मान॑स्य॒ स क्षयः॑
verses.transliteration: yát pā́ñcajanyayā viśā́-  -índre ghóṣā ásr̥kṣata  ástr̥ṇād barháṇā vipáḥ-  -aryó mā́nasya sá kṣáyaḥ

translation.text: When the Five Tribes with all their men to Indra have sent out their voice, And when the priest hath strewn much grass, this is the Friend's own dwellingpiace.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒यमु॑ ते॒ अनु॑ष्टुतिश्चकृ॒षे तानि॒ पौंस्या॑ प्राव॑श्च॒क्रस्य॑ वर्त॒निम्
verses.transliteration: iyám u te ánuṣṭutiś  cakr̥ṣé tā́ni paúṃsyā  prā́vaś cakrásya vartaním

translation.text: This praise is verily thine own: thou hast performed these manly deeds, And sped the wheel upon its way.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्य वृष्णो॒ व्योद॑न उ॒रु क्र॑मिष्ट जी॒वसे॑ यवं॒ न प॒श्व आ द॑दे
verses.transliteration: asyá vŕ̥ṣṇo vyódane-  urú kramiṣṭa jīváse  yávaṃ ná paśvá ā́ dade

translation.text: At the o'erflowing of this Steer, boldly he strode for life, and took Soma as cattle take their corn.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तद्दधा॑ना अव॒स्यवो॑ यु॒ष्माभि॒र्दक्ष॑पितरः स्याम॑ म॒रुत्व॑तो वृ॒धे
verses.transliteration: tád dádhānā avasyávo  yuṣmā́bhir dákṣapitaraḥ  syā́ma marútvato vr̥dhé

translation.text: Receiving this and craving help, we, who with you are Daksha's sons, Would fain exalt the Maruts' Lord.

verses.sanskrit_deva: बळृ॒त्विया॑य॒ धाम्न॒ ऋक्व॑भिः शूर नोनुमः जेषा॑मेन्द्र॒ त्वया॑ यु॒जा
verses.transliteration: báḷ r̥tvíyāya dhā́mne-  ŕ̥kvabhiḥ śūra nonumaḥ  jéṣāmendra tváyā yujā́

translation.text: Yea, Hero, with the singers we sing to the duly-coming Band Allied with thee may we prevail.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्मे रु॒द्रा मे॒हना॒ पर्व॑तासो वृत्र॒हत्ये॒ भर॑हूतौ स॒जोषाः॑ यः शंस॑ते स्तुव॒ते धायि॑ प॒ज्र इन्द्र॑ज्येष्ठा अ॒स्माँ अ॑वन्तु दे॒वाः
verses.transliteration: asmé rudrā́ mehánā párvatāso  vr̥trahátye bhárahūtau sajóṣāḥ  yáḥ śáṃsate stuvaté dhā́yi pajráḥ-  índrajyeṣṭhā asmā́m̐ avantu devā́ḥ

translation.text: With us are raining Rudras, clouds accordant in call to battle at the death of Vritra, The strong assigned to him who sings and praises. May Gods with Indra at their head protect us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उत्त्वा॑ मन्दन्तु॒ स्तोमाः॑ कृणु॒ष्व राधो॑ अद्रिवः अव॑ ब्रह्म॒द्विषो॑ जहि
verses.transliteration: út tvā mandantu stómāḥ  kr̥ṇuṣvá rā́dho adrivaḥ  áva brahmadvíṣo jahi

translation.text: MAY our hymns give thee great delight. Display thy bounty, Thunderer. Drive off the enemies of prayer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प॒दा प॒णीँर॑रा॒धसो॒ नि बा॑धस्व म॒हाँ अ॑सि न॒हि त्वा॒ कश्च॒न प्रति॑
verses.transliteration: padā́ paṇī́m̐r arādháso  ní bādhasva mahā́m̐ asi  nahí tvā káś caná práti

translation.text: Crush with thy foot the niggard churls who bring no gifts. Mighty art thou There is not one to equal thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वमी॑शिषे सु॒ताना॒मिन्द्र॒ त्वमसु॑तानाम् त्वं राजा॒ जना॑नाम्
verses.transliteration: tvám īśiṣe sutā́nām  índra tvám ásutānām  tváṃ rā́jā jánānām

translation.text: Thou art the Lord of Soma pressed, Soma impressed is also thine. Thou art the Sovran of the folk.

verses.sanskrit_deva: एहि॒ प्रेहि॒ क्षयो॑ दि॒व्या॒३॒॑घोष॑ञ्चर्षणी॒नाम् ओभे पृ॑णासि॒ रोद॑सी
verses.transliteration: éhi préhi kṣáyo diví-  -āghóṣañ carṣaṇīnā́m  óbhé pr̥ṇāsi ródasī

translation.text: Come, go thou forth, dwelling in heaven and listening to the prayers of men: Thou fillest both the heavens and earth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्यं चि॒त्पर्व॑तं गि॒रिं श॒तव॑न्तं सह॒स्रिण॑म् वि स्तो॒तृभ्यो॑ रुरोजिथ
verses.transliteration: tyáṃ cit párvataṃ giríṃ  śatávantaṃ sahasríṇam  ví stotŕ̥bhyo rurojitha

translation.text: Even that hill with rocky heights, with hundreds, thousands, held within. Thou for thy worshippers brakest through.

verses.sanskrit_deva: व॒यमु॑ त्वा॒ दिवा॑ सु॒ते व॒यं नक्तं॑ हवामहे अ॒स्माकं॒ काम॒मा पृ॑ण
verses.transliteration: vayám u tvā dívā suté  vayáṃ náktaṃ havāmahe  asmā́kaṃ kā́mam ā́ pr̥ṇa

translation.text: We call on thee both night and day to taste the flowing Soma juice: Do thou fulfil our heart's desire.

verses.sanskrit_deva: क्व१॒॑ स्य वृ॑ष॒भो युवा॑ तुवि॒ग्रीवो॒ अना॑नतः ब्र॒ह्मा कस्तं स॑पर्यति
verses.transliteration: kvà syá vr̥ṣabhó yúvā  tuvigrī́vo ánānataḥ  brahmā́ kás táṃ saparyati

translation.text: Where is that ever-youthful Steer, strong-necked and never yet bent down? What Brahman ministers to him?

verses.sanskrit_deva: कस्य॑ स्वि॒त्सव॑नं॒ वृषा॑ जुजु॒ष्वाँ अव॑ गच्छति इन्द्रं॒ क उ॑ स्वि॒दा च॑के
verses.transliteration: kásya svit sávanaṃ vŕ̥ṣā  jujuṣvā́m̐ áva gachati  índraṃ ká u svid ā́ cake

translation.text: To whose libation doth the Steer, betake him with delight therein? Who takes delight in Indra now?

verses.sanskrit_deva: कं ते॑ दा॒ना अ॑सक्षत॒ वृत्र॑ह॒न्कं सु॒वीर्या॑ उ॒क्थे क उ॑ स्वि॒दन्त॑मः
verses.transliteration: káṃ te dānā́ asakṣata  vŕ̥trahan káṃ suvī́ryā  ukthé ká u svid ántamaḥ

translation.text: Whom, Vritra-slayer, have thy gifts and hero powers accompanied? Who is thy dearest in the land?

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं ते॒ मानु॑षे॒ जने॒ सोमः॑ पू॒रुषु॑ सूयते तस्येहि॒ प्र द्र॑वा॒ पिब॑
verses.transliteration: ayáṃ te mā́nuṣe jáne  sómaḥ pūrúṣu sūyate  tásyéhi prá dravā píba

translation.text: For thee among mankind, among the Pûrus is this Soma shed. Hasten thou hither: drink thereof.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं ते॑ शर्य॒णाव॑ति सु॒षोमा॑या॒मधि॑ प्रि॒यः आ॒र्जी॒कीये॑ म॒दिन्त॑मः
verses.transliteration: ayáṃ te śaryaṇā́vati  suṣómāyām ádhi priyáḥ  ārjīkī́ye madíntamaḥ

translation.text: This, growing by Sushomâ and by Ṣaryaṇâvân, dear to thee, In Ârjîkîya, cheers thee best.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तम॒द्य राध॑से म॒हे चारुं॒ मदा॑य॒ घृष्व॑ये एही॑मिन्द्र॒ द्रवा॒ पिब॑
verses.transliteration: tám adyá rā́dhase mahé  cā́rum mádāya ghŕ̥ṣvaye  éhīm indra drávā píba

translation.text: Hasten thou hitherward, and drink this for munificence to-day Delightful for thine eager draught.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यदि॑न्द्र॒ प्रागपा॒गुद॒ङ्न्य॑ग्वा हू॒यसे॒ नृभिः॑ आ या॑हि॒ तूय॑मा॒शुभिः॑
verses.transliteration: yád indra prā́g ápāg údak-  nyàg vā hūyáse nŕ̥bhiḥ  ā́ yāhi tū́yam āśúbhiḥ

translation.text: THOUGH, Indra, thou art called by men from east and west, from north and south, Come hither quickly with fleet steeds;

verses.sanskrit_deva: यद्वा॑ प्र॒स्रव॑णे दि॒वो मा॒दया॑से॒ स्व॑र्णरे यद्वा॑ समु॒द्रे अन्ध॑सः
verses.transliteration: yád vā prasrávaṇe divó  mādáyāse svàrṇare  yád vā samudré ándhasaḥ

translation.text: If in the effluence of heaven, rich in its light, thou takest joy, Or in the sea in Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ त्वा॑ गी॒र्भिर्म॒हामु॒रुं हु॒वे गामि॑व॒ भोज॑से इन्द्र॒ सोम॑स्य पी॒तये॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ tvā gīrbhír mahā́m urúṃ  huvé gā́m iva bhójase  índra sómasya pītáye

translation.text: With songs I call thee, Great and Wide, even as a cow to profit us, Indra, to drink the Soma-draught.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ त॑ इन्द्र महि॒मानं॒ हर॑यो देव ते॒ महः॑ रथे॑ वहन्तु॒ बिभ्र॑तः
verses.transliteration: ā́ ta indra mahimā́naṃ  hárayo deva te máhaḥ  ráthe vahantu bíbhrataḥ

translation.text: Hither, O Indra, let thy Bays bear up and, bring upon thy car Thy glory, God! and majesty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॑ गृणी॒ष उ॑ स्तु॒षे म॒हाँ उ॒ग्र ई॑शान॒कृत् एहि॑ नः सु॒तं पिब॑
verses.transliteration: índra gr̥ṇīṣá u stuṣé  mahā́m̐ ugrá īśānakŕ̥t  éhi naḥ sutám píba

translation.text: Thou, Indra, wouldst be sung and praised as great, strong, lordly in thy deeds Come hither, drink our Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒ताव॑न्तस्त्वा व॒यं प्रय॑स्वन्तो हवामहे इ॒दं नो॑ ब॒र्हिरा॒सदे॑
verses.transliteration: sutā́vantas tvā vayám  práyasvanto havāmahe  idáṃ no barhír āsáde

translation.text: We who have shed the Soma and prepared the feast are calling thee. To sit on this our sacred grass.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यच्चि॒द्धि शश्व॑ता॒मसीन्द्र॒ साधा॑रण॒स्त्वम् तं त्वा॑ व॒यं ह॑वामहे
verses.transliteration: yác cid dhí śáśvatām ási-  -índra sā́dhāraṇas tvám  táṃ tvā vayáṃ havāmahe

translation.text: As, Indra, thou art evermore the common Lord of all alike, As such we invocate thee now.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒दं ते॑ सो॒म्यं मध्वधु॑क्ष॒न्नद्रि॑भि॒र्नरः॑ जु॒षा॒ण इ॑न्द्र॒ तत्पि॑ब
verses.transliteration: idáṃ te somyám mádhu-  ádhukṣann ádribhir náraḥ  juṣāṇá indra tát piba

translation.text: The men with stones have milked for thee this nectar of the Soma juice: Indra, be pleased with it, and drink.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विश्वाँ॑ अ॒र्यो वि॑प॒श्चितोऽति॑ ख्य॒स्तूय॒मा ग॑हि अ॒स्मे धे॑हि॒ श्रवो॑ बृ॒हत्
verses.transliteration: víśvām̐ aryó vipaścítaḥ-  -áti khyas tū́yam ā́ gahi  asmé dhehi śrávo br̥hád

translation.text: Neglect all pious men with skill in sacred song: come hitherward With speed, and give us high renown.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दा॒ता मे॒ पृष॑तीनां॒ राजा॑ हिरण्य॒वीना॑म् मा दे॑वा म॒घवा॑ रिषत्
verses.transliteration: dātā́ me pŕ̥ṣatīnāṃ  rā́jā hiraṇyavī́nām  mā́ devā maghávā riṣat

translation.text: Gods, may the mighty rest unharmed, the King who gives spotted kine, Kine decked with golden ornaments.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒हस्रे॒ पृष॑तीना॒मधि॑ श्च॒न्द्रं बृ॒हत्पृ॒थु शु॒क्रं हिर॑ण्य॒मा द॑दे
verses.transliteration: sahásre pŕ̥ṣatīnām  ádhi ścandrám br̥hát pr̥thú  śukráṃ híraṇyam ā́ dade

translation.text: Beside a thousand spotted kine I have received a gift of gold Pure, brilliant, and exceeding great.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नपा॑तो दु॒र्गह॑स्य मे स॒हस्रे॑ण सु॒राध॑सः श्रवो॑ दे॒वेष्व॑क्रत
verses.transliteration: nápāto durgáhasya me  sahásreṇa surā́dhasaḥ  śrávo devéṣv akrata

translation.text: Durgaha’s grandsons, giving me a thousand kine, munificent Have won renown among the Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तरो॑भिर्वो वि॒दद्व॑सु॒मिन्द्रं॑ स॒बाध॑ ऊ॒तये॑ बृ॒हद्गाय॑न्तः सु॒तसो॑मे अध्व॒रे हु॒वे भरं॒ न का॒रिण॑म्
verses.transliteration: tárobhir vo vidádvasum  índraṃ sabā́dha ūtáye  br̥hád gā́yantaḥ sutásome adhvaré  huvé bháraṃ ná kāríṇam

translation.text: LOUD singing at the sacred rite where Soma flows we priests invoke With haste, that he may help, as the bard's Cherisher, Indra who findeth wealth for you.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न यं दु॒ध्रा वर॑न्ते॒ न स्थि॒रा मुरो॒ मदे॑ सुशि॒प्रमन्ध॑सः य आ॒दृत्या॑ शशमा॒नाय॑ सुन्व॒ते दाता॑ जरि॒त्र उ॒क्थ्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: ná yáṃ dudhrā́ várante ná sthirā́ múro  máde suśiprám ándhasaḥ  yá ādŕ̥tyā śaśamānā́ya sunvaté  dā́tā jaritrá ukthyàm

translation.text: Whom with fair helm, in rapture of the juice, the firm resistless slayers hinder not: Giver of glorious wealth to him who sing a his praise, honouring him who toils and pours:

verses.sanskrit_deva: यः श॒क्रो मृ॒क्षो अश्व्यो॒ यो वा॒ कीजो॑ हिर॒ण्ययः॑ स ऊ॒र्वस्य॑ रेजय॒त्यपा॑वृति॒मिन्द्रो॒ गव्य॑स्य वृत्र॒हा
verses.transliteration: yáḥ śakró mr̥kṣó áśvyo  yó vā kī́jo hiraṇyáyaḥ  sá ūrvásya rejayaty ápāvr̥tim  índro gávyasya vr̥trahā́

translation.text: Ṣakra, who like a curry-comb for horses or a golden goad, Indra, the Vr̥itra-slayer, urges eagerly the opening of the stall of kine:

verses.sanskrit_deva: निखा॑तं चि॒द्यः पु॑रुसम्भृ॒तं वसूदिद्वप॑ति दा॒शुषे॑ व॒ज्री सु॑शि॒प्रो हर्य॑श्व॒ इत्क॑र॒दिन्द्रः॒ क्रत्वा॒ यथा॒ वश॑त्
verses.transliteration: níkhātaṃ cid yáḥ purusambhr̥táṃ vásu-  -úd íd vápati dāśúṣe  vajrī́ suśipró háryaśva ít karad  índraḥ krátvā yáthā váśat

translation.text: Who for the worshipper scatters forth ample wealth, even though buried, piled in heaps: May Indra, Lord of Bay Steeds, fair-helmed Thunderer, act at his pleasure, as he lists.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यद्वा॒वन्थ॑ पुरुष्टुत पु॒रा चि॑च्छूर नृ॒णाम् व॒यं तत्त॑ इन्द्र॒ सं भ॑रामसि य॒ज्ञमु॒क्थं तु॒रं वचः॑
verses.transliteration: yád vāvántha puruṣṭuta  purā́ cic chūra nr̥ṇā́m  vayáṃ tát ta indra sám bharāmasi  yajñám uktháṃ turáṃ vácaḥ

translation.text: Hero whom many praise, what thou hast longed for, oven of old, from men. All that we offer unto thee, O Indra, now, sacrifice, laud, effectual speech.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सचा॒ सोमे॑षु पुरुहूत वज्रिवो॒ मदा॑य द्युक्ष सोमपाः त्वमिद्धि ब्र॑ह्म॒कृते॒ काम्यं॒ वसु॒ देष्ठः॑ सुन्व॒ते भुवः॑
verses.transliteration: sácā sómeṣu puruhūta vajrivo  mádāya dyukṣa somapāḥ  tvám íd dhí brahmakŕ̥te kā́myaṃ vásu  déṣṭhaḥ sunvaté bhúvaḥ

translation.text: To Soma, Much-invoked, Bolt-armed! for thy carouse, Celestial, Soma-drinker! come. Thou to the man who prays and pours the juice hast been best giver of delightful wealth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: व॒यमे॑नमि॒दा ह्योऽपी॑पेमे॒ह व॒ज्रिण॑म् तस्मा॑ उ अ॒द्य स॑म॒ना सु॒तं भ॒रा नू॒नं भू॑षत श्रु॒ते
verses.transliteration: vayám enam idā́ hyó  -ápīpemehá vajríṇam  tásmā u adyá samanā́ sutám bhara-  -ā́ nūnám bhūṣata śruté

translation.text: Here, verily, yesterday we let the Thunder-wielder drink his fill. So in like manner offer him the juice to-day. Now range you by the Glorious One.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वृक॑श्चिदस्य वार॒ण उ॑रा॒मथि॒रा व॒युने॑षु भूषति सेमं नः॒ स्तोमं॑ जुजुषा॒ण आ ग॒हीन्द्र॒ प्र चि॒त्रया॑ धि॒या
verses.transliteration: vŕ̥kaś cid asya vāraṇá urāmáthir  ā́ vayúneṣu bhūṣati  sémáṃ na stómaṃ jujuṣāṇá ā́ gahi-  -índra prá citráyā dhiyā́

translation.text: Even the wolf, the savage beast that rends the sheep, follows the path of his decrees. So graciously accepting, Indra, this our praise, with wondrous thought come forth to us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कदू॒ न्व१॒॑स्याकृ॑त॒मिन्द्र॑स्यास्ति॒ पौंस्य॑म् केनो॒ नु कं॒ श्रोम॑तेन॒ न शु॑श्रुवे ज॒नुषः॒ परि॑ वृत्र॒हा
verses.transliteration: kád ū nv àsyā́kr̥tam  índrasyāsti paúṃsyam  kéno nú kaṃ śrómatena ná śuśruve  janúṣaḥ pári vr̥trahā́

translation.text: What manly deed of vigour now remains that Indra hath not done? Who hath not heard his glorious title and his fame, the Vritra-slayer from his birth?

verses.sanskrit_deva: कदू॑ म॒हीरधृ॑ष्टा अस्य॒ तवि॑षीः॒ कदु॑ वृत्र॒घ्नो अस्तृ॑तम् इन्द्रो॒ विश्वा॑न्बेक॒नाटाँ॑ अह॒र्दृश॑ उ॒त क्रत्वा॑ प॒णीँर॒भि
verses.transliteration: kád ū mahī́r ádhr̥ṣṭā asya táviṣīḥ  kád u vr̥traghnó ástr̥tam  índro víśvān bekanā́ṭām̐ ahardŕ̥śaḥ-  utá krátvā paṇī́m̐r abhí

translation.text: How great his power resistless! how invincible the Vritra-slayer’s matchless might! Indra excels all usurers who see the day, excels all traffickers in strength.

verses.sanskrit_deva: व॒यं घा॑ ते॒ अपू॒र्व्येन्द्र॒ ब्रह्मा॑णि वृत्रहन् पु॒रू॒तमा॑सः पुरुहूत वज्रिवो भृ॒तिं न प्र भ॑रामसि
verses.transliteration: vayáṃ ghā te ápūrvyā-  -índra bráhmāṇi vr̥trahan  purūtámāsaḥ puruhūta vajrivo  bhr̥tíṃ ná prá bharāmasi

translation.text: O Indra, Vritra-slayer, we, thy very constant worshippers, Bring prayers ne’er heard before to thee, O Much-invoked, O Thunder-armed, to be thy meed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पू॒र्वीश्चि॒द्धि त्वे तु॑विकूर्मिन्ना॒शसो॒ हव॑न्त इन्द्रो॒तयः॑ ति॒रश्चि॑द॒र्यः सव॒ना व॑सो गहि॒ शवि॑ष्ठ श्रु॒धि मे॒ हव॑म्
verses.transliteration: pūrvī́ś cid dhí tvé tuvikūrminn āśáso  hávanta indrotáyaḥ  tiráś cid aryáḥ sávanā́ vaso gahi  śáviṣṭha śrudhí me hávam

translation.text: O thou of mighty acts, the aids that are in thee call forward many an eager hope. Past the drink-offerings, Vasu, even of the good, hear my call, Strongest God, and come.

verses.sanskrit_deva: व॒यं घा॑ ते॒ त्वे इद्विन्द्र॒ विप्रा॒ अपि॑ ष्मसि न॒हि त्वद॒न्यः पु॑रुहूत॒ कश्च॒न मघ॑व॒न्नस्ति॑ मर्डि॒ता
verses.transliteration: vayáṃ ghā te tvé íd u-  índra víprā ápi ṣmasi  nahí tvád anyáḥ puruhūta káś caná  mághavann ásti marḍitā́

translation.text: Verily, Indra, we are thine, we worshippers depend on thee, For there is none but only thou to show us grace, O Maghavan, thou much invoked.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं नो॑ अ॒स्या अम॑तेरु॒त क्षु॒धो॒३॒॑ऽभिश॑स्ते॒रव॑ स्पृधि त्वं न॑ ऊ॒ती तव॑ चि॒त्रया॑ धि॒या शिक्षा॑ शचिष्ठ गातु॒वित्
verses.transliteration: tváṃ no asyā́ ámater utá kṣudhaḥ-  -ábhíśaster áva spr̥dhi  tváṃ na ūtī́ táva citráyā dhiyā́  śíkṣā śaciṣṭha gātuvít

translation.text: From this our misery and famine set us free, from this dire curse deliver us. Succour us with thine help and with thy wondrous thought, Most Mighty, finder of the way,

verses.sanskrit_deva: सोम॒ इद्वः॑ सु॒तो अ॑स्तु॒ कल॑यो॒ मा बि॑भीतन अपेदे॒ष ध्व॒स्माय॑ति स्व॒यं घै॒षो अपा॑यति
verses.transliteration: sóma íd vaḥ sutó astu  kálayo mā́ bibhītana  ápéd eṣá dhvasmā́yati  svayáṃ ghaiṣó ápāyati

translation.text: Now let your Soma juice be poured: be not afraid, O Kali's sons. This darkening sorrow goes away; yea, of itself it vanishes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्यान्नु क्ष॒त्रियाँ॒ अव॑ आदि॒त्यान्या॑चिषामहे सु॒मृ॒ळी॒काँ अ॒भिष्ट॑ये
verses.transliteration: tyā́n nú kṣatríyām̐ ávaḥ-  ādityā́n yāciṣāmahe  sumr̥ḷīkā́m̐ abhíṣṭaye

translation.text: Now pray we to these Ksatriyas, to the Âdityas for their aid, These who are gracious to assist.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मि॒त्रो नो॒ अत्यं॑ह॒तिं वरु॑णः पर्षदर्य॒मा आ॒दि॒त्यासो॒ यथा॑ वि॒दुः
verses.transliteration: mitró no áty aṃhatíṃ  váruṇaḥ parṣad aryamā́  ādityā́so yáthā vidúḥ

translation.text: May Mitra bear us o'er distress, and Varuṇa and Aryaman, Yea, the Âdityas, as they know.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तेषां॒ हि चि॒त्रमु॒क्थ्यं१॒॑ वरू॑थ॒मस्ति॑ दा॒शुषे॑ आ॒दि॒त्याना॑मरं॒कृते॑
verses.transliteration: téṣāṃ hí citrám ukthyàṃ  várūtham ásti dāśúṣe  ādityā́nām araṃkŕ̥te

translation.text: For wonderful and meet for praise is these Âdityas' saving help To him who offers and prepares.

verses.sanskrit_deva: महि॑ वो मह॒तामवो॒ वरु॑ण॒ मित्रार्य॑मन् अवां॒स्या वृ॑णीमहे
verses.transliteration: máhi vo mahatā́m ávo  váruṇa mítrā́ryaman  ávāṃsy ā́ vr̥ṇīmahe

translation.text: The mighty aid of you, the Great, Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman, We claim to be our sure defence.

verses.sanskrit_deva: जी॒वान्नो॑ अ॒भि धे॑त॒नादि॑त्यासः पु॒रा हथा॑त् कद्ध॑ स्थ हवनश्रुतः
verses.transliteration: jīvā́n no abhí dhetana-  -ā́dityāsaḥ purā́ háthāt  kád dha stha havanaśrutaḥ

translation.text: Guard us, Âdityas, still alive, before the deadly weapon strike: Are ye not they who hear our call?

verses.sanskrit_deva: यद्वः॑ श्रा॒न्ताय॑ सुन्व॒ते वरू॑थ॒मस्ति॒ यच्छ॒र्दिः तेना॑ नो॒ अधि॑ वोचत
verses.transliteration: yád vaḥ śrāntā́ya sunvaté  várūtham ásti yác chardíḥ  ténā no ádhi vocata

translation.text: What sheltering defence ye have for him who toils in pouring gifts, Graciously bless ye us therewith.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अस्ति॑ देवा अं॒होरु॒र्वस्ति॒ रत्न॒मना॑गसः आदि॑त्या॒ अद्भु॑तैनसः
verses.transliteration: ásti devā aṃhór urú-  ásti rátnam ánāgasaḥ  ā́dityā ádbhutainasaḥ

translation.text: Âdityas, Gods, from sorrow there is freedom, for the sinless, wealth, O ye in whom no fault is seen.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा नः॒ सेतुः॑ सिषेद॒यं म॒हे वृ॑णक्तु न॒स्परि॑ इन्द्र॒ इद्धि श्रु॒तो व॒शी
verses.transliteration: mā́ naḥ sétuḥ siṣed ayám  mahé vr̥ṇaktu nas pári  índra íd dhí śrutó vaśī́

translation.text: Let not this fetter bind us fast: may he release us for success; For strong is Indra and renowned.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा नो॑ मृ॒चा रि॑पू॒णां वृ॑जि॒नाना॑मविष्यवः देवा॑ अ॒भि प्र मृ॑क्षत
verses.transliteration: mā́ no mr̥cā́ ripūṇā́ṃ  vr̥jinā́nām aviṣyavaḥ  dévā abhí prá mr̥kṣata

translation.text: 0 Gods who fain would lend your aid, destroy not us as ye destroy Your enemies who go astray.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त त्वाम॑दिते मह्य॒हं दे॒व्युप॑ ब्रुवे सु॒मृ॒ळी॒काम॒भिष्ट॑ये
verses.transliteration: utá tvā́m adite mahi-  aháṃ devy úpa bruve  sumr̥ḷīkā́m abhíṣṭaye

translation.text: And thee too, O Great Aditi, thee also, Goddess, I address, Thee very gracious to assist.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पर्षि॑ दी॒ने ग॑भी॒र आँ उग्र॑पुत्रे॒ जिघां॑सतः माकि॑स्तो॒कस्य॑ नो रिषत्
verses.transliteration: párṣi dīné gabhīrá ā́m̐  úgraputre jíghāṃsataḥ  mā́kis tokásya no riṣat

translation.text: Save us in depth and shallow from the foe, thou Mother of Strong Sons: Let no one of our seed be harmed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ने॒हो न॑ उरुव्रज॒ उरू॑चि॒ वि प्रस॑र्तवे कृ॒धि तो॒काय॑ जी॒वसे॑
verses.transliteration: anehó na uruvraje-  úrūci ví prásartave  kr̥dhí tokā́ya jīváse

translation.text: Far-spread! wide-ruling! grant that we, unharmed by envy may expand: Grant that our progeny may live.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ये मू॒र्धानः॑ क्षिती॒नामद॑ब्धासः॒ स्वय॑शसः व्र॒ता रक्ष॑न्ते अ॒द्रुहः॑
verses.transliteration: yé mūrdhā́naḥ kṣitīnā́m  ádabdhāsaḥ sváyaśasaḥ  vratā́ rákṣante adrúhaḥ

translation.text: Those who, the Princes of the folk, in native glory, ne'er deceived, Maintain their statutes, void of guile —

verses.sanskrit_deva: ते न॑ आ॒स्नो वृका॑णा॒मादि॑त्यासो मु॒मोच॑त स्ते॒नं ब॒द्धमि॑वादिते
verses.transliteration: té na āsnó vŕ̥kāṇām  ā́dityāso mumócata  stenám baddhám ivādite

translation.text: As such, from mouth of ravening wolves, O ye Âdityas, rescue us, Like a bound thief, O Aditi.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अपो॒ षु ण॑ इ॒यं शरु॒रादि॑त्या॒ अप॑ दुर्म॒तिः अ॒स्मदे॒त्वज॑घ्नुषी
verses.transliteration: ápo ṣú ṇa iyáṃ śárur  ā́dityā ápa durmatíḥ  asmád etv ájaghnuṣī

translation.text: Âdityas, let this arrow, yea, let this malignity depart From us or e’er it strike us dead.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शश्व॒द्धि वः॑ सुदानव॒ आदि॑त्या ऊ॒तिभि॑र्व॒यम् पु॒रा नू॒नं बु॑भु॒ज्महे॑
verses.transliteration: śáśvad dhí vaḥ sudānavaḥ-  ā́dityā ūtíbhir vayám  purā́ nūnám bubhujmáhe

translation.text: For, Bountiful Âdityas, we have evermore enjoyed your help, Both now and in the days of old.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शश्व॑न्तं॒ हि प्र॑चेतसः प्रति॒यन्तं॑ चि॒देन॑सः देवाः॑ कृणु॒थ जी॒वसे॑
verses.transliteration: śáśvantaṃ hí pracetasaḥ  pratiyántaṃ cid énasaḥ  dévāḥ kr̥ṇuthá jīváse

translation.text: To every one, O ye Most Wise, who turneth even from sin to you, Ye Gods vouchsafe that he may live.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तत्सु नो॒ नव्यं॒ सन्य॑स॒ आदि॑त्या॒ यन्मुमो॑चति ब॒न्धाद्ब॒द्धमि॑वादिते
verses.transliteration: tát sú no návyaṃ sányase-  -ā́dityā yán múmocati  bandhā́d baddhám ivādite

translation.text: May this new mercy profit us, which, ye Âdityas, frees like one Bound from his bonds, O Aditi.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नास्माक॑मस्ति॒ तत्तर॒ आदि॑त्यासो अति॒ष्कदे॑ यू॒यम॒स्मभ्यं॑ मृळत
verses.transliteration: nā́smā́kam asti tát táraḥ-  ā́dityāso atiṣkáde  yūyám asmábhyam mr̥ḷata

translation.text: O ye Âdityas, this your might is not to be despised by us: So be ye graciously inclined.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा नो॑ हे॒तिर्वि॒वस्व॑त॒ आदि॑त्याः कृ॒त्रिमा॒ शरुः॑ पु॒रा नु ज॒रसो॑ वधीत्
verses.transliteration: mā́ no hetír vivásvataḥ-  ā́dityāḥ kr̥trímā śáruḥ  purā́ nú jaráso vadhīt

translation.text: Let not Vivasvan’s weapon nor the shaft, Âdityas, wrought with skill, Destroy us ere old age be nigh.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि षु द्वेषो॒ व्यं॑ह॒तिमादि॑त्यासो॒ वि संहि॑तम् विष्व॒ग्वि वृ॑हता॒ रपः॑
verses.transliteration: ví ṣú dvéṣo vy àṃhatím  ā́dityāso ví sáṃhitam  víṣvag ví vr̥hatā rápaḥ

translation.text: On every side dispel all sin, Âdityas, all hostility, Indigence, and combined attack.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ त्वा॒ रथं॒ यथो॒तये॑ सु॒म्नाय॑ वर्तयामसि तु॒वि॒कू॒र्मिमृ॑ती॒षह॒मिन्द्र॒ शवि॑ष्ठ॒ सत्प॑ते
verses.transliteration: ā́ tvā ráthaṃ yáthotáye  sumnā́ya vartayāmasi  tuvikūrmím r̥tīṣáham  índra śáviṣṭha sátpate

translation.text: EVEN as a car to give us aid, we draw thee hither for our bliss, Strong in thy deeds, checking assault, Lord, Mightiest Indra, of the brave!

verses.sanskrit_deva: तुवि॑शुष्म॒ तुवि॑क्रतो॒ शची॑वो॒ विश्व॑या मते आ प॑प्राथ महित्व॒ना
verses.transliteration: túviśuṣma túvikrato  śácīvo víśvayā mate  ā́ paprātha mahitvanā́

translation.text: Great in thy power and wisdom, Strong, with thought that comprehendeth all Thou hast filled full with majesty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्य॑ ते महि॒ना म॒हः परि॑ ज्मा॒यन्त॑मी॒यतुः॑ हस्ता॒ वज्रं॑ हिर॒ण्यय॑म्
verses.transliteration: yásya te mahinā́ maháḥ  pári jmāyántam īyátuḥ  hástā vájraṃ hiraṇyáyam

translation.text: Thou very Mighty One, whose hands by virtue of thy greatness grasp, The golden bolt that breaks its way.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि॒श्वान॑रस्य व॒स्पति॒मना॑नतस्य॒ शव॑सः एवै॑श्च चर्षणी॒नामू॒ती हु॑वे॒ रथा॑नाम्
verses.transliteration: viśvā́narasya vas pátim  ánānatasya śávasaḥ  évaiś ca carṣaṇīnā́m  ūtī́ huve ráthānām

translation.text: Your Lord of might that ne'er hath bent, that ruleth over all mankind, I call, that he, as he is wont, may aid the chariots and the men.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भिष्ट॑ये स॒दावृ॑धं॒ स्व॑र्मीळ्हेषु॒ यं नरः॑ नाना॒ हव॑न्त ऊ॒तये॑
verses.transliteration: abhíṣṭaye sadā́vr̥dhaṃ  svàrmīḷheṣu yáṃ náraḥ  nā́nā hávanta ūtáye

translation.text: Whom, ever farthering, in frays that win the light, in both the hosts Men call to succour and to help.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प॒रोमा॑त्र॒मृची॑षम॒मिन्द्र॑मु॒ग्रं सु॒राध॑सम् ईशा॑नं चि॒द्वसू॑नाम्
verses.transliteration: parómātram ŕ̥cīṣamam  índram ugráṃ surā́dhasam  ī́śānaṃ cid vásūnām

translation.text: Indra, the Strong, the measureless, worthy of praise, Most Bountiful, Sole Ruler even over wealth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तंत॒मिद्राध॑से म॒ह इन्द्रं॑ चोदामि पी॒तये॑ यः पू॒र्व्यामनु॑ष्टुति॒मीशे॑ कृष्टी॒नां नृ॒तुः
verses.transliteration: táṃ-tam íd rā́dhase mahé-  índraṃ codāmi pītáye  yáḥ pūrvyā́m ánuṣṭutim  ī́śe kr̥ṣṭīnā́ṃ nr̥túḥ

translation.text: Him, for his ample bounty, him, this Indra do I urge to drink, Who, as his praise was sung of old, the Dancer, is the Lord of men.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न यस्य॑ ते शवसान स॒ख्यमा॒नंश॒ मर्त्यः॑ नकिः॒ शवां॑सि ते नशत्
verses.transliteration: ná yásya te śavasāna  sakhyám ānáṃśa mártyaḥ  nákiḥ śávāṃsi te naśat

translation.text: Thou Mighty One, whose friendship none of mortals ever hath obtained: None will attain unto thy might.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वोता॑स॒स्त्वा यु॒जाप्सु सूर्ये॑ म॒हद्धन॑म् जये॑म पृ॒त्सु व॑ज्रिवः
verses.transliteration: tvótāsas tvā́ yujā́-  -apsú sū́rye mahád dhánam  jáyema pr̥tsú vajrivaḥ

translation.text: Aided by thee, with thee allied, in frays for water and for sun, Bolt-armed! may we win ample spoil.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं त्वा॑ य॒ज्ञेभि॑रीमहे॒ तं गी॒र्भिर्गि॑र्वणस्तम इन्द्र॒ यथा॑ चि॒दावि॑थ॒ वाजे॑षु पुरु॒माय्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: táṃ tvā yajñébhir īmahe  táṃ gīrbhír girvaṇastama  índra yáthā cid ā́vitha  vā́jeṣu purumā́yyam

translation.text: So seek we thee with sacrifice and songs, chief Lover of the Song, As, in our battles, Indra, thou to Purumâyya gavest help.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्य॑ ते स्वा॒दु स॒ख्यं स्वा॒द्वी प्रणी॑तिरद्रिवः य॒ज्ञो वि॑तन्त॒साय्यः॑
verses.transliteration: yásya te svādú sakhyáṃ  svādvī́ práṇītir adrivaḥ  yajñó vitantasā́yyaḥ

translation.text: O Thunderer, thou whose friendship and whose onward guidance both are sweet, Thy sacrifice must be prepared.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒रु ण॑स्त॒न्वे॒३॒॑ तन॑ उ॒रु क्षया॑य नस्कृधि उ॒रु णो॑ यन्धि जी॒वसे॑
verses.transliteration: urú ṇas tanvè táne-  urú kṣáyāya nas kr̥dhi  urú ṇo yandhi jīváse

translation.text: To us, ourselves, give ample room, give for our dwelling ample room: Give ample room to us to live.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒रुं नृभ्य॑ उ॒रुं गव॑ उ॒रुं रथा॑य॒ पन्था॑म् दे॒ववी॑तिं मनामहे
verses.transliteration: urúṃ nŕ̥bhya urúṃ gáve-  urúṃ ráthāya pánthām  devávītim manāmahe

translation.text: We count the banquet of the Gods a spacious pathway for the men, And for the cattle, and the car.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उप॑ मा॒ षड्द्वाद्वा॒ नरः॒ सोम॑स्य॒ हर्ष्या॑ तिष्ठ॑न्ति स्वादुरा॒तयः॑
verses.transliteration: úpa mā ṣáḍ dvā́-dvā  náraḥ sómasya hárṣyā  tíṣṭhanti svādurātáyaḥ

translation.text: Six men, yea, two and two, made glad with Soma juice, come near to me With offerings pleasant to the taste.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋ॒ज्रावि॑न्द्रो॒त आ द॑दे॒ हरी॒ ऋक्ष॑स्य सू॒नवि॑ आ॒श्व॒मे॒धस्य॒ रोहि॑ता
verses.transliteration: r̥jrā́v indrotá ā́ dade  hárī ŕ̥kṣasya sūnávi  āśvamedhásya róhitā

translation.text: Two brown-hued steeds, Indrota’s gift, two bays from Riksha’s son were mine, From Aṣvamedha’s son two red.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒रथाँ॑ आतिथि॒ग्वे स्व॑भी॒शूँरा॒र्क्षे आ॒श्व॒मे॒धे सु॒पेश॑सः
verses.transliteration: suráthām̐ ātithigvé  svabhīśū́m̐r ārkṣé  āśvamedhé supéśasaḥ

translation.text: From Âtithigva good car-steeds, from Arksha rein-obeying steeds, From Aṣvamedha beauteous ones.

verses.sanskrit_deva: षळश्वाँ॑ आतिथि॒ग्व इ॑न्द्रो॒ते व॒धूम॑तः सचा॑ पू॒तक्र॑तौ सनम्
verses.transliteration: ṣáḷ áśvām̐ ātithigvé-  indroté vadhū́mataḥ  sácā pūtákratau sanam

translation.text: Indrota, Âtithigva’s son, gave me six horses matched with mares: And Putakratu gave besides.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऐषु॑ चेत॒द्वृष॑ण्वत्य॒न्तर्ऋ॒ज्रेष्वरु॑षी स्व॒भी॒शुः कशा॑वती
verses.transliteration: aíṣu cetad vŕ̥ṣaṇvatī-  antár r̥jréṣv áruṣī  svabhīśúḥ káśāvatī

translation.text: Marked above all, amid the brown, is the red mare Vr̥ishaṇvatî, Obedient to the rein and whip.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न यु॒ष्मे वा॑जबन्धवो निनि॒त्सुश्च॒न मर्त्यः॑ अ॒व॒द्यमधि॑ दीधरत्
verses.transliteration: ná yuṣmé vājabandhavo  ninitsúś caná mártyaḥ  avadyám ádhi dīdharat

translation.text: O bound to me by deeds of might, not even the man who loves to blame Hath found a single fault in you.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रप्र॑ वस्त्रि॒ष्टुभ॒मिषं॑ म॒न्दद्वी॑रा॒येन्द॑वे धि॒या वो॑ मे॒धसा॑तये॒ पुरं॒ध्या वि॑वासति
verses.transliteration: prá-pra vas triṣṭúbham íṣam  mandádvīrāyéndave  dhiyā́ vo medhásātaye  púraṃdhyā́ vivāsati

translation.text: I SEND you forth the song of praise for Indu, hero-gladdener. With hymn and plenty he invites you to complete the sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न॒दं व॒ ओद॑तीनां न॒दं योयु॑वतीनाम् पतिं॑ वो॒ अघ्न्या॑नां धेनू॒नामि॑षुध्यसि
verses.transliteration: nadáṃ va ódatīnāṃ  nadáṃ yóyuvatīnām  pátiṃ vo ághnyānāṃ  dhenūnā́m iṣudhyasi

translation.text: Thou wishest for thy kine a bull, for those who long for his approach, For those who turn away from him, lord of thy cows whom none may kill.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ता अ॑स्य॒ सूद॑दोहसः॒ सोमं॑ श्रीणन्ति॒ पृश्न॑यः जन्म॑न्दे॒वानां॒ विश॑स्त्रि॒ष्वा रो॑च॒ने दि॒वः
verses.transliteration: tā́ asya sū́dadohasaḥ  sómaṃ śrīṇanti pŕ̥śnayaḥ  jánman devā́nāṃ víśas  triṣv ā́ rocané diváḥ

translation.text: The dappled kine who stream with milk prepare his draught of Soma juice: Clans in the birth-place of the Gods, in the three luminous realms of heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भि प्र गोप॑तिं गि॒रेन्द्र॑मर्च॒ यथा॑ वि॒दे सू॒नुं स॒त्यस्य॒ सत्प॑तिम्
verses.transliteration: abhí prá gópatiṃ girā́-  índram arca yáthā vidé  sūnúṃ satyásya sátpatim

translation.text: Praise, even as he is known, with song Indra the guardian of the kine, The Son of Truth, Lord of the brave.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ हर॑यः ससृज्रि॒रेऽरु॑षी॒रधि॑ ब॒र्हिषि॑ यत्रा॒भि सं॒नवा॑महे
verses.transliteration: ā́ hárayaḥ sasr̥jrire-  -áruṣīr ádhi barhíṣi  yátrābhí saṃnávāmahe

translation.text: Hither his Bay Steeds have been sent, red Steeds are on the sacred grass Where we in concert sing our songs.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रा॑य॒ गाव॑ आ॒शिरं॑ दुदु॒ह्रे व॒ज्रिणे॒ मधु॑ यत्सी॑मुपह्व॒रे वि॒दत्
verses.transliteration: índrāya gā́va āśíraṃ  duduhré vajríṇe mádhu  yát sīm upahvaré vidát

translation.text: For Indra Thunder-armed the kine have yielded mingled milk and meath, What time he found them in the vault.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उद्यद्ब्र॒ध्नस्य॑ वि॒ष्टपं॑ गृ॒हमिन्द्र॑श्च॒ गन्व॑हि मध्वः॑ पी॒त्वा स॑चेवहि॒ त्रिः स॒प्त सख्युः॑ प॒दे
verses.transliteration: úd yád bradhnásya viṣṭápaṃ  gr̥hám índraś ca gánvahi  mádhvaḥ pītvā́ sacevahi  tríḥ saptá sákhyuḥ padé

translation.text: When I and Indra mount on high up to the Bright One’s place and home, We, having drunk of meath, will reach his seat whose Friends are three times seven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अर्च॑त॒ प्रार्च॑त॒ प्रिय॑मेधासो॒ अर्च॑त अर्च॑न्तु पुत्र॒का उ॒त पुरं॒ न धृ॒ष्ण्व॑र्चत
verses.transliteration: árcata prā́rcata  príyamedhāso árcata  árcantu putrakā́ utá  púraṃ ná dhr̥ṣṇv àrcata

translation.text: Sing, sing ye forth your songs of praise, ye Priyamedhas, sing your songs: Yea, let young children sing their lauds: as a strong castle praise ye him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अव॑ स्वराति॒ गर्ग॑रो गो॒धा परि॑ सनिष्वणत् पिङ्गा॒ परि॑ चनिष्कद॒दिन्द्रा॑य॒ ब्रह्मोद्य॑तम्
verses.transliteration: áva svarāti gárgaro  godhā́ pári saniṣvaṇat  píṅgā pári caniṣkadad  índrāya bráhmódyatam

translation.text: Now loudly let the viol sound, the lute send out its voice with might, Shrill be the music of the string. To Indra is the hymn upraised

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ यत्पत॑न्त्ये॒न्यः॑ सु॒दुघा॒ अन॑पस्फुरः अ॒प॒स्फुरं॑ गृभायत॒ सोम॒मिन्द्रा॑य॒ पात॑वे
verses.transliteration: ā́ yát pátanty enyàḥ  sudúghā ánapasphuraḥ  apasphúraṃ gr̥bhāyata  sómam índrāya pā́tave

translation.text: When hither speed the dappled cows, unflinching, easy to be milked, Seize quickly, as it bursts away, the Soma juice for Indra’s drink

verses.sanskrit_deva: अपा॒दिन्द्रो॒ अपा॑द॒ग्निर्विश्वे॑ दे॒वा अ॑मत्सत वरु॑ण॒ इदि॒ह क्ष॑य॒त्तमापो॑ अ॒भ्य॑नूषत व॒त्सं सं॒शिश्व॑रीरिव
verses.transliteration: ápād índro ápād agnír  víśve devā́ amatsata  váruṇa íd ihá kṣayat  tám ā́po abhy ànūṣata  vatsáṃ saṃśíśvarīr iva

translation.text: Indra hath drunk, Agni hath drunk: all Deities have drunk their fill. Here Varuṇa shall have his home, to whom the floods have sung aloud as mother-kine unto their calves.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒दे॒वो अ॑सि वरुण॒ यस्य॑ ते स॒प्त सिन्ध॑वः अ॒नु॒क्षर॑न्ति का॒कुदं॑ सू॒र्म्यं॑ सुषि॒रामि॑व
verses.transliteration: sudevó asi varuṇa  yásya te saptá síndhavaḥ  anukṣáranti kākúdaṃ  sūrmyàṃ suṣirā́m iva

translation.text: Thou, Varuṇa, to whom belong Seven Rivers, art a glorious God. The waters flow into thy throat as 'twere a pipe with ample mouth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो व्यतीँ॒रफा॑णय॒त्सुयु॑क्ताँ॒ उप॑ दा॒शुषे॑ त॒क्वो ने॒ता तदिद्वपु॑रुप॒मा यो अमु॑च्यत
verses.transliteration: yó vyátīm̐r áphāṇayat  súyuktām̐ úpa dāśúṣe  takvó netā́ tád íd vápur  upamā́ yó ámucyata

translation.text: He who hath made the fleet steeds spring, well-harnessed, to the worshipper, He, the swift Guide, is that fair form that loosed the horses near at hand.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अतीदु॑ श॒क्र ओ॑हत॒ इन्द्रो॒ विश्वा॒ अति॒ द्विषः॑ भि॒नत्क॒नीन॑ ओद॒नं प॒च्यमा॑नं प॒रो गि॒रा
verses.transliteration: átī́d u śakrá ohate-  índro víśvā áti dvíṣaḥ  bhinát kanī́na odanám  pacyámānam paró girā́

translation.text: Indra, the very Mighty, holds his enemies in utter scorn. He, far away, and yet a child, cleft the cloud smitten by his voice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒र्भ॒को न कु॑मार॒कोऽधि॑ तिष्ठ॒न्नवं॒ रथ॑म् स प॑क्षन्महि॒षं मृ॒गं पि॒त्रे मा॒त्रे वि॑भु॒क्रतु॑म्
verses.transliteration: arbhakó ná kumārakó  -ádhi tiṣṭhan návaṃ rátham  sá pakṣan mahiṣám mr̥gám  pitré mātré vibhukrátum

translation.text: He, yet a boy exceeding small, mounted his newly-fashioned car. He for his Mother and his Sire cooked the wild mighty buffalo.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ तू सु॑शिप्र दम्पते॒ रथं॑ तिष्ठा हिर॒ण्यय॑म् अध॑ द्यु॒क्षं स॑चेवहि स॒हस्र॑पादमरु॒षं स्व॑स्ति॒गाम॑ने॒हस॑म्
verses.transliteration: ā́ tū́ suśipra dampate  ráthaṃ tiṣṭhā hiraṇyáyam  ádha dyukṣáṃ sacevahi  sahásrapādam aruṣáṃ  svastigā́m anehásam

translation.text: Lord of the home, fair-helmeted, ascend thy chariot wrought of gold. We will attend the Heavenly One, the thousand-footed, red of hue, matchless, who blesses where he goes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं घे॑मि॒त्था न॑म॒स्विन॒ उप॑ स्व॒राज॑मासते अर्थं॑ चिदस्य॒ सुधि॑तं॒ यदेत॑व आव॒र्तय॑न्ति दा॒वने॑
verses.transliteration: táṃ ghem itthā́ namasvínaḥ-  úpa svarā́jam āsate  árthaṃ cid asya súdhitaṃ yád étave-  āvartáyanti dāváne

translation.text: With reverence they come hitherward to him as to a Sovran Lord, That they may bring him near for this man’s good success, to prosper and bestow his gifts.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अनु॑ प्र॒त्नस्यौक॑सः प्रि॒यमे॑धास एषाम् पूर्वा॒मनु॒ प्रय॑तिं वृ॒क्तब॑र्हिषो हि॒तप्र॑यस आशत
verses.transliteration: ánu pratnásyaúkaso  priyámedhāsa eṣām  pū́rvām ánu práyatiṃ vr̥ktábarhiṣo  hitáprayasa āśata

translation.text: The Priyamedhas have observed the offering of the men of old, Of ancient custom, while they strewed the sacred grass, and spread their sacrificial food.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो राजा॑ चर्षणी॒नां याता॒ रथे॑भि॒रध्रि॑गुः विश्वा॑सां तरु॒ता पृत॑नानां॒ ज्येष्ठो॒ यो वृ॑त्र॒हा गृ॒णे
verses.transliteration: yó rā́jā carṣaṇīnā́ṃ  yā́tā ráthebhir ádhriguḥ  víśvāsāṃ tarutā́ pŕ̥tanānāṃ  jyéṣṭho yó vr̥trahā́ gr̥ṇé

translation.text: HE who, as Sovran Lord of men, moves with his chariots unrestrained, The Vr̥itra-slayer vanquisher, of fighting hosts, preeminent, is praised with song.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रं॒ तं शु॑म्भ पुरुहन्म॒न्नव॑से॒ यस्य॑ द्वि॒ता वि॑ध॒र्तरि॑ हस्ता॑य॒ वज्रः॒ प्रति॑ धायि दर्श॒तो म॒हो दि॒वे न सूर्यः॑
verses.transliteration: índraṃ táṃ śumbha puruhanmann ávase  yásya dvitā́ vidhartári  hástāya vájraḥ práti dhāyi darśató  mahó divé ná sū́ryaḥ

translation.text: Honour that Indra, Puruhanman! for his aid, in whose sustaining hand of old, The splendid bolt of thunder was deposited, as the great Sun was set in heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नकि॒ष्टं कर्म॑णा नश॒द्यश्च॒कार॑ स॒दावृ॑धम् इन्द्रं॒ न य॒ज्ञैर्वि॒श्वगू॑र्त॒मृभ्व॑स॒मधृ॑ष्टं धृ॒ष्ण्वो॑जसम्
verses.transliteration: nákiṣ ṭáṃ kármaṇā naśat-  yáś cakā́ra sadā́vr̥dham  índraṃ ná yajñaír viśvágūrtam ŕ̥bhvasam  ádhr̥ṣṭaṃ dhr̥ṣṇvòjasam

translation.text: No one by deed attains to him who works and strengthens evermore: No, not by sacrifice, to Indra. praised o all, resistless, daring, bold in might.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अषा॑ळ्हमु॒ग्रं पृत॑नासु सास॒हिं यस्मि॑न्म॒हीरु॑रु॒ज्रयः॑ सं धे॒नवो॒ जाय॑माने अनोनवु॒र्द्यावः॒ क्षामो॑ अनोनवुः
verses.transliteration: áṣāḷham ugrám pŕ̥tanāsu sāsahíṃ  yásmin mahī́r urujráyaḥ  sáṃ dhenávo jā́yamāne anonavur  dyā́vaḥ kṣā́mo anonavuḥ

translation.text: The potent Conqueror, invincible in war, him at whose birth the Mighty Ones, The Kine who spread aftar, sent their loud voices out, heavens, earths seat their loud voices out,

verses.sanskrit_deva: यद्द्याव॑ इन्द्र ते श॒तं श॒तं भूमी॑रु॒त स्युः न त्वा॑ वज्रिन्त्स॒हस्रं॒ सूर्या॒ अनु॒ न जा॒तम॑ष्ट॒ रोद॑सी
verses.transliteration: yád dyā́va indra te śatáṃ  śatám bhū́mīr utá syúḥ  ná tvā vajrin sahásraṃ sū́ryā ánu  ná jātám aṣṭa ródasī

translation.text: O Indra, if a hundred heavens and if a hundred earths were thine- No, not a thousand Suns could match thee at thy birth, not both the worlds, O Thunderer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ प॑प्राथ महि॒ना वृष्ण्या॑ वृष॒न्विश्वा॑ शविष्ठ॒ शव॑सा अ॒स्माँ अ॑व मघव॒न्गोम॑ति व्र॒जे वज्रि॑ञ्चि॒त्राभि॑रू॒तिभिः॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ paprātha mahinā́ vŕ̥ṣṇyā vr̥ṣan  víśvā śaviṣṭha śávasā  asmā́m̐ ava maghavan gómati vrajé  vájriñ citrā́bhir ūtíbhiḥ

translation.text: Thou, Hero, hast performed thy hero deeds with might, yea, all with strength, O Strongest One. Maghavan, help us to a stable full of kine, O Thunderer, with wondrous aids.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न सी॒मदे॑व आप॒दिषं॑ दीर्घायो॒ मर्त्यः॑ एत॑ग्वा चि॒द्य एत॑शा यु॒योज॑ते॒ हरी॒ इन्द्रो॑ यु॒योज॑ते
verses.transliteration: ná sīm ádeva āpad  íṣaṃ dīrghāyo mártyaḥ  étagvā cid yá étaśā yuyójate  hárī índro yuyójate

translation.text: Let not a godless mortal gain this food, O thou whose life is long! But one who yokes the bright-hued steeds, the Etaṣas, even Indra yoker of the Bays.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं वो॑ म॒हो म॒हाय्य॒मिन्द्रं॑ दा॒नाय॑ स॒क्षणि॑म् यो गा॒धेषु॒ य आर॑णेषु॒ हव्यो॒ वाजे॒ष्वस्ति॒ हव्यः॑
verses.transliteration: táṃ vo mahó mahā́yyam  índraṃ dānā́ya sakṣáṇim  yó gādhéṣu yá ā́raṇeṣu hávyo  vā́jeṣv ásti hávyaḥ

translation.text: Urge ye the Conqueror to give, your Indra greatly to be praised, To be invoked in shallow waters and in depths, to be invoked in deeds of might.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उदू॒ षु णो॑ वसो म॒हे मृ॒शस्व॑ शूर॒ राध॑से उदू॒ षु म॒ह्यै म॑घवन्म॒घत्त॑य॒ उदि॑न्द्र॒ श्रव॑से म॒हे
verses.transliteration: úd ū ṣú ṇo vaso mahé  mr̥śásva śūra rā́dhase  úd ū ṣú mahyaí maghavan magháttaye-  úd indra śrávase mahé

translation.text: O Vasu, O thou Hero, raise us up to ample opulence. Raise us to gain of mighty wealth, O Maghavan, O Indra, to sublime renown.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं न॑ इन्द्र ऋत॒युस्त्वा॒निदो॒ नि तृ॑म्पसि मध्ये॑ वसिष्व तुविनृम्णो॒र्वोर्नि दा॒सं शि॑श्नथो॒ हथैः॑
verses.transliteration: tváṃ na indra r̥tayús  tvānído ní tr̥mpasi  mádhye vasiṣva tuvinr̥mṇorvór  ní dāsáṃ śiśnatho háthaiḥ

translation.text: Indra, thou justifiest us, and tramplest down thy slanderers. Guard thyself, valiant Hero, in thy vital parts: strike down the Dâsa with thy blows.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒न्यव्र॑त॒ममा॑नुष॒मय॑ज्वान॒मदे॑वयुम् अव॒ स्वः सखा॑ दुधुवीत॒ पर्व॑तः सु॒घ्नाय॒ दस्युं॒ पर्व॑तः
verses.transliteration: anyávratam ámānuṣam  áyajvānam ádevayum  áva sváḥ sákhā dudhuvīta párvataḥ  sughnā́ya dásyum párvataḥ

translation.text: The man who brings no sacrifice, inhuman, godless, infidel, Him let his friend the mountain cast to rapid death, the mountain cast the Dasyu down.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं न॑ इन्द्रासां॒ हस्ते॑ शविष्ठ दा॒वने॑ धा॒नानां॒ न सं गृ॑भायास्म॒युर्द्विः सं गृ॑भायास्म॒युः
verses.transliteration: tváṃ na indrāsāṃ  háste śaviṣṭha dāváne  dhānā́nāṃ ná sáṃ gr̥bhāyāsmayúr  dvíḥ sáṃ gr̥bhāyāsmayúḥ

translation.text: O Mightiest Indra, loving us, gather thou up, as grains of corn Within thine hand, of these their kine, to give away, yea, gather twice as loving us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सखा॑यः॒ क्रतु॑मिच्छत क॒था रा॑धाम श॒रस्य॑ उप॑स्तुतिं भो॒जः सू॒रिर्यो अह्र॑यः
verses.transliteration: sákhāyaḥ krátum ichata  kathā́ rādhāma śarásya úpastutim  bhojáḥ sūrír yó áhrayaḥ
